El señor Luis como pertenece a una familia del campo también se dedica a la agricultura (plantaciones de mandioca, maíz, maní, y hortalizas)y la ganadería (criá de vacas lecheras y para engorde).

El desea aumentar los artículos de su despensa ya que deja buena ganancia. 

Solicita el préstamo para compra de azúcar, arroz, harina, lácteos, panificados ya que su meta es seguir trabajando crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is from the Santani district. He's married and owns a well-stocked business offering a good selection with all the typical items sold in a basic grocery store. He has a steady clientele that provides a good monthly income that helps him support his family to keep on living a dignified life. Luis comes from a family from the countryside and also is a farmer. He plants manioc, corn, peanuts and vegetables and he also raises livestock such as milk bearing cows and cows for fattening. He would like to increase the selection he offers at his store because the earnings are good and also his wife and children are able to tend the shop. He is requesting the loan to buy sugar, rice, flour, dairy products and baked goods because his goal is to keep growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel Perez-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, baked goods and dairy products

loans.name: Yoharis

texts.es:
Para Yoharys M. C., la miscelánea refresquería que  le cedió  su suegra  hace 3 años, fue una gran oportunidad para dedicarse más a su familia,  dejar de trabajar en el servicio domestico y obtener un buen ingreso en casa. Ella además de vender mercancías como cosméticos, variedades, vestidos juguetes etc., tiene una venta de bebidas frías para refrescar a todo los que habitan o pasan por su negocio. 
Yoharis es una mujer casada y tiene un niño de 7 años, vive en Villas de San Carlos, un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla; conoció de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por una amiga  que la recomendó  vincularse al conocerla como buena comerciante y muy seria,  ahora solicita un crédito por valor de $ 1.000.000 para comprar un enfriador e invertir en mercancías como colonias sandalias y suéteres que tiene encargados.
Su gran sueño es tener su casa propia donde poder adecuar su negocio , para generar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así mismo su  gran desafío es  interactuar con una resistente  competencia sectorial , que  la  tiene constantemente creando  nuevas estrategias para sostener su mercado y rescatar clientes para aumentar su nivel de ingresos. 
Yoharis  esta rodeada de buenos vecinos, muy solidarios y constantemente realizan actividades conjuntas para apoyar la pavimentación de sus calles y aumentar el acceso de vehículos y personas que representan sus clientes potenciales
texts.en:
For Yoharys M. C., the soft drink business that her mother-in-law gave to her three years ago was a great opportunity for her to dedicate herself to her family, to quit her job as a domestic servant and earn a good income at home. In addition to selling merchandise such as cosmetics, a variety of products, dresses, toys, etc., she also has the business selling cold drinks to refresh everyone who lives in and passes through her neighborhood. Yoharis is married and has a 7 year-old son. She lives in Villas de San Carlos, a neighborhood located in southwest Barranquilla. She learned about the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo from a friend who recommended she get involved after learning she was a good and serious business owner. She is requesting a loan in the amount of COP 1,000,000 to buy a refrigerator and merchandise such as sandals and sweaters that she has orders for. Her greatest dream is to have her own house where she can have her business so that she can provide better service to her customers. Her biggest challenge is dealing with strong competition in her area, which has her constantly coming up with new strategies for keeping her market and getting back customers so that she can increase her level of income. Yoharis is surrounded by good and collaborative neighbors who are always working together to get their streets paved and increase access to vehicles and people, who represent her potential customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and merchandise such as sandals and sweaters that she has orders for.

loans.name: Julia Umbelina

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Julia es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y gaseosa.
Los sueños de Julia son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y progresar mas.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Faith Community Bank. Julia is married, 44 years old and she has three children. She has a store at her house where she sells general grocery items. She does this job everyday with the help of her children. Julia needs a loan of 900 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of rice and sodas. Julia's dreams for the future include educating her children so that they will be professionals and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and soda

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es:
Cuando Libardo Antonio González llego de Sincelejo, capital del departamento de Sucre, al noroeste en la Costa Caribe colombiana, en su mente construyo el sueño de tener su propio negocio, que  5 años después se convirtió en una  venta de pollo asado, hamburguesas y perros calientes, del que ahora viven él y su familia, conformada por su esposa (a su lado en la fotografia) y sus tres hijos de 16 17 y 18 años, que también trabajan con él; este negocio Libardo  lo registró en la Cámara de Comercio, como “Comidas Rápidas el Chino y Ceci”, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el barrio Villanueva muy cerca al mercado de Barranquilla. Su actividad la desarrolla en dos lugares diferentes: todos los días tiene un puesto en el mercado de Barranquilla desde las 4:00 AM hasta las 8:00 AM y los fines de semanas  en la esquina de la cuadra donde vive;  Libardo esta aplicando a su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su anterior financiamiento pudo comprar herramientas de cocina y arreglar su vivienda; en la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar un par  de vitrinas, sillas y mesas e insumos como salsas y aderezos,  pues muchos de sus clientes cuando van a comprarle se quedan de pie y esto no hace que fluya su mercado.
Su sueño es terminar su casa y que sus 3 hijos terminen el bachillerato y continúen sus estudios universitarios, por eso su gran desafío es sacar adelante el negocio para poderlo hacer, ya que este constituye su único ingreso familiar; otro de sus desafíos es el transporte  pues vive en un lugar retirado  detrás del mercado de Barranquilla y espera que esta situación sea resuelta prontamente por el estado.
texts.en:
Ever since Libardo arrived in Sincelejo (the capital of the department of Sucre on the Colombian Carribean coast) he dreamed of having his own business. Five years later this dream has turned into a reality with his business of selling barbequed chicken, hamburgers and hot dogs. He lives with his wife (at his side in the photograph) and his three children ages 16,17 and 18. His family works with him. Libardos’s business is registered with the Commerce Department under the name “El Chino and Ceci Fast Food”. The business is located in the Villanueva community near the Barranquilla Market. His business activities happen in two places. Every day he has a booth in the Barranquilla Market from 4:00 AM until 8:00 AM. On the weekends he works on the corner of the street where he lives. Libardo is applying for his second loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Institution. With his last loan he was able to buy kitchen tools and fix his house. He is asking for a loan of $2,000,000 in order to buy a pair of cabinets, chairs, tables and ingredients such as salsas and seasonings. Many of his customers, when they come to buy his food, have to stand up to eat it. This influences his sales. His dreams are to finish his house. He wants his children to finish high school and continue studying in the university. To achieve these dreams he continues to grow his business. His business is the only family income. Another of his challenges is transportation as they live in a place that is a distance behind the Barranquilla Market. He hopes the state will provide better public transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pair of cabinets, chairs, tables and other ingredients such as salsas and seasonings.

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: Lesbia Del Socorro de 47 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, las cuales vende ciertos lugares en los que tiene suficiente clientes. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, desde muy joven se inicio en la venta de mercancía, como calzado y ropa femenina y gradualmente fue agregándole muchos productos, como adornos, cosméticos. La señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de mercadería en general. Ya que tiene variedad de pedidos. El sueño de Lesbia es continuar con este negocio activo.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 47 years old. She sells general merchandise. She sells this in certain places where there are enough customers. She has been doing this business for seven years. She started selling merchandise when she was young. First she sold shoes and women’s clothes. Gradually she expanded to more products such as adornments and cosmetics. She is asking for a new loan in order to purchase general merchandise as she has a variety of requests from her customers. Her dreams for the future are to continue with her active business

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Marina es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Marina vende quesos de manera ambulatoria en los mercados, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes. Además Marina se dedica a la siembra de papa que vende en la ciudad de Lima y Ayacucho.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Marina son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Faith Community Bank. She lives with a man, is 37 years old and has four children. She sells cheese as a roving salesperson in the market. She does this job every afternoon. She also grows potatoes that she sells in Lima and Ayacucho. Marina needs a loan of 600 soles, money that she will use to buy cheese. Marina future dreams include improving her business. She also hopes her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cheese.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana ,de 27 años, es viuda y tiene un hijo pequeño . Reside en una  comunidad de la selva ayacuchana, donde casa que es propia y esta echa  a base de madera.Ana quería estudiar la carrera de agronomía, pero debido al factor económico no pudo acabar sus estudios secundarios, y sus planes no se concretaron .Entendió que no podía exigirles  a sus padres, y asi empezó a trabajar como peona en la chacra de su vecino, todo el dinero ganado lo juntaba . En la actualidad tiene su propio terreno de cultivo, produce y comercializa cacao y café para ella no existe el  “no se puede” ; es por esta razón que ya tiene segmentado su nicho de mercado, generando un margen de rentabilidad aceptable a su corta edad .Su éxito radica en que se dirige temprano a su chacra, para brindarle el cuidado respectivo, por lo general trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 5:30 am hasta las 6:00 pm , y normalmente sus productos los vende a los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Es por eso que para el  futuro tiene planeado  instalar  una tienda de abarrotes para  diversificar su mercado.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está de acuerdo por las buenas decisiones que toma su banco comunal.Ana tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en abonos e insumos, con la finalidad de mejorar sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Ana, 27 years old, is a widow and has a young child. She lives in the jungle of Ayacucho, where she has her own house made of wood. Ana had wanted to study agronomy, but due to her economic situation, she couldn’t finish her secondary studies, and her plans never worked out. She understood that she could not depend on her parents, so she began work as a laborer on her neighbor’s farm. All the money that she earned, she saved up. Now she has her own land to cultivate, produce and sell cacao and coffee. “It’s not possible” does not exist for her. For this reason, she has already found her niche in the market, generating quite a degree of success for her young age. Her success is due to her early mornings at her farm, to give it needed attention. In general, she works Monday through Saturday, from 5:30am until 6:00pm. Normally, her products are sold at centers in her community. In the future, she plans to put in a grocery store to diversify her market. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to complete the payments punctually. Also, she is happy with the good decisions that her communal bank makes. Ana plans to invest this money in fertilizers and other consumables, with the goal of improving her cacao and coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Maria es casada, tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende comida en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Maria son educar a su hijo y nieto, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Faith Community Bank. She is married, 53 years old and has two children. Maria sells food in the doorway of her house. She does this every day. Also she sells clothes at various markets in the region. Maria needs a loan of 1800 soles, money that she will use to buy clothes. Maria dreams include providing an education for her son and grandchild. She also dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Leidi Ester

texts.es:
Leidi Ester U. C. vive en el barrio Santuario de la ciudad de Barranquilla, tiene una  hija de 17 años de edad y  se dedica a la confección de ropa femenina, trabaja medio tiempo  como empleada  de  una confección donde le prestan una  maquina plana ,para que trabaje en su propio negocio la otra parte del tiempo. Aun así ella quiere lograr mayor  independencia,  por eso solicita un crédito  por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar la suya propia y mejorar la calidad de la puntada, porque cuando trabaja en su casa lo hace con una de pedal, "la negrita zz". 	
Leidi hace de todo un poco, es decir maneja  la confección  en línea femenina, infantil y masculina, pero también vende mercancías como cobijas, maletines, termos, maquinas de repostería, abanicos y perfumes y así mismo elabora pasteles los fines de semana y en fechas especiales, porque ha hecho muchos cursos de culinaria y repostería. Su esposo es pensionado de la policía y  su hija ya esta tecnificándose en mercadeo y ventas con el SENA y además aprende inglés en una academia; sus principales clientes son su familia, amistades y sobre todos los oficiales de la policía, antiguos compañeros de trabajo de su esposo; aunque ella  tiene mas de 9 años  de tener negocios, desde que hizo los curso y empezó a explotar lo que aprendió, este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está solicitandole a esta organizaciòn su financiamiento,  por recomendación de muchas personas que han recibido sus beneficios, espera que su crédito le ayude a aumentar su capital y a poder realizar entregas mas oportunas.
Su sueño mas adelante es tener un carro y que su hija llegue a la universidad, vive con su cónyuge en  el Santuario un popular y uno de los mas antiguos barrios de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ahí se siente satisfecha porque  tiene muchos servicios cercanos como el de seguridad policial, de salud y  está ubicada en dirección al Estadio Metropolitano donde comparten el buen futbol los equipos profesionales de Colombia y es la casa del Junior de Barranquilla.
texts.en:
Leidi Ester U. C. lives in the Santuario neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla; she has a 17 year old daughter. Leidi makes women's clothing and works part-time as an employee of a clothing factory where they lend her a sewing machine so she can work on her own business during her free time. Still she would like to become more independent which is why she is seeking a $1025 loan to buy her own machine and improve the quality of the stitching because when she works out of her home, she sews with a foot-pedal machine she calls, "the little black zz." Leidi does a little of everything--she makes clothes for men, women and children but she also sells such items as blankets, backpacks, thermoses, pastry appliances, fans, and perfumes; at the same time she makes pastries on the weekends and on holidays as she has taken a number of cooking and baking classes. Her husband is retired from the police department and her daughter is majoring in marketing and sales in the SENA while learning English in an academy. Leidi's primary customers are her family, her friends and police offers who were old colleagues of her husband. Though she has worked in this business for 9 years ever since she took her classes, this is her first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She was referred by a number of people who benefitted greatly from the foundation; she hopes that the loan will help her to increase her capital and to get better pricing on her shipments. Her dream is to someday have a car and that her daughter studies in the university. She lives with her husband in Santuario, an old and popular neighborhood of Barranquilla; she feels content because she has many services nearby such as the police and health clinics. She lives near the Metropolitan Stadium where the professional Colombian soccer teams play and near the home of Junior de Barranquilla.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and improve the quality of her stitching

loans.name: Allpaurccuna Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Allpaurccuna inicia su sexto ciclo con 16 socias que son D. la comunidad del mismo nombre que significa D. donD. se saca tierra en quechua, comunidad que se encuentra a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y pertenece al Distrito D. Pacaycasa.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es la venta D. cereales, frutas, cochinilla, tara, animales menores, abarrotes en general y la agricultura.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Isabel que es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, Isabel es casada, tiene 35 años y 6 hijos, Isabel junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta D. animales, los cuales son adquiridos en las ferias y pueblos y los comercializa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y Huanta, además tienen un carro con el cual realizan transporte D. pasajeros a distintas provincias. Isabel invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. animales. Los sueños D. Isabel son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, sean profesionales y mejorar sus negocios.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 10,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Allpaurccuna Village Bank is starting its 6th cycle with 16 members from the community of the same name which means "From where the earth comes" in Quechua. The community is located about 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho and is part of the Pacaycasa district. The group members work in various businesses such as the sale of cereals, fruit, pigs, tara (a local tree), small animals, groceries, and in agriculture. Isabel is the president of the bank, is 35 and married with 6 children. Isabel and her husband buy and sell animals which they buy in the markets of the villages and sell in the cities of Ayacucho and Huanta. They also have a car they use to proviD. transportation services to different provinces roundabout. She will invest her loan in the purchase of more animals. Her dream is for her children to finish their schooling, to become professionals in their careers and improve their businesses. The group members need different loan amounts such as $100, $200, and $300 for a total of $3600.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La señora Sandra Maria tiene 36 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación posee un pequeña tienda, madre de 2 hijos una niña de 6 años y un niño de 10 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la planta como albañil. Ella tiene 5 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a diferentes clientes pues estos recursos lo ha obtenido han sido por los financiamientos que han sido de gran ayuda. en la actualidad esta solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día en ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is 36 years old and sells clothing around her town and out of her home where she has a small store. She is the mother of two, a daughter who is 6 and a son who is 10. Her husband works as a construction worker. For the past 5 years she has worked in clothing sales and she sells her products to many different customers. She obtained the resources to start her business through loans which have helped her substantially. She is seeking a loan to buy raw materials. Her desire is to improve every day in selling her products.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha ,D. 43 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Vive en la localidad D. Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donD. tiene su casa que es propia.Antes D. iniciarse  en la actividad agrícola, sus padres eran agricultores y  ella aportaba y a cambio percibía sus primeros sueldos. Se sentía emocionada y  con ganas D. trabajar , tanto le gustó y sin pensarlo siguió el mismo camino. Pero, después D. un tiempo ,cultivó un producto que le generó bastante ganancia en corto tiempo. Es por esta razón  que se dedicó al cultivo D. la hoja D. coca. Su estrategia D. éxito es que labora en su chacra desD. las 5:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm , y sus productos los lleva a su localidad, para venderlos  en los grandes centros D. acopio. Normalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda D. sus hijos, y juntos hacen buen equipo. En un tiempo cercano piensa diversificar sus productos, cultivando cacao y café.Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus  pagos, además tiene mucha fe D. que  llegará lejos con su grupo comunal , por la responsabilidad que tiene cada uno D. los integrantes.Bertha  invertirá una parte del dinero solicitado en lo gastos escolares D. sus hijos y el resto lo  destinará para comprar abono , con el propósito D. mejorar la producción D. sus plantaciones D. hoja D. coca.
texts.en:
Bertha is 43 years old, married with 8 children. She lives in her own home in Santa Rosa which is located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle. Like her parents before her, she is involved in agriculture which is how she received her first wages. She was happy to work and enjoyed what she was doing. Without giving it a second thought, she followed in her parent’s path. After a while, she started to grow a product that generated significant income in a short time. For this reason, she dedicated herself to growing coca leaves. Her strategy is to work in her fields from 5:00am until 6:00pm. She sells her produce locally to middlemen. Normally she works alone, but occasionally she receives help from her children and together they make a great team. In the near future, she is thinking of diversifying her crops and cultivating both cocoa and coffee. This is her third credit with MFP and she promises to complete her repayment plan punctually. She has great faith that she will go far with her communal group as each member is very responsible. Bertha will use part of her loan to pay for her children’s school expenses. The rest will be used to buy fertilizer in the hopes of improving her production of coca leaves.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina tiene  65 años de edad. La señora se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de cosméticos, Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 4 años ya que tenía que mantener a sus 4 hijos que estaban a su cargo, que actualmente no dependen de ella, con el tiempo su trabajo le gusto y decidió seguir con este negocio. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de productos, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande ubicada en el nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Orbelina is 65 years old and dedicates herself to buying and selling cosmetics. She started this business 4 years ago, as she needed to support her 4 children who depended on her. Although they are now living on their own, she liked her work and decided to continue with it. She is requesting a loan with Fundación León 2000 to invest in the purchase of products, since she currently has many orders. Her dream has always been to manage to have a large store located in the new market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es: Julia Narda tiene la edad de 60 años. Ella se dedica a vender cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella dio inicio con esfuerzos propios inicio con ciertos productos que le fueron otorgados con muy pocos productos, pues siempre le ha gustado interactuar con sus clientes. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. siempre sueña con tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Julia Narda is 60 years old and dedicates herself to selling cosmetics. She has been in this line of business for more than 11 years, because she has always liked to work. She launched her business through her own efforts, with just a few products that were granted to her. She has always enjoyed interacting with her customers. She is requesting this loan to use as working capital, so she can buy additional materials. She has always dreamed of having her own store location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nassibatu

texts.en: Nassibatu J. trades in local gara dye textile materials. She is hardworking and business minded, and has six years experience in the business.   Nassibatu is married to a local carpenter and has four children, all school going. She spends her entire time in business and needs a loan to buy brillion (a textile), ink and dye for processing. She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children and open a bank account to save towards buying a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy materials for making and dying textiles

loans.name: Gerber

texts.es: Gerber tiene 30 años D. edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Vive en L. comunidad D. Palestina Alta, ubicada en L. hermosa selva cuzqueña, donD. tienen su techo propio. Hace dos décadas, se vivo una etapa D. crisis social y económica, en nuestro país, por lo que Gerber se vio perjudicado, percibiendo poco ingreso por las ventas D. su producto. Hoy su producto D. cacao lo venD. a los grandes mayoristas D. su misma localidad y a un precio competitivo, eso ha favorecido mucho sus ingresos, que va en aumento y esto es gracias a su perseverancia y tenacidad. Además se dedica a educar a sus hijos, para que mas adelante sigan sus pasos e implanten nuevos mecanismos en el trabajo. Generalmente, son sus peones que realizan el trabajo en el campo, pero D. vez en cuando tiene el apoyo D. su familia. Su mayor anhelo es abrir un ferretería bien equipada, ya que en su comunidad existen pocas ferreterías, para que así capte nuevos clientes potenciales. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente a gusto trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en L. compra D. fertilizantes y abono para darle un tratamiento a sus plantaciones D. cacao.
texts.en:
Gerber is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He lives in a community called Palestina Alta, located in the beautiful jungles of Cusco, and where he has his own home. Two decades ago, our country experienced a period of social and economic crisis that affected Gerber and led to little income from the sale of his product. Today, he sells his cacao to the major wholesalers of his locality at competitive prices. This has greatly helped his income, which continues to increase thanks to his perseverance and tenacity. He is also dedicated to his children’s education, hoping they will follow in his footsteps and bring new methods and technologies to their line of work. For the most part, he uses farm laborers to work his land, but he also sometimes has the help of his family. His greatest dream is to open a well-stocked hardware store. There are few in his area, and he sees an opportunity to capture new potential customers. This is his third loan with MFP, and he commits to fulfilling his payment obligations. In addition, he enjoys working as part of a cooperative group. He will use the loan to invest in fertilizers to treat his cacao crop.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his cacao crops.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria De La Concepción se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella se hace cargo de sus 2 hijos que todavía están menores de edad y dependen de ella. Algo que ha influido, en el manejo de su crédito, es la buena administración y el buen uso de los recursos. Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y disfruta de seguir adelante sus recursos. Pues siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. El sueño de Ella es tener  un pequeño negocio formal en el mercado. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria De La Concepción dedicates herself to selling general merchandise. She has her 2 children in her care who are still minors and dependent on her. Something that has influenced her, in managing her credit, is administering the funds properly and using her resources well. Maria is hard-working woman who enjoys continuing to forge ahead. She is always seeking out new ways to improve her income. Her dream is to establish a small formal business at the market. She requests this loan in order to buy the supplies necessary for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Abu White

texts.en: Abu White is a trader who owns a drugs store along St. Francis Road, Makeni. He has a small and well-organised drug store. He is married to a nurse and has seven dependents. Abu is hardworking and determined to do business. He has 14 years experience and spends his entire time doing business. He needs a loan to buy more drugs for his store. He hopes to use the proceeds of his loan to educate his children and buy a vehicle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio , de 42 años , convive con su pareja , y tienen un hijo  Samuel (9) .Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.Ante las adversidades siempre siguió adelante y su meta era tener su propio negocio con el tiempo. Luego empezó a producir cacao en una pequeña parcela, y todo lo que cosechaba lo vendía a los  minoristas, pero él no se sentía a gusto , porque pagaban poco y existía un compromiso por largo tiempo. En la actualidad produce y comercializa cacao, café y hoja de coca, y reconoce que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, además sus ventas han crecido de manera constante. Por lo general sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad y cuenta con la ayuda  de sus  peones que le facilitan la extracción de sus productos agrícolas. Sus aspiraciones futuras son ambiciosas, a tal punto que quiere  ampliar su terreno de cultivo, en otras localidades, con la finalidad de captar nuevos clientes .Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y  agradece a la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que brindan, es mas asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago. Además le va muy bien con  su banco comunal, ya que existe un clima cordial entre todos los integrantes. Claudio tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en pagar su terreno que adquirió en la ciudad ,con el propósito de construir su casa, y brindarle educación superior a su hijo.
texts.en:
Claudio, 42 years of age, lives with his partner and together they have a son, Samuel (9). They live in the Santa Rosa community, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house. Before adversity hit, he always forged ahead and his goal was to establish his own business over time. Later, he started to produce cacao on a small parcel of land and sold everything he harvested to retailers. Despite this, however, he did not feel content because they paid little and required a long-term commitment. Currently, he produces cacao, coffee and coca leaves, and he acknowledges that he has a large customer base. In addition, his sales have grown in a consistent manner. He generally sells his merchandise in the areas near where he lives, and counts on the help of his laborers to help him with his agricultural endeavors. His future aspirations are ambitious, to the point where he would like to expand his harvest lands into other localities in order to capture new customers. This is his second loan with MFP, and he thanks the institution for the access to credit that they facilitate and commits to fulfilling his payment obligations. In addition, things are going very well for him with his cooperative bank as there is a cordial atmosphere among all the members. Claudio plans to invest the requested funds to pay for land he acquired in the city. His goals are to build a house and to provide a superior education for his son.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for land where he will build a house.

loans.name: Sofia Mercedes

texts.es: Sofía Mercedes tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Tiene la actividad económica de alquiler de sillas. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Pues anteriormente tenía un trabajo muy estable pero no ganaba lo suficiente. Fue por esto que decide establecer este negocio de alquiler de sillas, inicio solamente con muy pocas sillas, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos fue incrementando sus productos. Por lo que el financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. El sueño que tiene es seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Sofía Mercedes has been working with Fundación for a long time. Her economic activity is renting chairs. She has been in this business for more than 8 years. Previously, she had a very stable job but didn't earn enough. That is why she decided to start this business of renting chairs. She started with only a few chairs, but with the help of the loans, she increased her products. The loan is to buy raw materials. Her dream is to continue with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julio Hermes

texts.es: El prestatario se dedica desde hace 8 años en brindar transporte a escolares y servicio de taxi; la movilidad que utiliza es alquilada con placa BF-2838 de propiedad del Señor Tasayco Saravia Hector.Es soltero, vive en casa familiar junto a su madre y dos sobrinos.No cuenta con experiencia crediticia ni comerciales. Requiere prestamo para invertir en un negocio y necesidad personal.
texts.en:
The borrower has worked for eight years providing school transportation and taxi service. The vehicle he uses is rented with plate BF-2838, and it belongs to Mr. Tasayco Saravia Hector. He is single, and he lives in the family house with his mother and two nephews. He does not have loan or commercial experience. He needs the loan to invest in his business and for personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal needs and invest in his business

loans.name: Bou Ndiaye

texts.fr: Bou Ndiaye S. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA depuis le 08 avril 2008. Elle est vendeuse de poisson frais, son lieu d'approvisionnement est Mboro un village de pêcheurs situé à une trentaine de kilomètre de chez elle. Avec son nouveau prêt elle pourra s'approvisionner en grande quantité en poisson pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle locale. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Bou Ndiaye S. is 36 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 8 April 2008. She sells fresh fish, and she gets her supplies from Mboro, a fishing village located 30 kilometers from where she lives. Her new loan will enable her to bring in a large supply of fish to satisfy her local customers. Her objective is to assist her husband with the various family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her business selling fresh fish

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es: El prestatario tiene 42 años, vive en San Joaquin en la casa de su suegra. Es separada vive con sus tres hijos dos de los cuales son mayores de edad; el padre los apoya con una pension para los estudios de la hija menor de 4 años de edad, posee una mototaxi la cual uno de sus hijos la maneja y una bodega pequeña que la atiende junto con su hija mayor que es soltera. El destino del credito es para capital de trabajo por que desea invertir en venta de abarrotes e implementar su bodega.
texts.en:
The borrower is 42 years old, and she lives in San Joaquin in her mother-in-law’s house. She is separated, and she lives with her three children. Two of them are grown. The father supports them with money for the youngest daughter’s education. She is four years old. She has a mototaxi (three wheeled motorized vehicle), which one of her sons drives. She also has a small grocery store, which she tends together with her older daughter who is single. The loan is for working capital, which she wants to invest in grocery sales and to stock her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital - invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Depuis le 10 février 2005 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA d'où elle a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique à domicile où elle vend divers produits tels du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre, du lait concentré etc. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer davantage sa boutique en marchandises et faire des bénéfices plus importants pour participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Awa S. is 50 years old, married and the mother of four children, all under her care. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 10 February 2005. She has already been granted 10 loans, always well managed and reimbursed on time. She runs a home business where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, condensed milk, etc. Her loan will enable her to boost her supply of merchandise, generate more revenue and participate in managing family expenditures.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba S. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Depuis le 02 avril 2007 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA et y a reçu 06 prêts qu'elle rembourse toujours sans problème. Elle est vendeuse de poissons séchés. Elle achète son produit en grande quantité et revend au détail dans son quartier en faisant du porte à porte. Son prêt actuel l'aidera à renforcer et développer son activité de commerce pour gagner plus profits et subvenir à ses besoins personnels et à soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Daba S. is 51 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 2 April 2007, where she has been granted six previous loans, always repaid without any problems. She sells dried fish. She buys her product wholesale and retails it by going door-to-door in her village. Her current loan will enable her to strengthen and develop her commercial activity and generate more income, to meet her own personal needs and assist her husband in dealing with family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better develop her activity selling dried fish

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren J., 71, is a widow and lives with her 16-year-old grandson in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her grandson live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). Her grandson is a secondary school student. Davaasuren operates a kiosk near an apartment building. She sells small food products and some consumer products in it. Davaasuren has been operating her business since 2000, and has gained much experience in the previous 10 years. Her working capital is 200,000 MNT. She receives a 100,000 MNT loan every year from our bank. Davaasuren has a very good personality. She is requesting a 100,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: Mrs. Mat F., a 24-year-old homemaker, has two children who attend the local public school. Mat F. relies on the income from her husband’s job as a merchandise trader. Her husband appears in the photo here. He buys many products in bulk from his wholesale suppliers and retails them, around the provinces of Cambodia, from which he gains profit. He needs capital to improve his current business. This is why Mat F. is applying for a $300 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To improve the business.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. a 20 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant. Depuis le 02 avril 2007 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA. Elle fait de la restauration depuis qu'elle a commencé à contracter un crédit. Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte augmenter sa capacité de production en achetant beaucoup plus de riz et d'huile végétale et d'autres condiments de cuisine. Son objectif est de pendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de soutenir ses parents pour leur en charge.
texts.en:
Khady D. is 20 years old, unmarried without children. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 2 April 2007. She has been in the restaurant business since she was granted her first loan. This new loan will enable her to increase her production capacity by buying much more rice, vegetable oil, and other cooking condiments. Her objective is to manage her own personal needs and to support her parents who are still caring for her.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Galsandorj

texts.en: Galsandorj M., 47, is married and the father of three children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). Two of his children attend a local secondary school. Galsandorj operates a vegetable planting business in his town. He has been operating his business since 2002, and has become an experienced planter over the past eight years. As it is a seasonal business, he also operates a block manufacturing business during the summer months. In addition to these businesses, Galsandorj also works as a custodian in a local kindergarten. He is a very hard working person and a great businessman, as well as a good father for his family. Galsandorj is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan for his vegetable planting business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriano A. is from the village of Yeban Norte. He is 51 years old, is married and has two adult children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Cipriano has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 60,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2008, Cipriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. As with his previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which he has successfully repaid, this new loan of 25,000 PHP will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the fifth loan he has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Marème F. est âgée de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle a 4 ans et demi d'expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficier à 9 fois de suite. Elle fait un commerce de tabac, et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de s'en approvisionner en grande quantité et étendre son marché dans les villages environnants. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par exemple par rapport à la nourriture, la santé et l'habillement.
texts.en:
Marème F. is 57 years old, married and mother to five children who are in her care. She has been borrowing money for four and a half years and has had nine consecutive loans. She has a business buying and selling tobacco, and her new loan will allow her to get a large quantity of supplies and expand her customer base in surrounding villages. She is contributing to the improvement of her family's living conditions, in terms of food, health and clothing for instance.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get sufficient supplies of tobacco

loans.name: Phenh

texts.en: Mrs. Phenh C., aged 31, lives in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. She is the mother of three children who attend the local public school. She owns a general store in the local village where she earns some money from selling groceries. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Sang, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her husband does not have enough construction supplies to use. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Phenh C. is seeking a loan to buy construction supplies. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Hà Nguyễn Thị is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 19 (19).

Hà is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan from SEDA of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the first loan she has taken out from SEDA. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Tư  is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

2.  Trương Thị H.  is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

4.  Nguyễn Thị X. is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.

5.  Trương Thị N. is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

6.  Trương Thị Dự  is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà Nguyễn Thị (20203050103) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 19 (19).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 11 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 6.800.000 VND.  Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Tư (20203050104) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh H.ng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


2.  Trương Thị H. (20203050105) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050106) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh H.ng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


4.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20203050107) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


5.  Trương Thị N. (20203050108) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


6.  Trương Thị Dự (20203050109) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Loep

texts.en: Mrs. Loep S., 32, owns a medium-sized restaurant including music, where she sells food, beef, wine, beer, and soft drink to people who come directly to eat at her restaurant. She also receives helps from her husband to conduct the business (he appears in the photo). Loep S. has newly started her business and she still needs some money to accumulate her business capital. She dreams of having many clients recognize the good service that she provides. That is why Loep S. is looking for a $1000 loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To accumulate the business capital.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van L., who lives in Ta Pech village in Kandal province, was born in 1967. She and her husband, Mr. Phat Phan, are farmers who own a one-hectare  plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they try to work hard they can earn little income because their rice field has infertile soil and it is far away from an irrigation system. So, to improve the rice production, Mrs. Van L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and the rest of the loan will go to rent a plow to plow her rice field. Through this activity, they support four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to rent a plow

loans.name: Sa Num

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Num K. is a villager in Samar village in Kandal province and she is 43 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Pheun Tonh, are farmers who own a 1.2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field has infertile soil. So, to improve the rice production, Mrs. Sa Num K. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to rent a plow machine to plow her field. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the other is studying in the local public school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rent a plow to plow her field

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Nụ Nguyễn Thị (20203050077) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nụ is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 14 (14).


Nụ is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Nụ owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business, making and selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Nụ has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $265 a month from these activities.


In 2009, Nụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which again will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị L. (0) is a 19-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


2.  Trương Thị T. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  Trương Thị S. (0) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


6.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nụ Nguyễn Thị (20203050077) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nụ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 14 (14).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nụ kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Nụ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nụ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị L. (0) là 19 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Trương Thị T. (0) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Hou

texts.en: Hou L. is a 41-year-old mother blessed with two teenage kids, one of whom works sewing clothes in industry, while the other one attends school. Hou L. was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were young. To pursue a daily income, Hou L. works as a requirement laborer. She is always hired by people to do things to help their needs. Hou L. and her employed child always find it hard traveling to work or anywhere else, because they don’t have their own vehicle. Thus, Hou L. has requested a loan to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: In Preaek Hang village in Kandal province lives a person named Mrs. Yen C.. She was born in 1958. She is a farm laborer and her husband, Mr, Chey Chhor is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support his family.  He is also a fisherman. This current year, her problem is that her husband’s fishing did not have enough fishing supplies. So, to improve his fishing, Mrs. Yen C. is requesting a loan to buy a boat and a motor. This couple supports five children, two of whom are farm laborers, while another one is a construction worker. The others are attending the local public school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a boat and a motor

loans.name: Srean

texts.en: Mrs. Srean C. is living in Kbal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province and she is 40 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Teng Ngorn Ngang, prepare and sell food in the local market to support their family. Since their business is going well, they want to expand. So, to improve their business, Mrs. Srean C. is seeking a loan to buy an oven and a refrigerator. She is the mother of four children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an oven, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị (20203050042) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a seven-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 2 - nhóm 08 (8).


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. operates a family member's business venture in the services sector providing cargo transport services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  She is now requesting a new L. of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides.  This will be her 2nd L. from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Cao Thị L. (20203050046) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20203050043) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Trương Thị M. (20203050044) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050049) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


5.  Trương Thị S. (20203050045) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


6.  Trương Thị L. (20203050096) is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand her services

loans.name: Sok Chea's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people who live in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. They will use tH. loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in tH. future. Mrs. Sok Chea R. is tH. group leader, selected by all tH. members who will use tH. loan for different purposes. SH. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Sok Chea R. is asking a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Voras Saren, is a construction worker. They did have a child but now they live in a two-member household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Raji's Group

texts.en:
Raji baji is a wife of L. A. and lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small two roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. 
She is a very caring lady. She has given birth to four children: two boys and two girls. None of the children are school-going age yet. But she wishes to send all of them to school so that they get an education and make their future bright. She stays at home, does household chores and cooks food for them. 
Her husband operates his own grocery shop in the community and generates an income for the family. He spends 10 hours in the shop. He opens his shop in the morning at 9 o’clock and closes at 7 o’clock in the evening. 
Raji is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he may purchas the groceries in bulk for his grocery shop and increase the income.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20203060001) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn nhóm 07 (7).


L. is married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, L. owns and operates a restaurant, serving breakfast foods to customers in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately $140 a month from these activities.


L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.    She is requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  This  will be her 1st loan from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Mỹ (0) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Trương Thị T. (0) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Mỹ (0) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Trương Thị T. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mr. S. is a hardworking man and a determined father who has five teenage children. S., 56, earns a living by buying and selling used goods. He also collects used goods from the customer’s houses and saves up many hundreds of kilograms of used goods to recycle. 

His wife stays at home and makes desserts to sell for additional income. In addition, three of his children are employed in different occupations. Mr. S. is taking out his loan to purchase a small piece of farmland, which he will rent to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a small piece of farmland.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok O. is a villager in Kamnab village in Kandal province and she is 31 years old. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that it is time to plant, but she does not have enough money to start this year's crop. So to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Sok O. is asking for a loan for her farm in order to increase the rice yield this current year. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Mech, is a construction worker. She is the mother of two children who are both too small to work or study. On the day of the loan disbursement, Mrs. Sok O. was busy working in the field, so her husband, Mr. Sambath Mech, received the loan for her. The photo above shows Mrs. Sok O.'s husband.

loans.use: To start a crop this year

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in the city of Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 15 years. She is a vigorous lady. She operates her own business sewing clothes. She sews clothes of her neighbors. She always keeps a smile on her face and she never gives up. 

Her husband, S. A., operates his own motor workshop in the market where he repairs vehicles such as motorbikes and cars. He has been in this profession for 25 years. He learned this work at the age of 17. 

Kalsoom is applying for a loan from Asasah, to purchase repairing tools for her husband so he can better perform his work and generate more income.

loans.use: Purchase repairing tools for repairing vehicles

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Y. has a small trade selling fresh fish at a busy local market, earning a suitable profit for her family. Her husband works in the construction sector. The couple helps each other to earn money to ensure that their three school-aged children have good educations. Srey Y. faces difficulty with traveling because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for commuting. Therefore, she decided to request a loan to add to her savings so she can buy an old motorcycle to provide transportation for the family. (Mrs. Srey Y. was busy at her business when the photo taken so her husband is shown instead.)

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Mrs. Eng El Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eight people who are villagers in Ta Pech village in Kandal province. Mrs. Eng E. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Khet M., are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Their problem is that it is time to start this year's crop but they do not have enough money to support the planting. So to improve their rice production, Mrs. Eng E. is seeking a loan to start farming to bring in a rice crop this current year. Through this activity, they support five children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To start a rice crop this year

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz F. is a wife of M. aslam and lives in the city named Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years. She is a very caring lady. She stays at home and does household chores. She is fond of cooking and prepares healthy food for her family. 

Her husband involves in a ice blocks selling business. He places the ice blocks in his four-wheeled cart. His business grows especially in the summer season because people approaches him for purchasing ice which they used to drink chilled water. 

Kaniz is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband's business. So he can purchase more ice and increases his income.

loans.use: Purchase ice blocks for selling

loans.name: Mr. Sa Chek Village Bank Group

texts.en: The eight people who comprise this village bank loan live in Ta Pech village in Kandal Province. Led by Mr. C., they will use the loan for a variety of purposes, their common goal being to improve their businesses.  S., a fisherman who earns money selling his catches, is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net. His wife, Mrs. La Choung, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to support the family. They have five children, four of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy a fish net

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up a village bank loan and they live in Thmei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Oeun Y. is tH. group leader, selected by all tH. members who will use their loans for different purposes.

SH. and her husband, Mr. Mul Samreth, are farmers who rent a small piece of land to cultivate rice for their own use to support their family. From this activity they support four children, three of whom are laborers, while tH. other is attending a local public school.

Although they all try to work hard, they earn little income. So to improve tH. living conditions of their family, Mrs. Oeun Y. is seeking a loan to buy some fish to resell as tH. start of a new business.

loans.use: To buy fish to resell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok T. began to sell food that she prepared at home when she was newly married. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are now married and living separately and one is single and works in a mobile phone company. In addition to her food sales, Sok T. sells some cooking ingredients from the store she built. She has a life partner in her husband who is a military policeman. Sok T. is requesting a loan so she can decorate her store and increase her inventory of groceries and other food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To decorate her store and increase her inventory

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy O. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. This group loan has four members who live in Boeng Leu-I village in Kandal province. Those members will use their loan for different purposes to improve their businesses the future.

Mrs. Channy O. is a tailor at her home and her husband, Mr. Thea Hoem, is a battery charger in his local village and he is a bread seller, too. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants it to expand. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Channy O. is asking for a loan to buy more bread to resell. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more bread

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a citizen of a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. Her husband's name is M.
