M. who is involved in an ice selling business. He sells ice in different shops and markets. He provides them with ice blocks two times per day and generates income for his family. He has been doing this work for the last six years. 

Naseem is a very caring lady. She stays at home and does household work. She is fond of cooking and cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. She is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he can purchase more ice blocks and increase the profit of his business.

loans.use: Purchase ice blocks to sell

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en:
Mrs. K. currently earns a daily income by purchasing and selling used goods. She and her husband always leave their house in the early morning to collect and buy used goods from people who live around the community. They also save up many hundreds of kilograms of goods before selling.

The couple are the good parents of two kids who are going to high school. K. has borrowed a loan in order to accrue financial capital for her used goods selling business.

loans.use: To accrue financial capital for used goods selling business.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Spean Daek village in Kandal province is the home of four people who make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Oun M. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will each use their loan for different purposes.

She owns a general store at her home and her husband, Mr. Phan Yous, is a fisherman. Now her problem is that her husband did not have enough fishing supplies to use. So to improve the living conditions of her family, Mrs. Oun M. is seeking a loan to buy a boat and fishing nets.

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other one is helping to sell groceries, and the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Elcedita

texts.en:
Elcedita L., from the village of Palutan, is a 39-year-old married mother of four school-aged children. To make a living, Elcedita plants and harvests corn for sale. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 50000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Elcedita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, she is requesting a new loan, her third, of 20000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Elcedita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en: Five people residing in Spean Daek village in Kandal Province comprise this group loan, led by Mrs. Tha K., and will use the loan for a variety of purposes. Although Tha, a lotus seller at her local market and her husband, Mr. Khloeng Chorn, a fisherman, try to work hard, their income is often insufficient to support their family living.  Therefore, to improve their living conditions, Tha is requesting a loan to fix her house. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To fix her house

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar is the wife of M. J. and they both live in a city named Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. They have a small house of two rooms and have lived in it for the past fifteen years. 

She is an active lady. She operates her own business sewing clothes. She receives orders from her neighbors and earns money from them. By seeing her gradually progressing, her relatives also started giving her orders. Now her eldest son also helps her sewing clothes. Naseem has purchased another sewing machine for him with her earnings.

Her husband works in a local factory for meager income. To support him financially, she and her son manage the financial expenses from their business sewing clothes.

Naseem is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase an electric sewing machine so she will be able to sew more clothes and increases her profit.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Renel

texts.en:
Renel S. is from the village of Palutan. He is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting corn for sale. Renel has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 55,000 PHP during harvest season.
In 2009, Renel joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Renel is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his third from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Pheang's Group

texts.en:
Six people make up this group loan and they all live in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. They will each use their loan for a different purpose in order to improve their family's living conditions.

Mrs. Pheang S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local marK.. Her husband, Mr. S. Sen, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to sell, in order to support his family. Her husband’s field is reading for growing, but they do not have enough money to support it. Therefore, in order to improve production, Mrs. Pheang S. is seeking a loan to buy bamboo to grow vegetables. She is a mother of a child who is a farmer, too.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to grow vegetables

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Mrs. T., 39, is a local crop farmer who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. In addition to her crops, she raises pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She has a life partner in her husband who is a requirement worker (casual laborer).

T. has two single kids who are employees at different companies, while another one is now married and lives independently. Mrs. T. will be using a Kiva loan to purchase a plot of another farmer’s farmland, in which she will plant various crops for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy local produce to resell.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Одинаев Шерали проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сма Шерали имеет высшее медицинское образование. Работает по профессии, стоматологом. Кроме того более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Sherali O. lives in the Vose region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has six children. His wife is a homemaker. Sherali has high medical education. He works as a dentist. He also does animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. He breeds cattle at home. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle to increase their headcount.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Operating  from a leased store on Campbell Street, a busy locale in Makeni, Isatu S. has sold assorted food items for the past four years. This well-organized lady is married to a trader and has four children.  She is now requesting a loan to buy provisions and confectionery, and hopes to use any additional profits to educate her children and buy a piece of land to build a dwelling in the future.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Yen Yan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 12 people who live in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yen Y. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Yen Y. owns a general store where she earns money from selling groceries. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Yen Y. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell. Her husband, Mr. Van Sek, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small amount of money to support his family. They support three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Koeb Im Roth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 15 people who are villagers in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Koeb Im R. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use their loans to improve their family's living conditions.
Mrs. Koeb Im R. is a mother of two children who attend the local public school. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, in order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables for resale. Her husband, Mr. Davin Sok, is an electrician who earns a small salary to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu S. sells dishes along one of the main business streets in Makeni. She started out selling foodstuffs but later moved over to dishes. She is married to a trader and has six children, all of whom attend school.  Abibatu has 15 years' experience in business and is requesting a loan to buy more dishes from Freetown. She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy dishes for resale

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: Sallay K. sells used clothing along Campbell Street. She is married to a trader and has eight dependants. She has 15 years' experience in business. She spends her entire time in business and is requesting a loan to buy additional used clothing.  She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate her children and construct a house.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Mr. Sophal Uy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 16 people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. They will all use their loans for different purposes in order to improve their businesses in the future. Mr. Sophal U. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. 

Mr. Sophal U. is a father of five children – one is a seamstress in a garment factory, three attend the local public school, and the other is two years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Sarey But, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their field is ready for growing. So to improve production, Mr. Sophal U. is seeking a loan to bU. bamboo to grow vegetables. 

All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is partially obscured.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to grow vegetables

loans.name: Mirzoodina

texts.ru: Сайфуллоев Мирзоодина проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Мирзоодина занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает духи. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 7 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mirzoodina S. lives in the Vose region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. Mirzoodina sells on the market. He sells mainly perfumes. He has been in this business for seven years already. He is taking out the loan to increase variety.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Phanna D., 25, and her husband, Mr. Mun Khoem, 30, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2004 and have a young son.
Phanna has been a silk weaver for eight years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a security guard for three months. Phanna is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mrs. Savy Khun  Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who make up a village bank loan group live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Mrs. Savy K. was selected by all the members as the village bank president. The members will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Savy K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Now her problem is that her field is ready to grow but she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve production, she is asking for a loan to grow bananas this year. Her husband, Mr. They Hun, is a construction worker. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To grow bananas

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: S., aged 25, is a garment worker who lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh. She is married to Thear, aged 25, who is a local farmer. He climbs palm trees (to tap juice etc.) as well as cultivating rice. They have one young child who is enrolled in school. The rice-growing season is coming and S.’ husband lacks some of the farming tools that could ease his hard labor on the farm. Therefore, S. is requesting a loan of $800 to help buy a couple of oxen for her husband, which he can use to plow the farmland. They will then buy fertilizer and seeds for growing. S. and her husband are shown in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy a couple of oxen

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Preak Svay village, in Kandal province, twelve people have formed a village bank loan group. The members have selected Mrs. Kim K. as the village bank president. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Kim K. sells fish and vegetables. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, she is seeking a loan to buy more fish and vegetables to resell. She is a widow, and supports four children by herself. Three of her children are attending a local public school, the fourth is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Lom

texts.en:
Mrs. Lom C. (shown in the photo), 49, is a widow with three children: one son and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home and the other two work in a garment factory. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Lom has been a silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Um-E-Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Um-e-Kalsoom is a citizen of a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living there with her family for over twenty-five years. 

She is a very talented and active lady. She operates a carpet weaving business. She does this work to manage the financial expenses of her home. Her work requires her full attention because when it sells they get the profit of almost $360 to $420, which is a big opportunity for them to save money for their rainy days. Her husband also helps her in this business, so both of them make the effort for the purpose of generating income. 

She is applying for a loan from Asasah so they can purchase items needed for the business (colored thread and tools) and increase their profits.

loans.use: Purchase items for carpet weaving business

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is the wife of A. K. and they reside in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She is a very active lady. She performs her household duties along with her clothes-sewing business very efficiently. 

She is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. They all are living with a dream; her daughter's dream is to be a doctor; the younger two want to be professors in renowned colleges. This thinking gives her motivation to grow her sewing business. 

Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. His shop is the busiest one in the community. People are used to coming to him for purchasing so he always needs of a good stock of groceries. Presently, his stock of groceries is insufficient to meet the requirements of his customers. 

Kalsoom is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase groceries in bulk so he may increase the profits of his shop as well as the number of customers.

Note: "In this picture she is showing herself with her sewing machine because she does this work to share the financial burden with her husband."

loans.use: Purchase stock for grocery store

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Phum M. is 45 years old and generates a daily income of $5 per day by selling fish. She is married to Yan, who is 33 years old and owns a trailer-motorbike taxi service. He also works in the construction field. He also earns approximately $5 each day to help manage the family's expenses. They have four children who go to the local public school. 

Phum M.’s husband has a problem: he can’t earn as much income as before since his taxi has broken often when providing transportation. To help solve the obstacle, Phum M. requests a loan to mend the broken taxi. Phum M.'s husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: To mend a broken taxi.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a very vigorous lady who lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been a part of this city for the last twenty-five years. 

She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of them support her in her carpet weaving business. They all complete a carpet in one and half months and then earn approximately $420 to $480 by selling it in the market. This amount helps them to improve the family's standard of living.
 
Naseem is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase the required items (such as threads and tools), so they can complete the carpet which they have started.

loans.use: Purchase required items for carpet weaving business

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Voeun U. (shown in the photo), 60, and her husband, Mr. Orm Oeun, 62, have been married since 1970 and have nine children: one son and eight daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home. They live across the Mekong River aboU. 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Voeun and her husband have been farming for ten years. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase a water pumping machine to water her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water her farm.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the wife of M. I. and they live in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. 
 
She is a caring mother as well as a caring wife. She stays at home and does household chores. She also cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. 

Her husband is involved in a cosmetics selling business. He purchases the cosmetics at wholesale prices and then sells them to the cosmetics shops. He has been in this business for over ten years.  

Razia is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase cosmetics in bulk and increase his profits.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
C., 25 years old, is a married mother who has been blessed with a small kid who is not yet enrolled in school. 

She rents a store in the busy local market where she sells used clothes to people who come to buy anything in the market. She generates a daily income of about $3.50 each day to manage her family's expenses, especially to support her child’s food needs. She has an assistant in her husband who helps her in selling clothes. 

C. will be using her first loan as capital for her used clothing business. She intends to use any remaining cash from the loan to invest in a fish-sale trade.

loans.use: To use as capital for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao M. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Norng Chea, were married in 2000 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and the other two are still too young for school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sreymao has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a fisherman for twenty years. 

Sreymao ask for a Kiva loan one time already. She now wants to finance a new business of raising pigs. She will be able to get extra income from selling pigs when they grow big enough. So, she is asking for her second loan of $400 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Душанова Муслима проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 30 лет. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается торговлей. В основном продает ткани. Муслима хочет расширить свой бизнес. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Muslima D. lives near Vose. She is 30 years old. Married with one child. She has finished secondary school. She has been in sales for over eight years. She mostly sells fabrics. Muslima would like to expand her business. She is taking out a loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun S. (shown in the photo), 52, and her husband, Mr. Nat Ou, 57, have been married since 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, and another one is a construction worker. They are living along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savoeun has been selling fruit for thirty years. Her husband has been a construction worker for twenty years. She hopes to create another new business raising pigs. She will be able to get extra income from selling pigs when they grow big enough. So, she is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: R. is 62 years old and married with two children, who are now married and working. They all live together in the family home. To make a living, R. built a small workshop from which she sells some foodstuffs, earning around $5 a day. She lives her husband who has a skill in building wooden houses. R. is requesting a loan to enlarge the current capital of her food business.

loans.use: To enlarge the current capital of her food business

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-ol L., 53, has been married to his new wife since 1998. He has five children – two sons and three daughters. Three of them married and live outside the family home and the other two are hairdressers. They live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sam-ol has been driving a motor taxi for 25 years. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk (auto-rickshaw), because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy a trailer. He also will use part of the loan to repair the wall of his house.
The couple are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to drive as a tuk tuk taxi

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Mrs. Pok O. is 63 years old and is a villager who lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming she also sells sugar palm, and makes a small income to support her family. For her sugar palm business, Mrs. Pok O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more sugar palm to expand her business activities. She is a widow with two children, one is a laborer while the other one is a famer and also helps with Mrs. Pok O.'s farming.

loans.use: To buy more sugar palm for resale

loans.name: Fayziddin

texts.ru: Наимов Файзиддин проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Файзиддин имеет высшее образование по специальности "Бухгалтер". Работает по профессии. Одновременно занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Fayziddin N. lives near Vose. He is 50 years old. He is married and has six children; his wife is a homemaker. Fayziddin has a college degree in accounting and works in his professional field. In addition, he raises livestock. He mainly raises cattle for resale. He has been doing this for four years already. He is taking out a loan in order to purchase large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: Mrs. Sophon P. is 43 years old and lives in Kor village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bunly Chea (pictured), are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sophon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Bunly Chea receives a small salary from construction work. This couple has four children; one is a silk weaver while the other three are students and also help their parents with farming.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Mrs. P., a 50-year-old homemaker, has two married children and one single child. She relies on farming rice when the farming season comes. She has another financial contributor in her husband, who climbs palm trees for juice to boil into sugar to sell. P. sometimes helps her husband to boil the palm juice. The family have a bicycle that they ride slowly to pick up sugar to take to the market. They hope to change it, and therefore P. is requesting a loan to put with her cash savings to buy a used motor, which she can use to deliver the sugar to market more quickly.

loans.use: To buy a used motor

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeung U. is 38 years old and lives in Kouk Doung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Mos Vith, is security guard and receives a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Thoeung U. now is requesting for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband. Mrs. Thoeung U. is a mother of five children who all are students also supports mother farming. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine V. is from the village of Barangay Salvacion, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Josephine is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. Josephine owns & operates a retail store that sells clothing & shoe products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Clothing and shoe store inventory

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is from the village of Catugan, Lallo, Cagayan. She is 26 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilyn is married and has 2 infant children. Marilyn owns & operates a piggery, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun V. is 52 years old and lives in Damnak Reachea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Kimly Ros, is construction worker. Mrs. Noeun V. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle for family transportation. This couple has three children: one is a car mechanic, one is a government worker, and the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of San Juan, Lallo, Cagayan. She is 39 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has 6 school-aged children. She owns and operates a fruit tree farm. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Gloria is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mr. Mai R. and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Tun, have been married since 1985. They have five children – three sons and two daughters. One of them is married, one is a construction worker, two attend school and the other is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mai was not available when the photograph was taken so his wife is shown instead.
Mai has been a construction worker for more than 20 years. He works in his village and the nearby district. Mai has requested a Kiva loan once before. He is now asking for his second loan of $500 to concrete his house's foundations.

loans.use: To concrete his house's foundations

loans.name: Rât

texts.en:
Rât R. is a 58-year-old resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She and her husband have five children: four are married and work, and the other is single. Rât R. earns a living by producing and selling cement jars for profit. She and her husband always help each other to produce their many sets of jars to sell. She also receives orders from middlemen, who then need to wait a week for their order.
Recently, Rât R. has built a pig pen where she hopes to raise pigs for extra income. As she does not have any capital yet, Rât R. has decided to request a loan of $1000 to buy pig food and ten piglets to begin breeding. Rât R. and her son are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and ten piglets

loans.name: Ang

texts.en: Mrs. Ang U. is 52 years old and is a villager in Trapeang Reang village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming. Her husband, Mr. Rorn Mao, is a motorbike taxi driver. This couple has five children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other three are farmers. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en:
Emelia A. is from the city of Calaocan Santiago. She is 46 years old. Emelia is the group leader of a 14-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Emelia A. Group'.

Emelia is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Emelia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from catching and selling fresh-water fish at the market. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov B. is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Kolab Choeng, is 35 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of the children have full-time employment while the other two are still young, live in the family home and attend school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pov was not available when the photograph was taken so his wife is shown instead.
Pov has been working on construction sites for four years. His children’s work is far from their house so they sometimes have to ride with their relatives or take a motor taxi, which is very expensive. It’s difficult for them to get to work, therefore Pov is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha L. is a 30-year-old married woman and she lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on and aside from farming, she also is a grocery seller and pig breeder at her home. For her grocery and pig businesses, Mrs. Chantha L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries and piglets and pig feed to support her businesses. Her husband, Mr. Houn Chhay, is a teacher in the local school where he can receive a small salary to support his family. This couple has two children; one is attending the local school while the younger one is three years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita E. is from the village of Olango. She is 49 years old. Rosita is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Rosita E. Group'.

Rosita is widowed and has 8 children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a butcher shop. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhim U. is 47 years old and she is a villager who lives in Trapeang Reang village in Takeo province. She is a grocery seller and pig breeder who can earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Sokhim U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries, piglets and pig feed to support her businesses. Her husband, Mr. Sambo Hoem, is employed by the government and can help support his family with a small salary. This couple has two children; one is seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a student in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Rosario's Group

texts.en:
Rosario R. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 37 years old. Rosario is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Rosario R. Group'.

Rosario is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit K. is 33 and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Ly (pictured with him), is 30. They have been married for ten years and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are in school and the other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Tit and his wife have been farming for seven years. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village. Tit does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. That is why he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to make these purchases. He will also use a part of the loan to buy a water pumping machine to spray his vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, pesticide and a water pumping machine

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Mr. Korn E. is 36 years old and he lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on. His wife, Mrs. Rom Preap, is Khmer cake seller who can earn a little income to support her family. Mr. Korn E. now is requesting a loan to add to his savings to purchase a motorcycle to furnish his family with transportation. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other three are attending the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Mrs. Nheb S. is 43 years old and she is a villager who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Kun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice on. Aside from being farmers, they are also beef sellers who can earn a small income to support their family. For their beef business, Mrs. Nheb S. decided to ask for a loan to buy beef to sell. This couple has three children who all are students and also help with their parents' business. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy beef

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita R. is from the village of Olango. She is 40 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Teresita R. Group'.

Teresita is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Mrs. Saren V. is a 55-year-old and she is a villager who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. Mrs. Saren V. is a farmer while her husband, Mr. Thay Long, can earn a small income to support their family by selling rice. Since her husband's business is going well and in order to increase their income to support the family better, Mrs. Saren V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to enlarge her husband's business. This couple has a child who is a staff member of Acleda Bank. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Dagdondov

texts.en: Dagdondov T., 49, is a widower and lives on his own in Hovd province, Mongolia. His children work in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 1997, Dagdondov has been operating a meat-trading business in his town. He has gained much experience over the past 13 years as a trader. Dagdondov purchases meat at wholesales price from the countryside and resells the meat at a local market. He also purchases livestock at wholesale prices and slaughters it to sell the meat at a local market. Previously, Dagdondov has received loans of between 200,000 and 400,000 MNT from Kiva partner, XacBank. He has successfully paid back these loans without any problems. He is an experienced trader who has a very good personality. Dagdondov is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Dama Ty

texts.en:
Mrs. Dama Ty P. lives in Seiha village in Takeo province. She owns a store that rents out items for weddings and ceremonies. From this business, she earns a small income to support her family.

Mrs. Dama Ty P. is 43 years old and widowed with two children, one of whom is on staff at a private company while the other is a student. Mrs. Dama Ty P. is requesting a loan to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Sammilyn

texts.en: Sammilyn L. is from the village of San Jose. She is 32 years old. Sammilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sammilyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sammilyn has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 90,000 Philippine pesos per harvest. In 2005, Sammilyn joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sammilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Sammilyn is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Sammilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin T. is a 60-year-old wife and mother. She has been farming for years, cultivating rice. Her husband, Phol Phorn, aged 61, is a domestic ox trader. He buys oxen at reasonable prices and fattens them for a while before selling on to gain an income. The couple lives with two single children, while another two are now married and live separately. Chin T. is currently planting a rice crop, which she will harvest when mature. She sees that her husband's ox trade is the main source of family income, and this is why she has applied for a loan of $1,100 for her husband to increase his business capital.

loans.use: To increase her husband's business capital

loans.name: Nom

texts.en:
Mrs. Nom N. is 53 years old. She lives in Kouk Doung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She is also a duck breeder and earns a small income from this business to help support her family. Mrs. Nom N. is requesting a loan to buy 200 more ducklings to breed.

Mrs. Nom N. is a widow. She has three children; one works as a seamstress in a garment factory and another is a duck breeder, while the third is a student.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to breed

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun C. lives in Prey Bay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Tol Mon, is a cow middleman. He is also a motorbike taxi driver.

Mrs. Thoeun C. is asking for a loan to support their livelihood. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farming activity, and also to purchase a motorbike for her husband's transportation business.

The couple have a child, who is a student.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith R. is a villager who lives in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Ith Riem is asking for a loan to buy an ox for her farm. Her husband, Mr. Samnith Seav, is a construction worker who makes a small salary to help support his family. Mrs. Ith Riem is 35 years old and the mother of two children, one is a student and one stays at home. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Munawar Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Munawar Sultana is a wife of M. R. and they both are citizens of the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. They own a small, two-roomed house where they have lived with their family for over 35 years.
Munawar is an efficient lady in her work. She manages perfectly her domestic chores as well as her business sewing clothes. She sews clothes for her neighbors with her machine, which she purchased last year with the profits of her business. Her husband operates a grocery shop in the community. He selected this work because he has three years of selling experience in a general store as a salesman.
Munawar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to invest the capital into her husband’s grocery shop so he can purchase groceries in bulk and increase his profit.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mr. Phun V., 42 and his wife, Mrs. Bunthorn Chea, 39, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have three children – one son and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker and the other two children study in a local school. The couple is shown in the photo.
Mr. Phun V. is a fisherman and does construction work. He is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to get to work and to build a restroom for his family to use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his daughter to get work and build a restroom for his family

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Mrs. Pin R. is 56 years old and sells foods from her house in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She is a widowed mother of four children. Three of her children are married and living independently, while one is single. Currently, Pin R. has a small income, but it is not enough to serve her family. She wanted to invest in another business line but had no money to start a new business. Therefore, Pin R. is looking for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva to purchase pig food and lots of piglets to raise in a stall she has built.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and lots of piglets to raise

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is from the village of Dawo, Dapitan City. She is 48 and married with three adult children. Rebecca has a retail store selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for the renovation of her videoke machine — a popular form of entertainment in the Philippines. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rebecca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her videoke machine

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros D. is from the village of Dohinob, Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 65 years old and married. To make a living, Milagros provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Milagros from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her tailoring business

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Yi H. and her husband, Mr. Mi Loem (pictured above), live in a small village along National Road Number Two about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1981 and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives in a separated home; three children are garment factory workers; one son is a security guard and three attend school.

Mrs. Yi H. has been selling Cambodian cakes for over two years. Her husband is a fisherman and does construction work. Yi used a previous kiva loan to buy a motorcycle for her son to get work. She now is asking for another loan of US$1,100 to purchase another motorbike for her son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to get work.

loans.name: Sam Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Oeun S. is a farmer while her husband is a duck breeder. She is a 49-year-old villager who lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. With the businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Sam Oeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy 200 more ducks to enlarge her husband's business. This couple has three children: one is a car mechanic and the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy 200 more ducks

loans.name: Khalida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over twenty-years. She is a caring mother as well as a caring wife. She performs her duties very efficiently. She stays at home and gives proper attention to her kids. Although she is not educated, she sends her kids to school so they can make their future bright and judge the good or bad in their own lives. 

Her husband is involved in a dairy business. He purchases milk from the milk shops and sells in the community. He gets up early in the morning and goes to the milk shops for purchasing the milk. He works hard to manage the financial expenses of its family. By going to milk shops for purchasing milk, it affects his earnings. Therefore, Khalida has decided to apply for a loan from Asasah to purchase a dairy cow. This will allow her husband to get the milk directly from the cow and sell it to the required customers. They hope that, if they earn a good profit, they will be able to purchase another dairy cow and then open their own milk shop and provide milk to their customers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for selling milk.

loans.name: Nare

texts.en:
Loan Term (low and high range):	20 months

Mrs. Nare K. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy K., live about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They married in 1992 and have five sons. Three of their sons attend school, one is a garment factory worker and another one is still young.

Nare has been a garment factory worker for more than two years. Her husband has been a policeman in Phnom Penh for more than twenty years and he also drives a motor taxi when he is free. Nare is applying for a loan of $800 to concrete her house foundation.

Pictured: Mrs. Nare K. and her husband.

loans.use: To concrete her house foundation.

loans.name: Voeng

texts.en: Mrs. Voeng T. is 59 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. Mrs. Vorng Nouch is a widow with four children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a motorbike taxi driver, while the last one is a farmer who supports his mother in farming. Mrs. T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Vorng T. now is requesting for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to support her child's transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mr. Chinda D. and his wife, Mrs.Thida Rous (pictured together), live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1991 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of the children attend school and other two are still young. 

Chinda and his wife have been selling flowers and bananas for more than twelve years. They buy bananas and flowers from villagers and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Chinda wants to expand the house where he lives in order for it to be larger for family members to stay. So, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to use for the project.

loans.use: To expand the house where he lives.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya  K.  operates a silver goods and craft business out of a rented stall in a large store in the city. She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Bayangol district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rental house. Her daughters attend the local secondary Chinese school. 
Enkhtuya started her business in 2006 after previously working as a salesperson for two years. Her business has been quite successful. Today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2,190 USD). She continues to work hard to grow her business and expand her customer base. She is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug (~950 USD) loan to purchase more silver products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more silver products.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthorn L. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Touch Sen, are farmers who own 1.20-hectares of land to cultivate rice. Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Chanthorn L. is owns a general store to sell goods and vegetables. Mrs. Chanthorn L. now is requesting for a loan to buy more groceries and vegetables to support her business and to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire farming laborer to support her farming. This couple has three children; two are attending in the local school while the youngest one is a year old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more groceries, pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai S. is 28 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Thnuoh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, while her husband, Mr. Vart Muth, is a construction worker and also makes furniture, doors, and windows for selling. Mrs. Thai S. now is requesting a loan to purchase construction supplies to support her husband's business. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Latifan's Group

texts.en:
Latifan is a 50 year-old married woman with five children. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan.

She is an active lady. Despite her old age she involves herself in a shoe making and selling business. This has become her family business. They all make the shoes and then sell them to the shoe shops. Her two daughters stay at home and manage the household chores and cook the food for the family.

They don't make just simple shoes – they also make embroidered shoes. Their earning range up to 10-15000 PKR every month.

Latifan is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase material (glue, nails, leather and thread) so she can take orders from more shoe shops and increase her profits.

She hopes to marry her elder son and daughter with the profitable amount.

loans.use: To purchase material to make shoes to sell.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 47 years old and single. To make a living Arnaldo plants and harvests rice for sale. He also started raising pigs. He has been engaged in his business for over 30 years.

Arnaldo joined CEVI in 2008 to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnaldo has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI.

Arnaldo is requesting his 6th loan, for 15000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also to acquire piglets to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to acquire piglets.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children.

To make a living Fely plants rice crops and raises pigs. She sells her harvested rice and and grown pigs. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 30 years now.

In 2008, Fely joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI.

Fely is requesting her 6th loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a wife of M. A. and they live in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. They own a small house of two rooms and have been living in it with her family for over 15 years. She has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters.

Jamila operates a sewing clothes business. Her business earns her 5000 PKR every month. Earlier she just sewed clothes of her neighbors but now she sews the clothes of her relatives as well. She uses her income to pay the education expenses of her kids.

Her husband operates a fruit selling business. He purchases the fruits from the fruit market and sells it to the fruit shops. He has been doing this work for the last 3 years.

Jamila is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s fruit selling business. He wishes to start his own fruit shop so he can better sell to the customers and make his own customers.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children.

To make a living Haydee raises crops. She and her husband also opened a metal shop that her husband mainly operates. Haydee has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.

In 2008, Haydee joined CEVI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haydee has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI.

Haydee is requesting her 6th loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: Шарифова Фазилат проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 30 лет. Не замужем. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном продает детскую одежду и женскую обувь. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Fazilat S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 30 years old, single. She has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales at a market. She primarily sells children's clothing and women's shoes. Fazilat has been involved in this business for 8 years already. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Mrs. Nhan R. is a 30-year-old resident of Kompong Cham Province. She lives in her own old wooden house with other family members and makes a living as a farmer, growing various crops. Her husband who appears on the right in the photo also assists her on the farm. This couple is blessed with three kids who are attending school and under their care. Nhan R. will be using her loan to hire a laborer to clean up her farmland, as well as buy fertilizer. Then she will plant her potato crop.

loans.use: To hire a laborer and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yadamsuren

texts.en: Yadamsuren B. is 22 years old and lives with his wife in an apartment in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They have been living together in their current home for five years. Yadamsuren operates a clothing trading business at a rented counter in a local shop with his wife's help. He has been successfully operating his business since 2009. Yadamsuren started his business with a working capital of 500,000 MNT, however within only one year he managed to increase his working capital to 800,000 MNT. Since he started operating his business, his family's living conditions have improved. Yadamsuren is an open person who has very good communication skills.  He says, “My wife is pregnant and we are expecting our first child. My dream is to provide high quality of life for them. ” Yadamsuren is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: 18.03.040 Group

texts.en:
Tình P. Thị (87) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Tình is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 040-Quảng Hưng (18.03.040).


Tình is married and has two adult aged children.  To make a living, Tình owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Tình has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tình has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Tinh from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tình plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  H. Thị Chiêu (84) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Minh (86) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tình P. Thị (87) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Tình là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040-Quảng Hưng (18.03.040).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Tình thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tình kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2007, Tình đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tình đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  H. Thị Chiêu (84) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Minh (86) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: 16.04.03 Đông Hai Group

texts.en:
Yen Nguyen Thi (6) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Yen is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Đông Hải (16-04-03 Đông Hải).
