Yen is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Yen operates a family member's business harvesting & selling river-caught fish in the local community.  Yen has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,700,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Yen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Yen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by Yen from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Yen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Vu Thi Nhung (3) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


2.  Do Thi Van (73) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Nguyen Thi Du (1) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Yen Nguyen Thi (6) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Yen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03-Đông Hai (16-04-03 Đông Hai).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở sông trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Yen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Yen kiếm được khoảng 1700000 VND.  Vào 2009, Yen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Yen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Vu Thi Nhung (3) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Do Thi Van (73) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyen Thi Du (1) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Mrs. Nam K. is 45 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Krang Thnong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Rin Pov, is an ice cream seller who can earn a small income to support his family's living. In order to support his ice cream business, Mrs. Nam K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle to support her husband's transportation needs to sell ice cream. This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the last one is a construction worker. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ihbayar

texts.en: Ihbayr D., 38, is married and the father of three children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His oldest two daughters, aged 13 and 10, attend a local primary school. Currently, Ihbayr operates transportation and agriculture businesses in his town. He started these businesses three years ago, and has been successfully operating them since then. He used to operate a taxi service, but this year he purchased a bigger car and expanded his business by operating a transportation service between the cities. Each year, his farm crops have been going very well. However, he does not have a warehouse to keep the leftover vegetables. Therefore, he sells vegetables at wholesale prices at a local market in the autumn.  Ihbayr has a very good personality and is focused on the future. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his car and to purchase seeds for his agriculture business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car and seeds

loans.name: Mnarani Group

texts.en:
Hadija is a 38-year-old married mother of five children between 13 and 20 years old.  Her youngest three children are at school.  Hadija sells fruits and vegetables at a tabletop stand in the Buja market near Dar Es Salaam.  She has been running this business for three years.  She leaves her home at 5am each morning to buy the produce, and after a day at the market, she returns home around 9pm in the evening. She earns a profit of about $50 a month.  This is Hadija's first loan from Tujijenge and she will use it to increase her stock and variety of fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to support her children.  

Hadija is the Treasurer of the Mnarari Group.  She can be seen raising her hand in the photo.  The group's 18 members run a variety of businesses including sales of clothes, medicine, food, and khangas (traditional East African cotton fabric).  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back this loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Mahamudu is 25 years old and single.  He has been running a small stand selling second-hand clothes and shoes since 2008.  He works from 7:30 am until 7 pm six days a week and earns about $200 a month in profits. Mahamudu dreams of expanding his business, and he will use this loan to increase his stock by purchasing additional styles and sizes of clothes and shoes.  

This will be Mahamudu’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Mahamudu is a member of the Saranga Group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  Mahamudu is the only man in the group and can be seen in the back row wearing a hat.

loans.use: To increase his second hand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mr. Oeun M. is 50 years old, and he is a villager who lives Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Touch Long, are farmers who own 2.70-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mr. Oeun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to support his farming crops. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Oeun M. is also Khmer trailer taxi driver who can earn a small income to support his family's living. This couple has six children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and two are attending in the local school while the other three are staying at home and also support their parents' farming. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye N., âgé de 50 ans, est un charretier (caleche) de métier et gère parallélement sa boutique pour diversifier et augmenter ses revenus.  C'est depuis 8 ans que son frère lui avait acheté un cheval avec lequel il menait une activité de transport urbain dans la ville de Bambey. Il compte beaucoup d'expériences dans ce métier et a un amour très profond du cheval qu'il continue de chérir dans son métier.
Cet homme marié et pére de 3 enfants souhaitait un crédit pour acheter un cheval .
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye N., who is 50 years old, is a horse-drawn carriage driver by trade, and at the same time he manages his shop in order to diversify and increase his income. His brother bought him a horse eight years ago and with this horse he ran an urban transport activity in the town of Bambey. He has a lot of experience in this business and a deep passion for the horse which he continues to hold dear in his trade. This married man who is father to three children wanted a loan to buy a horse.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with four boys (two are in secondary school and two in primary).  She's a cook and sells samosas, Irish potatoes, french fries, and juices out of her home to her neighborhood and passersby.  She's had her business for 12 years.  Halima's husband works as a driver and mechanic.

Halima requested a loan that she will use to buy a freezer for her juice business and to purchase more Irish potatoes.  One of her recent business challenges is the rising price of baking flour, potatoes, and cooking oil.  

Halima hopes to make enough with her business to have her own home in the coming years. (Currently she rents a small room where she has electricity but no piped water.)  She joined Yehu in order to gain access to loans like this one so she might improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
Imanuel is 47 years old and married with three children.  His eldest child is 28 years old and married.  His other children are 19 and 8 years old and they go to school.  For five years, Imanuel has run a micro-business as a groundnut vendor.  He works from 5pm-10pm each evening, selling to commuters during the busy evening rush hour.  This is Imanuel's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and he will use it to increase his stock of nuts.  This should allow him to increase sales and profits. 

Imanuel is one of 10 members of the Dubai group.  The members run diverse businesses including carpentry, food sales and charcoal sales.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Imanuel is wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Хочаев Нуриддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Нуриддин имеет средне - специальное образование, "Механизатор". По профессии работал 9 лет. Сейчас он тракторист, работает на поле. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет на ремонт трактора.
texts.en:
Nuriddin H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Nuriddin has a secondary-specialized education as a mechanic. He spent 9 years working in that field. Now he is a tractor driver and works in the fields. He has been involved in this business for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan in order to repair his tractor.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tractor repairs

loans.name: Rady

texts.en: Mr. Rady T. is 43 years old, and he is a villager who lives in Roteang village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Samoun Ros, are farmers who rent some land to grow crops. For this farm, Mr. Rady T. decided to ask for a loan to hire a farming laborer and to pay for the laborer to plow his farm. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Rady T. is a motorbike taxi driver, and his wife, Mrs. Samoun Ros, is a fish seller. With this both businesses they can earn a small income to support their family's living. This couple has four children; one is seamstress in a garment factory while the other three are students in the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To hire a farming laborer and to pay for the laborer to plow his farm.

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Annamaria is 34 years old and married.  She is the adoptive mother of five nieces and nephews.  Annamaria sells birds (chickens, turkeys and ducks), water, soft drinks and cake.  She has been in business for five years.  She works from 7am until 9pm each day and earns about $215 per month.  With her loan, Annamaria plans to pay the school fees for one of her children who is entering Senior 5 year.  

This will be Annamaria's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Annamaria will share this loan with all 17 members of the Mpipi (Sweet) Group.  Group members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.  

Annamaria can be seen wearing a pink jacket in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Moen

texts.en: Mrs. Moen N. is 51 years old, and she lives in Check village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Choeun Kum, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. For supporting this farm, Mrs. Moen N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Choeun Kum is a cow middleman who can earn a small income to support his family's living. Mrs. Moen N. is a mother of four children who all are attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josphine is a single woman with one son who attends school. She owns a motorbike and wants to buy another one to boost her motorbike transport business. She has been in the business for one year and previously was unemployed.

The challenge to her business is competition form other motorbike transport dealers. She rents her home and has electricity and water. She joined Yehu to improve her standard of living through access to loans. Her great expenses are house rent and school fees for her son. She hopes to open a boutique shop where she can sell clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sakhorn L. is 40 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller who can earn a small income to support her family's living, while her husband, Mr. Chhoun Hout, is a laborer who receives a small salary. Mrs. Sakhorn L. now is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to support her business activities. This couple has seven children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a construction worker while the other for are attending in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Mrs. Navy R. is 39 years old, and she is a villager in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kimleng Chea, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Navy R. decided to ask for a loan to pay for a laborer to plow her farm and to buy the hose to support her water (irrigation) machine. This couple has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a chef while the youngest one is attending in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to pay for a laborer to plow her farm and to buy hose for irrigation

loans.name: Serigne Mor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Serigne Mor F. est un jeune marié âgé de 26 ans. Il est un agent de sécurité de l'agence Dalalbi Presta. Il vient récemment d'être recruté  après avoir servi deux entreprises comme vigile.  C'est parce que ses deux entreprises lui doivent de l'argent qu'il jugea nécessaire de contacter les agences de sécurité pour trouver un emploi. 
En fin, cet homme, père de 2 enfants, souhaitait avec le crédit demandé achever la construction d'une chambre qu'il avait commencé  dans la maison familiale.
texts.en:
Mr. Serigne Mor F. is married and 26 years old. He is a security agent at the Dalalbi Presta agency. He was recently recruited there after being employed as guard by two companies. He found it necessary to contact the security agencies to find a job, as both his previous employers owed him money. This father of two children wishes to use the loan requested to finish building a room he had started working on in the family home.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: finish building a room

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Eight people make up a village bank cooperative located in Champuh Káek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarin K. 50 years old and is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose. Mrs. Sarin K. is a pure-drinking-water seller who can earn a small income to support her family. For this business, Mrs. Sarin K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pure drinking water to sell. Mrs. Sarin K. is widow with four children, two are staff workers in casino club and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy more pure drinking water to resell

loans.name: Vutha's Group

texts.en: For this group loan, Mr. Vutha S., 39 years old, is the village bank president, and there are eight members located in Chong Prek village in Kandal province. The members of this loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mr. Vutha S. and his wife, Mrs. Pov Khut, are flower sellers. With this business they can earn a small income to support their family's living. In order to support this business, Mr. Vutha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy flowers to resell. This couple has four children; one is seamstress in a garment factory and two are attending in the local school while the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy flowers to resell.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rom T. is 47 years old and is the village bank president selected by 17 members, located in Koh Krabei village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose. Mrs. Rom T. is a fruit seller while her husband can earn a small income by motorbike taxi driving to support his family's living. In order to support the fruit business, Mrs. Rom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruits to resell. This couple has three children who all are students and who also support their mother business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: complete the purchase of a plot of land

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of 16 people and is located in Koh Krabei village in Kandal province. Mr. Dara H. is 39 years old and is the village bank president who was selected by the members. Each member of this village will use it to support their different purposes. Mr. Dara H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow potatoes. For this farm, Mr. Dara H. decided to ask for a loan to support his potato crop. His wife, Mrs. SaroeU. Yim, is a seamstress in a garment factory. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To support his potato farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sónia

texts.pt:
Sónia A. M. nasceu na Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 27 anos de idade, casada e  mãe de 1 filho de 12 anos de idade, vai a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo no Distrito de Boane com seus pais ainda muito nova. Tem um negocio próprio ha mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, blocos, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 5.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para conclusão da sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Sonia A. M. was born in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She is 27 years old, married, and has a 12-year-old son who attends school. Sonia only studied through 5th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents’ lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. She left Gaza for the Boane district of Maputo with her parents when she was still quite young. She has owned her own business for more than 5 years. She doesn’t employ any help and has a monthly income of around 9000 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and occasionally saves some in her bank account as well. Sonia has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 15,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, bars, blocks, iron and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home. Her earlier loan was for 5000 Meticais and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house and offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement and other items)

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, two girls and two boys who all attend school. She sells chapati (flatbread), beans and half cakes to passersby and her neighbors.

Fatuma has been in business for one year and previously was a hairdresser. With the KES 20,000 loan, she hopes to look for a shop where she can work from and also to buy more flour, beans and cooking oil. Her business challenges are seasonality and customers defaulting on goods taken on credit.
		
Fatuma rents a home with electricity but no water. Her great expenses are school fees, medication and rent. She joined the organization so that she can access loans and improve her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land where she can construct a shop and carry out her business there.

loans.use: To rent a shop and buy flour, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
António M. nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 10, 06 e 03 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Frequenta o 4° ano do ensino superior, a esposa também continua estudando. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane com a sua mãe ainda muito novo e acabaram fixando sua residência neste Distrito. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 10 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.886.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, blocos, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar uma actividade comercial e concluir a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Antonio M. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children 10, 6 and 3 years old. The two older children attend school. Antonio is currently studying to finish the 4th year of college and his wife is finishing her studies as well. He lives with his family in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. He left Manhiça for the district of Boane with his mother when he was still a young child, and they ended up staying in that area. He has worked for more than 10 years for the Ministry of Education as a teacher. He doesn’t employ any help and has a monthly salary of 5886 Meticais. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some each month in his bank account. Antonio has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues who also work with the institution. This is his 2nd loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, bars, blocks, iron and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of his home. His earlier loan was for 10,000 Meticais and was used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later.. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to start a business and finish his house, in order to offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, nails and other items)

loans.name: Amélia

texts.pt:
Amélia M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 39 anos de idade, casada e mae de 5 filhos de 20, 17, 13, 10 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 9ą classe não continuou devido ao casamento prematuro. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Nunca mudou da sua terra natal, trabalha no Instituto Agrário de Boane ha mais de 06 anos e tem um empregado que lhe auxilia nos trabalhos de casa. O seu salário mensal é de 2.200.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do salário do marido consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes, areia, pedra e outros) para ampliar a sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 6.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar com ampliação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Amelia M. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children who are 20, 17, 13, 10 and 6 years old. All of the children attend school. Amelia only studied through 9th grade, and didn't continue because she married at a young age. She lives with her family in their own house and helps support two nephews who live with them. She continues to live in Boane, where she has worked in the Agricultural Institute for 6 years. She employs one person to help her with cooking and housework. She has a monthly salary of 2200 Meticais, which she uses to cover household expenses. With the help of her husband and his salary, she also saves some in her bank account. Amelia has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues who also work with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, zinc plates, beams, sand, stone and other items) in order to expand her home. Her earlier loan was for 6000 Meticais and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish working on her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, zinc plates and other items)

loans.name: Mamrachab

texts.ru: Чориев Мамрачаб проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сыновья на заработках в России. Сам Мамрачаб занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mamrachab C. lives in the Yavan district. He is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. The sons work in Russia. Mamrachab is involved in animal husbandry. He owns a small cowshed, where he breeds livestock. He has been involved in this type of business for over 5 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Alda

texts.pt:
Alda N. C. nasceu na ciadade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mae de 4 filhos de 20, 16, 14 e 10 anos de idade, os dois mais novos vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta Mais ninguém.
Saiu da cidade da Matola para o bairro da Matola rio quando se juntou ao seu marido. Trabalha como auxiliar de limpezas no Instituto Agrário de Boane ha mais de 20 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 3.060.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez em quanto na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, portas, aros de portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa e oferecer conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Alda N. C. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 20, 16, 14 and 10 years old. The two younger children attend school. Alda only studied through 4th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents’ lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. She left the city of Matola for a neighborhood near the Matola river when she was married. She has worked for more than 20 years on the janitorial staff of the Agricultural Institute of Boane. She doesn’t employ any help and has a monthly income of 3060 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and occasionally saves some in her bank account. Alda has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues who also work with the institution. This is her 3rd loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, zinc plates, doors, door frames and other items) in order to continue with the construction of her home. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to furnish her house and offer her family more comfortable living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, zinc plates, doors and other items)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa A. M. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 56 anos de idade, casada e mae de 3 filhos de 30, 28 e 14 anos de idade, apenas o mais novo continua estudando. Fez somente 4ą classe do antigo sistema de educação e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta Mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, tem um negocio próprio ha mais de 3 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do marido que é auto mecânico consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tijolos, areia, pedra, cimento e outros) para terminar a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Rosa A. M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 56 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 30, 28 and 14 years old. Only the youngest is still in school. Rosa only studied through 4th grade under the old education system, and didn't continue because of her parents’ lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. She continues to live in Maputo and has owned her own business for more than 3 years. She doesn’t employ any help and has a monthly income of almost 7000 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and with the help of her husband, who is an auto machanic, she manages to save some each month in her bank account. Rosa has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (bricks, sand, stone, cement and other items) in order to continue finish the construction of her home. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to furnish her house and offer her family more comfortable living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (zinc plates, cement, bricks and other items)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina B. N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 18 e 07 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a gravidez indesejada. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Maputo para o bairro da Matola quando se casou. Tem um negócio próprio há mais de 5 anos, possui um empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (ovos, arroz, feijão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir casas de aluguer.
texts.en:
Cristina B. N. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, widowed, and has 2 children who are 18 and 7 years old. Cristina only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue because of an unplanned pregnancy. She lives with her children in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. She left Maputo for the neighborhood of Matola when she got married. She has owned her own buisness for more than 5 years and has one employee. She earns a monthly income of almost 5000 Meticais, which she uses to cover household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account. Cristina has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 25,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy products (rice, eggs, beans and other items) in order to increase her stock of merchandise. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to build rental houses.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs, rice and beans

loans.name: Arsénio

texts.pt:
Arsénio H. V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 40 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 11, 09 e 04 anos de idade, os 2 primeiros vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta os pais enviando algum dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Maputo para Nampula quando seus pais foram transferidos pelos serviços. 5 Anos depois regressa a Maputo no Distrito de Boane e constitui uma família. Trabalha num orfanato na área agro-pecuária ha mais de 1 ano. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 3.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do rendimento do seu negócio consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmão que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, cervejas, bolachas, biscoitos, pipocas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e construir um murro de vedação na sua casa.
texts.en:
Arsenio H. V. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 11, 9 and 4 years old. The two older children attend school. Arsenio only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue because of his parents’ lack of financial resources. He lives with his family in their own house and helps to support his parents by sending them money to help with their household expenses. He left Maputo for Nampula when his parents were transferred for work reasons. 5 years later he returned to Maputo and the district of Boane, where he started a family. He has worked in an orphanage in an agricultural zone for more than a year, and doesn’t employ any household help. He earns a monthly salary of 3500 Meticais, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some in his bank account. Arsenio has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through his brother, who also works with the institution. This is his 5th loan, for the amount of 25,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy products (soft drinks, beer, cookies, crackers, popcorn and other items) in order to increase his stock of merchandise. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and build a security wall around it.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer, soft drinks, cookies and popcorn

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
Gilda C. M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 40 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 17 anos de idade, vai a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo apenas mudou do bairro quando se casou. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 20 anos, conta com ajuda de 2 empregados que lhe auxiliam no seu trabalho. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar roupa diversa nova e usada para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para montar uma boutique e ampliar ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Gilda C. M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 40 years old, married, and has a 17-year-old son who is in school. She only studied through 4th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and she helps support a niece who lives with them. She never left Maputo, but moved to a new neighborhood when she got married. She has owned her own business for more than 20 years and has two employees who help her. She earns a monthly income of around 8000 Meticais, and she uses this money to cover household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account. Gilda has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 20,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy a variety of new and used clothing in order to increase her stock of merchandise. Her earlier loan was for 10,000 Meticais and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to open a boutique and expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shirts, skirts and other clothing

loans.name: Mame Mor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mame Mor G. est célibataire âgé de 23 ans. Monsieur G. est aviculteur et vendeur de poussins, poulet de chairs,aliments,  matériels d'aviculture ...etc. Il s'y active depuis 4 ans après la fin de ses études en école coranique. Il n'est novice au système de prêt établi par la mutuelle IMCEC car il est à sa quatrième demande de crédit et de l'avis de l'agent de crédit, Monsieur Mame Mor G. fait partie de leurs clients les plus solvables.
Cependant avec ce nouveau crédit, Monsieur G. souhaiterait acheter des poussins, sacs d'aliment, vaccin pour poussin et vitamine pour poussin afin de développer son business
texts.en:
Mr. Mame Mor G. is single, 24 years old. His business is breeding poultry and selling chicks, broiler chicken, food, aviculture materials etc etc. He has been doing this for four years after finishing his studies at a Quaranic school. He is not a newcomer to the loan system established by the IMCEC mutual fund as he is now on his fourth loan, and, according to his account representative, Mr. Mame Mor G. belongs to the most reliable clients. And thus with this new loan, Mr. G. would like to buy chicks as well bags of food, vaccines and vitamins for chicks in order to expand his business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening his poultry breeding business

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Albertina P. M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 22 e 09 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu de Maputo apenas mudou do bairro quando construi sua própria residência. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 05 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, arroz, ovos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu inventário.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir bens para melhorar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Albertina P. M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 42 years old, unmarried, and has 2 children who are 22 and 9 years old. Both attend school. Albertina only studied through 8th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her children in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. She never left Maputo, but moved to a new neighborhood when she built her own home. She has owned her own business for more than 5 years and doesn’t employ any help. She earns a monthly income of almost 10,000 Meticais, and she uses this money to cover household expenses. She also saves some in her bank account. Albertina has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy products (beer, soft drinks, rice, eggs and other items) in order to increase her stock of merchandise. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to purchase more goods to improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, eggs and drinks.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Катаева Наталья проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 32 года. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. Она продает парфюмерию, нижнее белье и многое другое. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Natalya K. lives in the Yavan district. She is 32 years old, divorced and has one child. She has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales. She sells perfumes, undergarments and various other merchandise. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Natalya is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Avelino

texts.pt:
Avelino C. M. nasceu na Província de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 26, 24, 20, 20 e 07 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 6ą classe do antigo sistema e não continuou porque na altura não havia possibilidades de ir mais alem. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado cumprindo o serviço militar obrigatório em 1975. Mais tarde constituiu sua família no Distrito de Boane onde vive actualmente. É reformado do Ministério da Defesa ha mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem uma pensão de 6.604.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, blocos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.500.00mt, 8.500.00mt, 12.500.00mt, 7.050.00mt e 15.500.00mt todos para a mesma actividade (habitação). 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra oferecendo assim melhores condições de habitabilidade da sua família.
texts.en:
Avelino C. M. was born in the province of Cabo Delgado in the north of Mozambique. He is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children who are 26, 24, 21, 20 and 7 years old. All of his children are currently in school. Avelino only studied through 6th grade under the old system of education, and didn't continue because at that time there was no chance for him to do so. He lives with his family in their own house and helps to support a niece who lives with them. He left Cabo Delgado in 1975 to comply with the obligatory military service. Later he built a family in the Boane district, where he currently lives. He is retired from the Ministry of Defense and has a monthly pension of 6604 Meticais. He doesn’t employ any household help. He uses the money from his pension for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account. Avelino has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is his 6th loan, for the amount of 16,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, iron, blocks, sand and other items) in order to continue working on a home improvement project. His earlier loans were for 6500, 8500, 12,500, 7050 and 15,500 Meticais and were all used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house, in order to offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, blocks, iron and other items)

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria P. N. nasceu na cidade de Xai xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 17 e 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e de vez enquanto envia algum valor monetário para ajudar a mãe em despesas alimentares.
Saiu de Xai xai para Boane com o seu marido em 1980 devido a transferência dos serviços. Actualmente on seu marido trabalha nas minas da África do Sul de vez enquanto envia dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas de casa. Maria é comerciante e dona do seu negocio há mais de 25 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos na cooperativa de credito TCHUMA e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos  e familiares que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pecas de capulanas, para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt os dois e todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. O seu sonho é de ter um estabelecimento comercial condigno para albergar toda a sua mercadoria. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar ainda mais seu negocio.
texts.en:
Maria P. N. was born in the city of Xai-Xai, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children, ages 17 and 14. Both children go to school. Maria only finished fifth grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and from time to time sends her mother some money to help with food costs. In 1980, she and her husband left Xai-Xai to go to Boane for a work transfer. Her husband currently works in the mines in South Africa and sometimes sends money to help with household expenses. Maria is a businesswoman and has run her own business for more than 25 years. She has no employees and earns about 4,500 meticais per month. Maria uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account. She has taken out loans before from Tchuma Credit Union and decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through friends and relatives who are also customers of this institution. This is Maria's third loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy capulanas (a traditional Mozambican skirt), so she can increase her stock. The earlier loans were both for 10,000 meticais and were used for the same purpose. Maria promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. Her dream is to have a nice shop to keep all her merchandise in. In the future she would like to ask for more loans in order to expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of capulanas (traditional Mozambican skirts)

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssatou M. est une femme mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait le commerce depuis 2004. C'est en aidant son mari dans sa boutique qu'elle prit goût au commerce. Ainsi, elle a décidé de gérer son propre commerce après une bonne comprèhension des affaires. 
Agée de 35 ans, Madame Aïssatou M.  pense que le commerce représente une identité partagée pour les femmes de sa localité, cette activité les valorise davantage et elles sont estimées par leurs maris. 
Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour acheter des tissus, chaussures, parfums et des bols qu'elle va commercialiser.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssatou M. is married and the mother of six children. She has been active in commerce since 2004. She initially took an interest in commercial activities by helping her husband in his shop. Having acquired a solid understanding of commercial practices, she then decided to run her own business. Mrs. Aïssatou M. is 35 years old, and believes that commerce is a shared activity among women in her locality, which boosts their sense of self-worth and wins the esteem of their husbands. To strengthen her business she is requesting a loan for 200,000 FCFA, to buy clothing fabric, shoes, perfume and bowls she will then resell.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase various products

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina M. D. C. nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filha de 18 anos de idade, vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou porque não conseguia ingressar ao ensino superior. Vive na casa própria com a sua filha e sustenta uma sobrinha de 14 anos que vive com ela.
Saiu de Magude para Boane com os seu pais quando foram transferidos pelos serviços devido a guerra de desestabilização. Trabalha como docente há mais de 12 anos e é do quadro do Ministério D. Educação, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.570.46mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainD. poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma colega que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, areia, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção D. sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar uma actividade comercial, como forma de melhorar a sua viD..
texts.en:
Cristina M. D. C. was born in Magude District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 42 years old, single, and has an 18-year-old daughter who goes to school. Cristina finished twelfth grade and did not continue school because she was not accepted into college. She lives in her own house with her daughter and supports a 14-year-old niece who lives with her. Cristina left Magude to move to Boane with her parents when they were transferred because of the civil war. She has worked as a teacher with the Ministry of Education for more than 12 years. She has no employees and has a salary of 5,570.46 meticais per month. She uses this for household expenses and also saves some in her bank account. She has never had loans from other banks. Cristina learned about Hluvuku through a co-worker who is also a customer of this institution. This is her first loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, beams and other items) to continue building her house. Cristina promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans so she can start a business to improve her life.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand, blocks, beams

loans.name: Mardonali

texts.en:
Mardonali is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children. He has been a farmer for the past five years. He began farming with the goal of supporting his household, and above all, satisfying the needs of his children. For Mardonali, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, vegetable production is what he likes most as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the production in great quantities and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take them away themselves. Now Mardonali wishes to borrow money that he wants to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Be an important part of the growth of Mardonali’s business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
E. Madina is 26 years old. She is selling dishes and plates in the oriental style and also kid’s toys in a central local shop. Madina has been in this business for four years already. During these years, the business turned to a successful one, allowing Madina to support herself and her family. Now Madina is planning to increase the stock and to purchase the dishes and plates at wholesale. With this purpose, she requests $1,000 US Dollars. Madina thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan timely. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dishes and plates at wholesale.

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
Armindo A. W. nasceu na cidade de Quelimane, Província de Zambezia, Centro de Moçambique, tem 48 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 22, 18, 14, 12 e 09 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente  7ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 enteados que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Zambézia para Boane cumprindo o serviço militar, mais tarde acabou fixando uma residência e formar a sua família. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 8 anos, conta com ajuda da sua sobrinha e uma cunhada onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.500.00mt e uma pensão de desmobilização militar de 3.200.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um colega militar que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos(arroz, frangos, carne, ovos, óleo e outros) para diversificar ainda mais as refeições que prepara para a sua clientela. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 19.000.00mt e 21.000.00mt para Habitação e comercio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para melhoramento do seu estabelecimento comercial e desenvolver ainda mais o seu negocio
texts.en:
Armindo A. W. was born in Quelimane City, Zambézia Province in central Mozambique. He is 48 years old, married, and has five children, ages 22, 18, 14, 12 and 9. All the children go to school. Armindo only finished seventh grade. He did not continue school because he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family and supports two step-children who live with him. He left Zambézia to go to Boane while performing his military service. Later on, he made his home and started his family here. For more than eight years he has run his own business, with the help of his niece and a sister-in-law. He earns about 7,500 meticais per month and receives a military pension of 3,200 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account at Millenium Bim. Armindo has never taken out loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a military colleague who is also a customer of this institution. This is Armindo's fourth loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (rice, chicken, meat, eggs, oil and other foods) to diversify the types of meals he prepares for his customers. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais, 19,000 meticais, and 21,000 meticais. They were used for housing and business. Armindo promises to pay off this loan on time so he may have more loans. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to improve his shop and make his business grow more.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans, sugar, potatoes

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en:
H. Mairam is 57 years old. She lives with her spouse and works every day starting very early in the morning so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her six children successfully finish University. Her business is located in the central market of Tursunzade and she sells clothes for women. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort, she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 6,000 Somoni, Mairam will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Bibaikhol

texts.en:
Bibaikhol has a very good sense of humor and her jovial spirit helps her face difficult times. She’s been immersed in raising animals since her childhood and for that reason, she decided to remain in this industry. Bibaikhol works very hard to obtain the income that will satisfy her family’s necessities. The immense love that she feels for her children and her faithful husband motivates her to keep working hard. She wishes to buy more animals and this way increase her income.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Inocência

texts.pt:
Inocência E. N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filha de 3 anos de idade, ainda não vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou porque não conseguia ingressar no ensino superior. Vive na casa cedida pelos serviços e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Maputo para Boane quando se juntou ao seu marido. Trabalha como docente há mais de 06 anos é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.585.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve um empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma colega que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, blocos, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 7.000.00mt para compra de bens. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para conclusão da sua casa e para aquisição de um meio de transporte próprio.
texts.en:
29 year-old Inocência E. N. was born in Maputo, in Southern Mozambique. Unable to continue her studies after high school, because she was not accepted into college, she left Maputo for Boane when she met the father of her daughter. The single mother of a 3 year-old girl, for the last six years Inocência has been working as a teacher for the Ministry of Education, earning a monthly salary of 5.585.00mt, which allows her to pay for her household expenses and to put some money into a savings account. Inocência has had a loan in the past with the credit cooperative TCHUMA. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend and this is her second loan with the institution. She plans to use the 15.000.00mt to buy construction material to continue building her house. She is committed to paying back her loan according to the loan's terms and plans to apply for more credit in the future, to finish the construction of her house and to buy a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sand, cement blocks, stones and other construction materials

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur Gora D. est vieux qui a fait pendant toute sa vie de l'agriculture. Il est également répararteur de montre au niveau du marché de Thiès. avec l'arrivée de la saison des pluies, au mois de Juillet, Monsieur D. voudrait d'un crédit d'une petite somme comme il le dit pour sa culture. En fait, il veut acheter des graines d'arachide pour son champ. En fait devenu vieux , son petit fils se charge de lui cultiver son champ.
texts.en:
Mr. Gora D. is old and has spent all his life working in agriculture. He is also a watch repairer at the market in Thiès. With the arrival of the rainy season in July, Mr. D. would like a small loan for his agricultural activity. In fact, he would like to buy peanut grains for his field. Because he is old, it is his grandson who is taking responsibility for cultivating his field.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of peanut grains to sow

loans.name: Ghandi

texts.en: Ghandi is a 38-year-old man. Ghandi has owned a bakery. For 20 years, Ghandi has been selling “saj” bread and Lebanese pastries. A saj is the metal oven used to make saj bread; it is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome. The saj is used to make several types of bread, including markouk (thinned) bread and doughy confections, or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but it somehow tastes better in the morning. He produces different types of jams, spices, bread and more. He also does Lebanese pastries like “Fatayers”, which are spiced triangular spinach pies stuffed with meat and onions; “Sfiha” which are pies made from our own fresh dough topped with spicy ground lamb meat, onions and tomatoes; “Sambousik” which are pastries with meat and pine nuts; and “Rakaek Jibne” which are thin flour dough, stuffed with a combination of cheese and fried to golden perfection. Ghandi requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to rehabilitate his oven and install an electricity meter for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. He is special in his work because he offers good quality and very tasty pastries and mankoucheh. His clients are people from his region, but mainly his friends, neighbors and tourists. Ghandi decided on doing his business because he is a very good cook and has experience. He plans to keep on expanding his business as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To rehabilitate his oven and install an electricity meter

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia J. M. was born in the Inhambane province, in southern Mozambique, 30 years ago. She could only study until 8th grade. She lives with her partner and two children aged 12 and 14. Both of them go to school. She also takes care of her mother-in-law and two nephews that live with her. She left Inhambane for Boane, in the Maputo province in 2003, and has lived there with her family ever since.

She sells from a food stall she has by her house, where she works from approximately 9am to 5pm. She does not have any employees. She learned the business from her mother-in-law two years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy several food products such as eggs, rice, kidney beans or peanuts to sell in her food stall. She obtains about 3,800 meticais per month from her food stall and she is able to save most months.

This is her second loan with our Mozambican MFI partner. She has only started her business and her future success depends of her capability of finding clients, something that concerns her a little bit. She hopes her business goes well and that, in the future, she is able to start her own shop rather than having a stall by her house.

loans.use: To buy rice, eggs, peanuts, kidney beans and many other food products

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 54 year-old married man and father of 9 children. He has been working as a home painter, on a freelance basis, upon the request of the clients. He works hard to satisfy the demands of his job in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better living for his family.

Mohamad is a very dynamic man who does his best and works hard to improve his financial situation and sustain his family. The challenge he faces in his work is the competition since there are a lot of other home painters, but since he has good experience in his domain he does his best to increase his number of clients.

He is requesting a loan for the first time to purchase painting tools and paint. In the future he plans to keep on improving his work as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools and paint.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 45 year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is a married man and has four children to sustain. Hassan is a dedicated construction worker who works on projects on the request of clients. He specializes in tiles; he cuts them and then places them.

In order to improve his business he has requested a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua to buy a tile cutter and to buy diesel for his generator (the electricity is shut down daily so in order to continue his work he needs a generator).
