When he first started his business he didn’t have use of a wide network but he knew on how to prove himself and make himself known. In the future Hassan plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To buy a tile cutter and diesel for his generator.

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en:
Jamileh is a 51 year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. She is married.

Jamileh owns a printing shop. She also owns computers for people who want to work or access Internet services. Her customers include friends and other community members.

She is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. She plans to use the loan to invest in a computer and a printer for her shop. In the future, Jamileh hopes to further expand her business and provide greater support to her family.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer for her shop.

loans.name: Soussi

texts.en:
Soussi is a 53 year old married woman from Lebanon, who has three children. Soussi has a business repairing and making clothing for men and women. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread and improve her business. Soussi has been working from her house as a sewer for 26 years; therefore she has a broad customer base which includes friends, neighbors, family members and people from her region. Soussi has been a microcredit client for eight years and she paid back her previous loan on time. Soussi's previous loans always allowed her to improve her business. 
Not only is Soussi known for her talented work, she is also very punctual and repairs clothes within 1 or 2 days. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues. Soussi is a very active and has self confidence which encouraged her to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase thread.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 33-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He has been the owner of a car painting garage for more than 15 years. His customers include friends, neighbors and other community members who have come to know him through his work. Mhamad is extremely proud of his work and believes that it is his experience that has helped him succeed.

Mhamad is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to invest in paint equipment and supplies, as well as save for his future home. In the future, Mhamad hopes to further expand his business and provide greater support to his family.

loans.use: To buy paint equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Тагоева Сафаргул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 35 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне – специальное, медсестра. Более 4 лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает ткани. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Safargul T. lives in the Yavan district. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a secondary-specialized education as a nurse. Safargul has been involved in retail sales for over 4 years. She primarily sells fabrics. She is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou N. est née en 1952 et elle est à sa deuxième demande de crédit. Elle fait le commerce depuis 3 ans. Elle vend des produits de lessive et pain de singe. Madame N. fait le commerce ambulant. 
Pour ce prêt, elle veut ajouter dans son business la vente de pâte d'arachide et de l'huile de palme comme ça elle pourra diversifiée ses marchandises et gagner plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou N. was born in 1952, and she is on her second loan request. She has been in commerce for three years and sells laundry products and monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree). She is an itinerant vendor. For this loan, she wants to include with her business the sale of peanut butter and palm oil. In this way, she will be able to diversify her goods and to earn more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 25 year old man who owns a bakery. Ahmad specializes in croissants: flaky crescent-shaped bread roll made of a yeast dough similar to puff pastry, which can be either plain or sweet, such as a chocolate croissant. In Lebanon people also eat savoury croissants with zaatar (thyme) and jebneh (cheese). One can eat these croissant varieties anytime of the day, but somehow they taste better in the morning. The best time to eat a croissant is when it just went out of the oven when it is still hot, then it simply tastes great. Ahmad is a croissant specialist because he is known for his good and tasty croissants. He started his business a year ago when he realized that there is great demand for a baker in his region, especially since there is a school next to his bakery. Because he is well located, he has a broad customer base including friends, neighbors, passer bys and school children. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an oven and also a motorcycle for his bakery. The motorcycle will allow him to do home deliveries and increase his customers base. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Ahmad decided on this business because he always wanted to open a bakery on his own, after working in the same field and gaining some experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase an oven and also a motorcycle for his bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 42-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has three dependents living with him. Sarkis has been working as a car painter since 2001. Since he has lots of experience in this domain from his previous job, he decided to open his own garage. His customers include neighbors and friends from his community. Sarkis is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. Sarkis will use the loan to continue to develop his business. This is his fifth cycle and he has always paid on time. Thanks to his previous loans he was capable of improving his work and providing good quality services for his clients.

loans.use: To develop his business.

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 59 year old man who has four children. Sarkis has owned a grocery store since 2002. In his store he sells candies, canned food, beverage, chips, biscuits etc. Sarkis requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store in order to be able to expand and diversify his stock; the expansion will help him answer his clients' needs. This is the first time that Sarkis has requested a loan. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Sarkis decided to open a grocery business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, Sarkis plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Hammad

texts.en: Hammad is a 36 year old married man and the father of four children. For over fifteen years, Hammad has been a small-business entrepreneur; he sells fruits and vegetables which he buys from the local farmers. Hammad's merchandise varies with the seasons. Today, Hammad is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise in order to fill his shop with the needed goods to increase his sales and, therefore, his income. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. Hammad is known for his good quality products. He hopes that in the future he will be able to keep on satisfying his clients’ demand.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Abd Al Nasser

texts.en:
Abd A. Nasser is a 25-year old single man who lives in Lebanon and has more than 10 years of experience working in a hair-cutting salon. He has owned his own business for more than a year, and most of his clients are close contacts and friends. 

Abd is applying for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, his first such request, to expand his business and pay for a medicA. operation his sister badly needs.

loans.use: To expand his business and pay for a medical operation for his sister

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Plata Group

texts.es:
Maria M. C. de 26 años es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Vicuñitas de Plata, ella se dedica a vender queso  desde hace 2 años, en la Ceja y la feria 16 de Julio y necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería. Las demás integrantes tienen variados negocios como:  elaboración de calzados, tejido de chompas,  venta de comida (chicharron) venta de caramelos y confección de faldas.
Liderizadas por su mesa directiva elaboran su reglamento interno,  ellas se reúnen en el Centro Focal German Busch.
texts.en:
Maria M. C. is 26 years old and a member of the Vicuna Community Association of Plata. She has worked selling cheese for the past 2 years in Ceja and the July 16th market; she needs this loan to buy more inventory. The other group members work in various businesses like: making shoes, weaving sweaters, selling food (chicharron), selling candy and making dresses. They are led by their board of directors who comes up with their bylaws; they meet in the German Busch Center.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Awadiss

texts.en: Awadiss is a 31-year old single man who lives Lebanon and has more than 10 years of experience working in the beauty industry. He has run a salon since 2007, and rents out spaces in which other people work. He specializes in hair color and highlights, and many people come to him when preparing for weddings and other important events. Most of his customers are friends and neighbors, and the main challenge he faces is raising sufficient capital for his small company. He has applied for a $1,000 loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, his first such request, to buy new chairs for his salon. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and acquire a larger space.

loans.use: To invest in new chairs for his salon.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is a 35-year old married man who lives in Lebanon. Since 2006, he has supported his wife and two children by  running a construction business which specializes in bricks and concrete. He has worked in this industry for 18 years, having learned the trade from his father, who encouraged him to take over the family business. He is proud of his competitive prices and honesty. His customers include people from his village and surrounding regions. His main challenge is raising enough capital for his company. He has applied for a $1,000 loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to help pay his children’s school fees and expand his business. This is his first loan request with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To pay for his children’s school fees and expand his business.

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
Kpana C. is the leader of Good Friends, a group made up of five borrowers. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 13 to 34 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. For the last year, she has made a living selling pepper, salt, onions and rice at the Stephen Tolbert Estate Market, which is located on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells her goods in a friendly, upbeat way, which keeps customers returning.  

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more pepper, rice onion and salt to sell to her customers. Her goal is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kpana is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more pepper, rice onion and salt to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emad

texts.en: Emad is a 43-year old married father. Through his work as a truck driver and tools salesmen, he helps provide for the four members of his family. He has owned his shop, in which he sells second-hand tools, since 1990 and has acquired a lot of experience in this field. His main customers include local auto-repair shops and junkyards. Initially, he faced many challenges to get his business going because of the large number of competitors, but he has been able to stay ahead in this field because he is flexible when making purchases for his business. He has requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This is his first loan request to Al Majmoua, and he plans to use the funds to increase his working capital and buy more tools to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and buy more tools to sell to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more red oil.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, who is 26 years old, has been selling water for a living for the past three years.  He is also employed in a construction company.  Since he joined a group called Negeu in Faulu Kenya, David has been able to save his money on a weekly basis, a development that has enabled him to increase his stock regularly, thereby improving the business.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy mineral water for sale, hoping to become a wholesale distributor in the future.  For this reason, he strives to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy mineral water for sale

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus, a 29-year-old married man, operates "The Top Designer’s" metal fabrication workshop where he manufactures collage seats, tables and office furniture.  He uses his income to pay wages to his employees, support his family and save money with Mwanzo Umoja group in Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, Justus has received two loans, repaying consistently.  He is now requesting a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy metal tubes, resins and a new drilling machine.  He hopes to expand his business and open many outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy metal tubes, resins and a drilling machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, a 37-year-old married  father of two children who go to school, practices dairy farming to earn a living, while his wife is a hair dresser.  He was previously employed in a hotel before he ventured into business.  Joseph joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Ikinu Rehema so that he could access working capital.  He successfully serviced his first loan which he used to buy a dairy cow, a purchase that marked his entry into dairy farming five years ago.  The hardworking Joseph is now requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy a dairy cow, and he hopes to construct a zero grazing unit with a capacity for carrying many cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mishack

texts.en:
Mishack is 37 years old and married with three children. He makes metallic grills, doors, windows, cookers and deep fryers and also does plumbing to earn a living.  He has been in this business for three years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya under Kuendelea Self Help Group, he has serviced one loan. He used the loan to boost his business and successfully repaid it. He managed to relocate his business from a slum to a permanent house in a different place. His business has improved tremendously and this has helped him provide a better education for his children.  

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy materials such as scrap metals. He hopes to purchase a piece of land in order to construct a home for the family in future.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 32-year-old single lady. She has been selling clothes for the past three years. She was formerly selling jewelry to earn a living. Blessed is the name of a group in Faulu Kenya (a Kiva partner) where Sarah saves her money. Being in this group has enabled her to service two loans from Faulu Kenya; this is because she is guaranteed by the group members.  

She has currently requested a loan of 44,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya. With this loan, she wants to add more stock of clothes. She hopes to employ more people in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a married man who has one child.  He is a businessman who operates a wholesale shop where he sells mobile phone airtime cards.  He was previously selling vehicle tyres and oil.  He has four years experience in his business.  He joined Matel group in Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend.  He was previously guaranteed a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to boost his business.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy mobile phone airtime cards.  He hopes to improve his living standards in the future.  For this reason, he works hard in his business.  He sees himself owning several shops in ten years.  He describes himself as confident and determined.

loans.use: To buy mobile airtime cards

loans.name: Edelira

texts.es:
La solicitante es la señora  Edelira M. quien se dedica a la  venta de ropas y calzados por toda la zona de Santani, y también vende en su propio domicilio donde tiene un pequeño salón comercial.
Es una persona responsable, muy trabajadora y posee buenas referencias comerciales  y personales.
La señora empezó a trabajar  hace aproximadamente 4 años en esta actividad.
Su deseo es tener un  local mas amplio para poder  atender mejor a sus clientes y satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de ellos.
Actualmente llega la temporada fría al país  y quiere comprar
ropas  para invierno como poleras, busos, camperas,      sueter, pantalones,  y otras prendas.
Para la compra de los artículos mencionados solicita el crédito, y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya  y Kiva por la ayuda crediticia que obtienen.
texts.en:
The person requesting the loan is Mrs. Edelira M. who sells clothing and shoes for a living all over the neighborhood of Santani. She also sells from her own home where she has a small store. She is a hard working, responsible person who has good business and personal references. The señora started this business about four years ago. She would like to have a bigger place to be able to take care of her customers better and satisfy each of their needs. The cold season is starting in her country and she wants to buy winter clothing like t-shirts, jackets, sweaters, pants, and other items. She is taking out a loan to buy the articles mentioned and thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their help with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, jackets, sweaters, and other things.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 42 years old and married to a teacher. She sells household goods, both in wholesale and retail. She was previously employed as a teacher before she started her business. 

She mainly earns her income by knitting sweaters and scarves. She gets her orders from schools. She joined Vision Corner self help group with Faulu Kenya, in order to access capital more easily. This is because the group members guarantee each other loans. So far, she has managed to service one loan from Faulu Kenya. She has applied for another loan, worth Kes. 40,000, from Faulu Kenya. She plans to buy knitting yarn, materials and accessories for knitting sweaters and scarves. She hopes to improve her business and create employment for the youth.

loans.use: To buy knitting yarn, materials and accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agyei Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Evans is a 28-year-old man who describes himself as trustworthy.  He is a father with one child who is 2 years old. He is a single father with hopes of providing his child with an education and a home. Evans has sold electrical gadgets from a street table for one year.  He will use the loan to purchase more electrical gadgets like cables, electric switches, plugs, fittings, etc., to meet his demand. He hopes to eventually expand and upgrade his business by opening his own electrical shop.  

Evans is currently the leader of the 'A. Solidarity Group'. The group was named after the leader. There are 4 members in this group.  The other members also operate trading businesses selling items such as foodstuff, cosmetics, groceries, used clothes, etc. They plan to use the loan to buy various stock to grow their business and be able to provide adequate financial support to their families.

loans.use: To purchase assorted electrical goods

loans.name: Best Friends Group

texts.en:
Mary A. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Best Friends. She is 50 years old, married and has six children. She was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For 20 years, she has been selling jean trousers, men's shirts and underclothes at the Stephen Tolbert Estate Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.  

She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 31,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more men's shirts, underclothes, and jean trousers. Her goal is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy men's shirts, underclothes, and jean trousers for resale

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es:
Flora M. G. de 45 años, viven en la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente en la zona Santa Rosa de Lima, hace 8 años aproximadamente. Flora se dedica a la venta de tostados (habas secas y tostadas) en dos ferias, una de ellas se llama Remedios y otra  Ingavi y necesita el préstamo para la compra de insumos.
Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Unión Progreso, que a su vez, pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, se dedican a diversas actividades económicas como la venta de frutas, venta de comida, confección de prendas de vestir, venta de higiénicos, y trenzado de mantas.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima.
texts.en:
Flora M. G. is 45 years old. She has lived in the city of El Alto in the Santa Rosa de Lima region for approximately eight years. Flora sells “tostados” (dried and toasted beans) at two fairs. One is called Remedios, and the other is Ingavi. She needs the loan to buy supplies. The other members of the Unión Progreso Communal Bank, which belongs to the German Busch community center, have diverse economic activities like selling fruit, selling food, making clothes, selling hygienic products, or blanket braiding. They all need the loan to acquire merchandise, supplies, or raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He has been baking and selling cakes to earn a living. He has been in this business for the past four years. He also makes artwork that he sells.

He was introduced to Kiambu Victory Group by a friend. In this group, he is able to save his money on weekly basis. The group members can also guarantee him in case he takes out a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of Kes. 50, 000 to buy an oven for baking cakes. He hopes to grow his business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy an oven for baking cakes

loans.name: Halleluya Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a 27-year-old man who describes himself as faithful and a good team leader. He is single and a visionary young man. For the past 8 years, Stephen has operated a trading business where he sells provisions, groceries like rice, cooking oil, canned drinks, washing soaps, etc. He dreams of becoming a wholesaler in groceries. He plans to use the loan to buy bags of rice and cooking oil to increase  his inventory with the hope of growing his business to support his young brothers in school.  

Currently, Stephen is the leader of the group named 'Halleluyah Solidarity Group'.  There are 8 members in this group.  The other members of the group are also traders, selling items such as foodstuffs, groceries, cooked foods and doing other petty trading. They anticipate receiving the loan to enable them to buy various stock to grow their business and be able to better support their families.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries in bulk

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 46-year-old man who owns a curio shop. He also does farming to earn a living. He has employed seven people in his curio shop so that he can concentrate on farming. 

He belongs to Turitu Uwezo group, where he saves his money on weekly basis. The group members have guaranteed him a loan of Kes. 50,000. With this loan, he wants to add raw materials for making curios, such as stones for carving and beads. He hopes to improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as stones for carving and beads

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 25 years old, married to a driver, and has one child. She has been selling malimali (assorted household goods) and second-hand clothes for three years. She also does dairy farming to earn extra income. She uses her income to support her family and also saves with a group in Faulu Kenya called Ikinu Genesis. She uses her savings to invest in business. 

She has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her inventory of clothes and household goods, which includes buckets, utensils, basins and cloth bins. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and household goods for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana ,de 50 años , es casada y tiene seis hijos. Reside en una localidad  ubicada en la selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa , que es propia .Desde muy joven Juana carga sacos de cacao, y aunque es un  trabajo de hombres, jamás tuvo vergüenza. Con el empuje que la caracteriza decidió incursionar en la actividad agrícola, en la  producción y comercialización de cacao.Siempre le gusto respetar la calidad de su producto, es por ello que ya tiene compradores potenciales. Su forma de trabajo es consecuencia de mucha dedicación en su terreno de cultivo, y le dedica 12 horas diarias, solo que los días domingo se da un descanso. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos, pero ocasionalmente tiene la ayuda de sus peones, en temporadas de cosecha. Normalmente vende su producto en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Juana reconoce que le falta mucho por recorrer, es por eso que para el  futuro espera comprar más terrenos para  producir otros productos como: café y frutas cítricas , con el propósito de poder diversificar su cartera de clientes.Este es tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y asegura que cumplirá fielmente como en sus anteriores pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal por la transparencia con la que trabaja.Juana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  insumos y abono, para  brindarle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in an area located in the Ayacuchana jungle, where she has her own house. Ever since she was young, Juan has been carrying sacks of cacao. Even though this is work for men, she has never been embarrassed. With her characteristic energy she decided to engage in farming, the production and sale of cacao. She has always respected the quality of her product. That is why she has potential buyers. The way she works is a consequence of much dedication to the land with her crops. She works 12 hours a day, and she only rests on Sundays. She generally works with her children, but sometimes she has the help of laborers during harvest time. She normally sells her products in the centers where people gather in her area. Juana recognizes that there is much to do. That is why she plans to buy more land in the future. She will produce other products like coffee and citrus fruits in order to be able to diversify her portfolio of customers. This is her third loan with MFP. She assures us that she will faithfully repay the loan like she did with her previous payments. She is grateful to her communal bank for the transparency in which it works. Juana will use the money she is requesting to buy supplies and fertilizer to provide adequate maintenance to her cacao crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
El señor Eligio, es propietario de una despensa y copetín(venta de comestibles y bebidas) en su propio domicilio, el es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha con toda su familia, para salir adelante de la mejor manera posible.
El negocio que el posee se encuentra bien surtida con todos los productos de consumo familiar, y es atendida generalmente por la esposa ya que el también se dedica a otras actividades como la agricultura.
El negocio se abrió en el 2005 y actualmente cuenta con una clientela formada que la conforman especialmente los vecinos.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar fideos, arroz, harina, lácteos, panificados, aceite,  para surtir mas su negocio y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Eligio is proprietor of a store selling provisions, including food and drinks, from his own home. He is a hard-working person who struggles together with his family to get ahead in the best manner possible. Eligio's business is well supplied with all the products a family might consume. It is attended generally by his wife, since he also dedicates himself to other activities, including agriculture. The business opened in 2005 and actually, it can count on a clientèle made up primarily of neighbors. Eligio is requesting a loan to purchase beans, rice, wheat flour, milk products, bakery items, and cooking oil, to better stock his business and thus, satisfy the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BEANS, RICE, WHEAT FLOUR, MILK PRODUCTS, FRUIT AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 35-year-old married man who has four children who go to school.  He has been doing metal fabrication for two years and has employed three people.  He makes and sells window frames, door frames and metallic chairs.  He belongs to Budea SHG group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loans.  Since he joined the group, he has managed to purchase a welding machine and open up a workshop.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy metal bars.  He hopes to open up another workshop in the future.

loans.use: To buy metal bars

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha del Socorro D. V., tiene la edad de 43 años habita con  su compañero de vida en el Barrio la Primavera de Managua, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y un menor de 10 añitos, el señor labora como cargador, brindando a un aporte económico a los gastos diarios, la señor posee una pulpería, siendo este el principal ingreso familiar.

La variación de precio de los productos no le ha permitido en varias ocasiones buenas utilidades, que favorezcan a  su estilo de vida, fue con la ayuda de su familia y marido que económicamente le apoyaron y con un financiamiento, abrió su negocio hace ya 7 años, los planes del negocio, es la venta de ropa y calzado de segunda mano, debido a que la demanda de estos productos hoy en día en Nicaragua es alta, es por tal razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos para su negocio, una inversión de esta magnitud permitiría un aumento en las ventas, favoreciendo sus niveles de vida y la satisfacción de brindarle a sus hijos mejores condiciones socio-económicas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtha del Socorro is 43 years old and lives with her life companion in the Primavera (Spring) barrio of Managua. They have 3 children, of whom 2 are adult and 1 is a minor, aged 10. Her companion works as a porter, helping with their daily expenses. Mirtha has a general store which is the principal source of family income. Variations in product prices have not permitted good profits, on various occasions, and this has harmed their standard of living. In the past, aid has come from her family and her husband. With a loan, she opened her store some 7 years ago. Plans for her used-clothing and used-shoes store resulted from the fact that demand for these items remains high in Nicaragua. That's why she is requesting a loan for purchasing a greater inventory of products for her store. An investment of this magnitude should permit an increase in sales, elevating their standard of living, and offering the satisfaction of better socioeconomic conditions for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO SUPPLY HER 2ND-HAND STORE

loans.name: Conquistadores De Tapana Group

texts.en:
Norma, Silvia and Marisol are members of the village bank "Los Conquistadores Tapana", which begins its first loan cycle with 18 members.

Norma lives with her two children who are eight and two years old. She has separated from her partner because he abused her. Norma received a loan of PEN 500 for salt and small animals for her business. Ever since she was a little girl Norma has worked and built up savings by buying and selling small animals to her neighbors. Norma is expecting her business and life to change significantly as she progresses as a member of FINCA and gets the chance to learn how to save her money, take care of her community, and attend various training sessions offered. Norma is dreaming of having a large guinea pig farm someday.

Silvia is married and has two children who are also eight and two years old. Silvia was granted a loan of PEN 200 to use for her business, selling grains and small animals. Silvia has suffered greatly since childhood, becoming an orphan at the young age of eight. She bought grains to start a business and move forward and decided to join FINCA to learn to save her money and because she likes the training sessions and workshops. Silvia expects that her life will change as a member of FINCA and that she will learn to appreciate herself as a woman. Silvia dreams of owning a small grocery store.

Marisol is married and has three children who are two months, four and six years old. She has struggled since the father of her children abandoned them. She used her PEN 200 loan to purchase more chickens for her business. Marisol is grateful to FINCA because she will now have life insurance (FINCA Vida) and will have more capital for her business. Marisol is excited to learn how to save her money and invest it in her business. She dreams of having a larger chicken business.

loans.use: Buying small animals to re-sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene un taller de confección de mantas y polleras que comercializa en su tienda que esta ubicada en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Ana es madre soltera de dos hijos de 15 y 4 años de edad y vive en alquiler en la zona Villa Esperanza de la misma ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (compra de tela) para confeccionar mantas y polleras y de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su mercado.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación de otro préstamo para Ana.
texts.en:
Ana has a workshop where she makes blankets and traditional Bolivian skirts that she sells in her shop, which is located in the market "16 de Julio," in the city of El Alto. Ana is a single mother of two children who are 15 and 4 years old, and she lives in a rented home in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials (to buy fabric) to make blankets and traditional skirts. In this way she can satisfy the quantity demanded in her market. This is her 4th loan with IMPRO, and as a result of her good payment history Ana is approved for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric for her business making blankets and traditional skirts

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La  señora Lourdes, es de San Estanislao, tiene casa propia.
Es propietaria de una tienda de ropas, que esta ubicada en el mercado de la ciudad, con 10 años de funcionamiento, con clientela formada y un buenas ventas, ya que tiene buenos precios y calidad sus mercaderìas, tambien el buen trato con los clientes.
Desea ampliar su local para poder tener màs variedad de ropas y otras cosa que los clientes solicitan para ello queire obtener el préstmo y así invirtir en la compra de ropas.
texts.en:
La señora Lourdes is from San Estanislao and owns her home. She is the proprietor of a clothing store, which is located in the plaza of the city. The store has regular customers, good sales, and has been open for 10 years. Also, la señora Lourdes takes good care of her customers and offers very reasonable prices and high quality of merchandise. She wishes to expand her premises and offer more variety of clothing and other things that her customers request. She would like to invest this loan in clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jeans, T-shirts, sundresses, blouses, and other items

loans.name: Primavera De Cachi Baja Group

texts.es:
Bertha, Alicia y Eulalia son 3 socias D. las 22 que tienen el Bancomunal Primavera D. Cachi Baja, ubicado en el departamenteo D. Huancavelica.

Bertha es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Bertha se dedica a L. venta D. sal y granos a granel los cuales traslada hasta L. capital para su venta. Bertha necesita un préstamo para poder comprar más granos y  venderlos. Quiere empezar a ahorrar para poder tener una pequeña empresa D. crianza D. cuyes.

Alicia es casada y tiene 02 hijos pequeños, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. hierbas D. distintas variedades, las cuales recolecta D. madrugada, hace secar y las venD. por kilos. Alicia, requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual quiere comprar mas hierbas y así hacer crecer su negocio. Alicia quiere empezar a ahorrar, para así poder comprar un máquina para secar las hierbas

Eulalia es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Eulalia se dedica a L. venta D. sal, granos y hierbas. Las cuales recolecta en su comunidad y traslada a L. capital para su venta. Eulalia, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual aumentara L. cantidad D. sus productos y le generará mayores ingresos. Eulalia tiene como primera meta el ahorrar para comprarse un auto y así trasladar su mercadería hasta L. capital.
texts.en:
Bertha, Alicia, and Eulalia are three of the twenty-two members of the Primavera D. Cachi Baja Community Bank which is located in Huancavelica department. Bertha is married and has five children. Her job is selling salt and grains in bulk which she takes to the capital city to sell. Bertha needs a loan to buy more grains to sell. She wants to begin saving money so she can start a small business raising guinea pigs. Alicia is married and has two small children. She sells herbs which she gathers at dawn, dries them, and sells them by the kilo. Alicia needs a loan to buy more herbs and expand her business. She wants to begin saving for a machine that dries herbs. Eulalia is married and has five children. She sells salt, grains, and herbs. She gathers the herbs in her community and takes them to the capital to sell. Eulalia needs a loan so she can increase the number of products she sells and thus earn more money. Her primary goal is to save enough money to buy a vehicle to use for transporting her merchandise to the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her grain-selling business

loans.name: Sabath Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 36-year-old man who describes himself as smart.  He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 1 and 10 years old. For the past 3 years, Nicholas has operated a trading business where he sells cassette tapes and compact discs.  He plans to use the loan to buy compact discs and cassette tapes in bulk.  Nicholas’ ambitious future goals include owning his own recording studio and a house in Kumasi.  Kumasi is the second largest city in Ghana and is known as the cultural center of Ghana.  

Currently, Nicholas is the leader of the group named 'Sabbath Solidarity Group'.  Nicholas believes he was elected group leader because he is a good coordinator.  There are 6 members in this group.  The other group members are traders and food processors. They anticipate receiving the loan to enable them to buy various kinds of stock to grow their business and provide adequate support to their families.

loans.use: To purchase cassette tapes and DCs in bulk

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina ,de 55 años, es madre soltera y tiene seis hijos. Reside en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia.Recuerda muy bien que tenía pocos recursos económicos, y solo le alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, además tenía una pequeña parcela, en donde producía y comercializaba cacao , pero sus ventas no le generaban buenas ganancias. En la actualidad  tiene un terreno de cultivo, en donde produce cacao y café en grandes cantidades, y ya tiene una buena cantidad  de clientes con los que trabaja de manera conjunta, es por esta razón que se  que se siente satisfecha con su trabajo.Además ya lleva trabajando 39 años de manera constante y con buenos resultados, para lograrlo  siempre tuvo la ayuda de sus hijos y ocasionalmente sus peones, en temporada de cosecha. Normalmente trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde . Generalmente comercializa  sus productos en los centros de acopio de sus comunidad, no obstante, para más adelante anhela  ampliar su terreno de cultivo con la finalidad de satisfacer a sus clientes.Este es su segundo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente  con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal.Justina invertirá el dinero solicitado  para comprar fertilizantes,  y otra parte la destinará para  cubrir los constantes gastos universitarios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Justina is a single mother and has six children. She lives in her own home, in a town located in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle. She knows very well that she has few economic resources and that she only uses them to pay for necessities. She also had a small plot of land, on which she cultivated cocoa, but her sales of cocoa did not generate a good income. Now she has a plot where she cultivates cocoa and coffee in large quantities, and she also has a good number of customers among those she works with. For this reason, she is satisfied with her work. She has been working steadily for 39 years with good results; to achieve this, she always had the help of her children, and occasionally the help of farm workers, at harvest time. She normally works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Generally, she sells her products at the street market of her community. Nevertheless, for the future, she yearns to expand her cultivated land with the goal of satisfying her customers. This is her second loan from MFP (local lending institution), and she is committed to making timely repayments. She is also satisfied with the work of her communal bank. Justina will invest the loan proceeds in fertilizers and will also use part of the proceeds to pay the ongoing university expenses of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and pay the university expenses of her son

loans.name: Joy Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Akua is a 47-year-old woman who describes herself as trustworthy.  She is married to a cocoa farmer and has 6 children between the ages of 9 and 25 years old.  Akua and her husband hope to provide their children with a good education and build a home for their family. For the past 25 years, Akua has operated a business selling vegetables and fruit.  Akua also manufactures local soap for washing clothes.  She will use the loan to purchase more vegetables and fruit such as tomatoes, garden eggs (or eggplant), and also buy more ingredients for her soap-making business.
 
Akua is currently the leader of the group named 'Joy Trust Bank Group'.  She believes she was elected as the group leader because she is a good organizer.  There are 9 members in this group.  The other members include 'kenkey' food processors, soap manufacturers, and maize traders.  'Kenkey' is a local dish prepared from maize, cooked and eaten with pepper sauce and fish. They plan to use the loan to buy food ingredients and other stock to grow their business and be able to adequately support their families.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Hector Ruben

texts.es:
Hector de 66 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, es viudo pero tiene tres hijos de 30, 29 y 26 años. Hector trabajaba por 40 años en una joyería, pero al morir su esposa el decidió independizarse y poner un negocio de limpieza de joyería en su casa.

El ahora trabaja como limpiador de joyería de bronce en su casa, su trabajo lo hace artesanalmente con ayuda de sus hijos, por limpiar anillos le pagan $ 3.00, cadenas $ 5.00, pulseras $ 3.00. Trabaja desde muy temparno hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar laminas de bronce, hileras y herramientas nuevas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos tengan sus propios negocios.
texts.en:
Hector, 66, lives in an urban neighborhood in the outskirts of Guayaquil. He is a widow, but has three children who are 30, 29, and 26 years old. Hector worked for 40 years in a jewelry store, but after the death of his wife he decided to become independent so he put a jewelry cleaning business in his home. He now works cleaning brass jewelry in his home. He does the work by hand with the help of his children. They pay him $3.00 to clean rings, $5.00 to clean chains, and $3.00 to clean bracelets. He works from very early in the morning until the evening. With the loan he wants to buy sheets of brass, wire draw plates, and other new tools for his business. In the future he wants his children to have their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheets of brass and wire draw plates

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Eugenio,  él  tiene 60 años de edad es casado y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales el último tiene 13 años de edad, Nuestro socio sigue al cuidado permanente de sus tierras de cultivo, él socio tiene terrenos de cultivo de papa y en la época de heladas las deshidrata naturalmente para hacer chuño, que es un plato típico acompañado con queso fundido; Nuestros socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes de Cusco y llevarlos a su tierra que se encuentra a 4 horas y 40 minutos desde Cusco y el servicio de transporte hacia esta comunidad no es fluido por lo que el debe esperar los fines de semana para movilizarse.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Pacaha Illariy communal bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha, Ocongate district, in the Quispicanchis province of the department of Cusco. Our member's name is Mr. Eugenio. He is 60 and married with seven children, the youngest of whom is 13 years old. He works year-round in the cultivation of his farmlands, where he grows crops of potatoes. During the winter, he dehydrates the potatoes using a natural process in order to make potato flour, a typical dish that is served with melted cheese. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers in Cusco to transport back to his farmlands, which are located 4 hours and 40 minutes away. The transport service between the two isn't frequent, so he has to wait for the weekends to make the trips. Eugenio is thankful and appreciative of the support offered through this medium and he is committed to achieving timely repayment of his debt.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in Cusco and transport them to his farmlands.

loans.name: Charles Obure

texts.en: Charles Obure O. is 35 years old and married with three children, living in Migori. Before he became a driver in 1996, he worked as a farmer, but did not do very well. Despite his Matatu business generating income, it is not enough to pay school fees for his child who is in high school. Charles would like to get a loan for Ksh.30000 to assist him in paying school fees. His dream is someday he will have financial independence.

loans.use: payment of school fees for child

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, de 56 años, es soltero y tiene cinco hijos. Vive en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana del Perú, donde tiene su casa que es propia .En la actualidad la localidad donde vive, se encuentra en  pleno auge económico, es por esta razón que encontró un buen mercado para comercializar, para cubrir sus necesidades insatisfechas, y empezó a producir  cacao desde muy joven. En la actualidad siembra  dos productos mas que son el café y la hoja de de coca.Modesto siempre ha sido consecuente con sus objetivos trazados, aunque tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades , jamás  se amilanó y así aprendió buenas lecciones en la vida. Su horario de trabajo empieza a  partir de las 7 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde ; y por lo general  trabaja solo , pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Aunque los años pasan, él sigue  con esas mismas fuerzas, desde su juventud, es por esta razón que en el futuro desea  vender  sus productos en otras comunidades para minimizar el tiempo y costo de traslado de sus productos.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y se  compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos puntualmente , además trabaja en armonía junto a su grupo comunal, por el apoyo incondicional que lo otorgan.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  productos finales de cacao, y café,  a otros productores, con el propósito de mejorar su margen de utilidad.
texts.en:
Modesto, 56, is single and has five children. They live in their home located in Peru’s beautiful Ayacucho backcountry. The area where he lives in is currently undergoing an economic boom, so he finds a good market for sales there that will make it possible for him to cover his unmet needs. He started farming cocoa beans as a young man. He currently farms two additional products: coffee and coca leaves. Modesto has always been conscientious about his set objectives although he did go through some tough times. However, he didn’t become discouraged and learned good life lessons. His work schedule starts at 7am and continues until 6pm. He usually works alone but sometimes gets help from his family. As years go by he continues with the same strength as when he was young and would like to sell his products in other communities in the future in order to reduce the time spent and the costs of transporting his products. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Besides, he works harmoniously with his fellow communal bank members and appreciates the mutual support they provide. He will use the funds to buy harvested cocoa beans and coffee as well as other products in order to improve his profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Fátima

texts.en:
Mrs. Fátima G. A. was born in the city of Carapeguá and lives there now with her mother. She is dedicated to her business, selling clothes.
Having a good quantity of clients has helped her to increase her income and thanks to this she has now been able to work toward her aspiration of building a house.

She has received a loan from our institution that she has used for the construction of her house and this loan that she is now requesting will also go towards finishing the construction.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cements, wood and other products for building of her home

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Paulino, él  tiene 42 años de edad es casado y tiene  4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos tienen  15 y 13 años de edad, Nuestro socio se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, nuestro socio tiene terrenos de cultivos y también tiene 3 toritos y una vaca; él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para sus tierras y comprar una vaquita.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate, Mr. Paulino belongs to the Communal Bank "Pacaha Illariy." Our associate lives in the community of Llullucha, Ocongate District in the Quispicanchis Province, in the state of Cusco. Our associate is Mr. Paulino. He is 42 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are 15 and 13 years old. Our associate is devoted to agriculture and cattle. He has cultivated land, 3 young bulls and a cow. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizing agenda and fertilizer for his land, and to buy a calf. Our associate appreciates and values the help provided by these means, and he promises to complete payment of his debt by the established deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his land and to buy a calf

loans.name: Yarkamah Group

texts.en:
Lucy V. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Yarkamah #2. Lucy is 43 years old, married and has four children who range in ages from seven to 29 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For two years, she has been selling bowls, spoons, glasses, and cups at Golf Market in Garnersville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more stock to re-sell. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lucy is the borrower holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more bowls, cups, glasses and spoons to re-sell

loans.name: Rita María

texts.es:
señora Rita María S. es soltera de 42 años habita con sus dos hijos mayores de edad en el peligroso Barrio Laureles Norte conocido por  la delincuencia en la que se habita, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años, rubro que se ha fortalecido en los últimos años debido a  la crisis mundial y los problemas económicos de Nicaragua que no permiten  a la población la compra de prendas de vestir nuevas por el alto costo en las que se ofertan.

Ella comenzó con su tienda comprando de poco a poco mercadería, hasta que observo las buena demanda que existe y se arriesgo con  un préstamo en la compra de pacas  y ventas al por mayor, ahora nuevamente solicita de un nuevo préstamo para la reinversión a su negocio en la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que mejore aun mas su estabilidad económica y  su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rita María S., 42, is single and lives with her two adult children in a dangerous neighborhood, Laureles Norte, known for its high crime rate. She has sold used clothing for the past 3 years; an occupation that has strengthened in the last few years due to the world financial crisis and Nicaragua’s economic problems that keep the population from buying new clothing because of the high prices being asked for them. She began her store with little merchandise but, as she noted that demand was good, she risked getting a loan to buy bundles of clothing and to sell at wholesale. Now, she is once again asking for funds to reinvest in her business buying larger amounts of stock inventory so that her economic stability as well as her standard of living will improve still more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Our Father #2 Group

texts.en:
Kulah G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our Father #2.  Kulah is 37 years old and married with two children, aged eight and 14 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For 16 years, Kulah has been selling rice, slippers and lappas (traditional wrap-around clothing) at the Stephen Tolbert Estate Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  

She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more stock to re-sell. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kulah is the borrower holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more lappas, slippers and rice to re-sell

loans.name: Fuseini Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Fuseini is a 38-year-old man who describes himself as hard-working.  He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 6 and 11 years old. Fuseini has been trading in livestock for the past 16 years.  He will use the loan to buy more sheep, goats and cattle to supply restaurant operators. Fuseini hopes to eventually own his own slaughter house.  His future family goals include building a home.

Fuseini is the leader of the group 'Fuseini Solidarity Group', named after the leader.  He believes he was selected as group leader because he is a team player.  There are three members in this group.  The other members are also traders in food and clothing. They plan to use the loan to buy stock to grow their businesses to enable them to support their families better.

loans.use: To purchase to more sheep, goats and cattle

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Odilia, de 56 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa propia.Odilia siempre piensa en mejorar el buen servicio hacia al cliente,en el tiempo de entrega de sus productos , compromiso y responsabilidad;  eso sin desmerecer la calidad del producto. Esa fue la estrategia de Odilia frente a sus competidores, pues tiene su puesto de carne en un mercado de la ciudad , y percibe  buenos ingresos en su negocio . Aún quiere mejorar mucho más, es por esta razón que les viene inculcando a sus hijos sobre las técnicas de ventas, además de la manera de cosechar las tierras . Usualmente ella trabaja sola , pero ocasionalmente cuenta con la ayuda  de sus peones, para que trasladen su productos a los centros de acopio de su comunidad, con la finalidad de venderlos a buen precio. Su trabajo empieza  desde las 7 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde , y solo los fines de semana se dedica por entero a su familia. En el  futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de carne y también desea  ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de aumentar su volumen de producción, por lo tanto calcula que incrementará su grado de rentabilidad.Este es su tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente en confianza con su grupo comunal, por la buena comunicación y organización que existe  entre todos los integrantes.Odilia tiene planeado  invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ganado, con la finalidad  de ofrecer la carne a un buen precio para satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Odilia, 56, is a single mother; she lives with her two children in their own home located in Ayacucho’s backcountry. Odilia is always looking for ways to improve customer service, to deliver orders on time with responsibility and commitment without compromising product quality. That was Odilia’s strategy with respect to her competitors. She has a butcher shop installed in one of the city’s markets and earns good income from it. She wants to improve it still more and is teaching her children selling techniques and how to farm the land. She usually works alone but sometimes hires field hands to transport her products to the community wholesale centers in order to sell at good prices. Her work day begins at 7am and continues until 6pm; she only has weekends to entirely devote to her family. She plans to expand her meat business in the future by increasing production volume which she calculates will increase profits. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion; she feels comfortable with her communal group because of the good organization and communication that exists among them. Odilia plans to use the requested funds to buy cattle with the purpose in mind to offer the meat to her customers at good prices.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Reinaldo Maximiliano

texts.es:
Reinaldo Crespín de 58 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene cuatro hijos de 31, 27, 25, 18 años. Reinaldo antes trabajaba en un taller de costura, pero al ver sus hijos el cansancio y la necesidad de su papa de tener su propio negocio desde su casa decidieron comprarle una maquina de coser industrial. 

Por la ayuda que sus hijos le dieron ahora el tiene su propio taller de costura en la sala de su casa, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm, por el arreglo de camisetas cobrar $ 5.00, pantalones $ 15.00, calentadores $ 9.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar dos maquinas de coser, y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Reinaldo Crespín, 58, lives in an urban area of El Suburbio, Guayaquil; he has four children who are 31, 25, 25 and 18 years old. Reynaldo used to work in a tailor shop but, when his children saw how exhausted he was and that he needed to have his own home-based business, they decided to buy him an industrial sewing machine. Thanks to the help from his children, he has his own tailor shop in his house. His wife helps him and they are open for business from 8am until 10pm. He charges $5.00 for shirt repairs, $15.00 for pants and $9.00 for legwarmers. He will use the funds to buy fabrics and thread. He would like to buy two sewing machines in the future and make improvements to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Eliseo, él  tiene 35 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, Nuestro socio trabaja sus terrenos de cultivo, el socio también hace trabajos de construcción, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su caja personal de trabajo.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Pacaha Illariy communal bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha, Ocongate district, in the Quispicanchis province of the department of Cusco. Our member's name is Mr. Eliseo. He is 35 years old and married with two children, who are ages 10 and 5. He works cultivating farmlands, and he also works in construction. He is requesting a loan to buy tools for his toolbox. Eliseo is thankful and appreciative of the support offered through this medium and he is committed to achieving timely repayment of his debt.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his toolbox.

loans.name: Alejandro Jot

texts.es: Alejandro Jot tiene 43 años de edad, su actividad económica es una panadería. Don Alejandro tenía este sueño desde hace 5 años, pues desde muy joven él tenía en mente obtener este negocio que sería su medio de vida, por lo que su trabajo inicia desde muy temprano a las 4 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, por lo que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para sufragar los gastos de su familia, pues además cuando tiene que salir a realizar la entrega de sus productos es muy agotador Alejandro trabaja muy duro para llevar dinero a su vivienda. El solicita este crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, sal, mantequilla entre otros productos. Su deseo es obtener otro medio de transporte para realizar las entregas en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Alejandro Jot is 43 years old, and he has a bakery. Alejandro has had this dream for five years. Ever since he was young he had in mind getting this business as his means of support. His work starts very early, at four in the morning, and works until seven at night. He has always worked very hard to pay the family expenses. Also, when he leaves to deliver his products it is very exhausting. Alejandro works very hard to bring money home. He is requesting this loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, salt, and butter, among other products. His wish is to get another means of transportation to make deliveries in due time and in proper form.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teodolinda Helena

texts.es:
Teodolinda Helena H. P., es casada, madre de 4 hijos, mujer de 52 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su esposo es mesero y apoya a los gastos mensuales en los que incurre la familia.

Uno de los principales problemas en los que se ha enfrentado en su labor, es la retención de los productos debido al cambio de moda, que no le permite la venta de la mercadería, fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien logro ahorrar para la compra de producots que comenzaron sus días en este rubro, dentro de los principales objetivos esta la apertura de una pequeña tienda donde ofertar ropa, cosméticos y calzado, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario que aumenten las ventas y mejoren sus utilidades y favoreciendo a sus niveles de vida que beneficien a toda su familia y brinden capital de trabajo para nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Teodolinda Helena H. P. is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She sells cosmetics, and her husband is a waiter. She contributes toward the monthly household expenses and incidentals. One of the main problems she has faced in her work is retention of the same product lines due to changing trends, which interferes with sales. It was thanks to the help of her husband, who managed to save up for the purchase of these products, that they could begin this line of work. Among Teodolinda's principal objectives is the opening of a small store where she plans to offer clothing, cosmetics and footwear for sale. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more inventory to increase sales and to improve profits. This will improve her whole family's standard of living and will bring in more working capital for new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Able God #1 Group

texts.en:
Morris T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Able God #1.  He is 42 years old, married and has four children who range from 8 to 17 years old.  He was only able to attend school to 11th grade due to poverty.


For 3 years, Morris has been selling shoes and plastic bags at the Chicken Soup Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.  He sells in a friendly manner which keeps his customers coming back.  
He plans to use his LRD 8,000 portion of this LRD 40,000 group loan to buy more plastic bags and shoes. His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Morris is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bags and shoes.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de  32 años, convive con su pareja y tiene tres pequeños  hijos. Reside en una  comunidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa propia.Desde muy joven,se dedica a la agricultura , y durante buen tiempo aprendió bien  las técnicas necesarias para obtener una cosecha productiva. En la actualidad produce de manera eficiente y eficaz el cacao, por el cual obtiene buenas ganancias económicas, a tal punto que en el futuro piensa ampliar su terreno de cultivo, adquiriendo otros tan productivos como el que tiene,  con la finalidad de producir a gran escala económica. Por lo general  vende sus productos  en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a precio competitivo. En la labor Rebeca tiene la ayuda de su pareja, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha cuenta con la ayuda  de sus peones que le facilitan la extracción de su producto final.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos obligaciones, además hace hincapié a su banco comunal por la veracidad y honestidad que tienen cada uno de los socios.Con el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en darle un mejoramiento de sus plantaciones de cacao, adquiriendo abono e insumos, con la finalidad de mejorar sus producción.
texts.en:
Rebeca, age 32, lives with her life partner and her three small children. She lives in a community located in the beautiful Ayachuchan jungle, where she has her own house. She has been farming since she was very young. In good time she learned the necessary techniques to get a productive harvest. She currently produces cacao in an efficient and effective way, and she gets good income. At some point in the future she plans to increase her planting fields. She will get others that are as productive as what she has. She will do this in order to produce on a large economic scale. She generally sells her products in the community centers where people gather, and she sells at a competitive price. Rebeca’s life partner helps her with the work. During planting and harvesting seasons she gets help from laborers who facilitate the extraction of her final product. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She promises to meet her respective obligations. She stresses that each one of the members of her communal bank is truthful and honest. She will use the money she is requesting to make improvements to her cacao plants. She will get fertilizer and supplies in order to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and supplies to improve her crops

loans.name: Grupo Brillante Group

texts.es:
El grupo de mujeres decidió llamarse “Grupo Brillante” porque están seguras que van lograr que sus pequeños negocios crezcan ciclo con ciclo, está integrado por once brillantes mujeres que en base al esfuerzo que le dedican a sus negocios están seguras sacarán a delante a sus familias. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Pachuca, Hidalgo.

la Sra. Rosa M. de 64 años, divorciada, sus hijos ya no dependen de ella, pues ya cada uno de ellos tomo su propio camino; desde hace 30 se dedica a la venta de colchas, sabanas y productos de belleza por catalogo la cual se encarga de surtir a sus vecinas, familiares y amigos los productos que vende, gracias al apoyo de sus hijos a logrado vender también en diferentes oficinas del gobierno, así que cuenta con un buen número de clientes.

En el caso de la Sra. María Lucia Hernández la cual se casó y es madre desde los 17 años ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven, actualmente tiene 26 años y tiene ya  3 hijos uno de 9 años,  de 7 años y de 3 años respectivamente. La Sra. Mary como sus vecinos la conocen comienza a trabajar desde las 3pm para poner a cocer los elotes y realizar los esquites que vende día con día, ella espera darle una vida mejor a su familia.

Ambas señoras tienen diferentes historias, pero algo que tienen en común es que luchan a diario para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
M. R. ROSA	        VENTA DE COLCHAS Y SABANAS
B. M. NORMA	        VENTA DE ZAPATOS, ORO Y PLATA
ANGELES MONSALVO ROSA MARIA	COCINA ECONOMICA
H. H. CIRILA	VENTA DE PLATA
H. V. MARIA LUCIA	VENTA DE ELOTES Y ESQUITES
M. H. MARIA ELENA	VENTA DE COLCHAS
S. M. BLANCA ROSA	VENTA DE AVON Y COLCHAS
S. R. JUANA VIVIANA	VENTA DE ZAPATOS Y LENCERIA
G. A. VALENTINA	ESTETICA
D. V. NAYELY	        RECAUDERIA
T. A. PATRICIA	        VENTA DE ZAPATO
texts.en:
This group of women decided to call themselves the “Grupo Brillante” or "Bright Group" because they are sure that their small business will grow with each loan cycle. The members are eleven bright women who are sure that they will put their families on the right track with the effort they put into their businesses. They live in the city of Pachuca, Hidalgo. Rosa M. is 64 years old. She is divorced and her children no longer depend on her, as each of them has already gone down his or her own path in life. For 30 years, Rosa has worked selling bedspreads, sheets and beauty products by catalog. She sells a variety of products to friends, neighbors and family members. Thanks to the support of her children she has also been able to make sales in various government buildings, so she has a good number of clients. María Lucia Hernández, who is married and became a mother at 17, has had to work hard from a young age. She is now 26 years old and has 3 children who are 9, 7, and 3 years old. "Mrs. Mary," as she is known to her neighbors, starts work at 3pm cooking ears of corn and making the esquites [a dish made with corn cut off the cob] that she sells each day. She hopes to make a better life for her family. Both of these women have different stories, but what they have in common is that every day they fight to improve their quality of life. The other members of the group, listed with their businesses, are: ROSA M. R. (sale of bedspreads and sheets) NORMA B. M. (sale of shoes, gold and silver) ROSA MARIA ANGELES MONSALVO (food sales) CIRILA H. H. (sale of silver) MARIA LUCIA H. V. (sale of corn products) MARIA ELENA M. H. (sale of bedspreads) BLANCA ROSA S. M. (Avon sales and sale of bespreads) JUANA VIVIANA S. R. (sale of shoes and lingerie) VALENTINA G. A. (beautician) NAYELY D. V. (owner of a small grocery store) PATRICIA T. A. (shoe sales)

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Juana,  ella tiene 37 años de edad es casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales sus últimos hijos tienen 5 años y 8 meses de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende verduras y frutas en el mercado local de la comunidad; La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor para la semana y algunas frutas que llegaron a la comunidad en camiones.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Pacaha Illariy community bank. Our member lives in the community of Llullucha, in the Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, in Cusco. Our member is Juana. She is 37 years old, is married and has four children. The youngest are 5 years old and 8 months old. Our member alternates her work in the home with retail. She buys and sells produce and fruit in the community's local market. She is requesting a loan to buy produce at wholesale for the week and some fruit that arrived in the community in trucks. She is thankful and values the support provided in this manner and promises to meet her debt payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy produce at wholesale.

loans.name: Frankling Antonio

texts.es: Franklin Antonio es un joven muy luchador y que disfruta de su trabajo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de moto taxi. Tiene más de 3 años de realizar este tipo de trabajo, él tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo pues como padre responsable tiene que proporcionarles lo más necesario. Sus inicios fueron muy difíciles pues no tenía suficiente capital para empezar este negocio fue con ahorros propios  y con algunos financiamientos que salió adelante. el solicita este financiamiento para la compra de brindarle mejoras a su moto y así ofrecer un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Franklin Antonio is an extremely hardworking young man who enjoys his work running a taxi service. He’s been doing this for more than three years. He has two young children in his care, and as a responsible father he has to provide them with whatever is necessary. Life was very difficult for him at first as he didn’t have enough money to begin this business. However, with his own savings and some financing he got it going. He is now asking for a loan to make improvements to his vehicle so he can offer an excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Leoncio,  él socio tiene 35 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos y él trabaja como porteador en el camino inka y cuando no está en camino inka él es albañil; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprarse mochila para sus viajes y zapatos.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Pacaha Illariy". He lives in the community of Llullucha, Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. His name is Leoncio. He is 35 years old and lives with his girlfriend and three children. He works as a porter on the Inca Road, and when he's not on the road he works as a mason. He is seeking this loan to buy a backpack for his travels and shoes. He is grateful for the support from this loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase backpack for traveling and shoes

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Gregorio,  él socio tiene 31 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestro socio  trabaja como albañil y en algunas ocasiones va de porteador al camino inka y al nevado de Ausangate, Nuestro socio trabaja muy duro para poder construir su casa y dar a su familia mejor calidad de vida. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas y víveres para su hogar.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
