This member belongs to the "Pacaha Illariy" communal bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha in Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. His name is Gregorio. He is 31 years old and lives with his girlfriend and two children. He works as a mason and sometimes as a porter on the Inca Trail and to the snowy mountain of Ausangate. He works very hard to be able to build a house and give his family a better life. He is seeking this loan to buy tools and food for his home. He is grateful for the support from the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and food for his home

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos, dos de los cuales aún estudian, en el centro poblado Chosica del Norte, distrito de La Victoria, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella tiene en su casa un horno artesanal en el cual elabora pan, desde hace mas de tres años su familia se sostiene económicamente con esta actividad, su esposo solía trabajar como obrero de construcción civil, pero debido a su avanzada edad tuvo que dejar su trabajo y retomar su oficio de panadero.

Gregoria trabaja junto a su esposo desde las 6 de la tarde hasta muy avanzada la noche amasando los ingredientes para la elaboración del pan, luego lo hornean en la madrugada para sacarlo a la venta. Todos los días, a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana, dos jóvenes y sus dos hijos menores salen a repartir pan en algunas bodegas y viviendas de la zona, luego sus dos hijos van a la escuela, ella también vende pan por las mañanas en la esquina de su casa.

Gregoria ya había trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, ella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas que en aquella oportunidad le ayudaron a mantener su negocio ante el incremento del precio de los insumos que necesitaba, a raíz de ese préstamo,su negocio empezó a crecer y desde entonces pudo contratar a los dos jóvenes que le ayudan a captar mas clientes y seguir creciendo como empresaria. Actualmente ella ha solicitado nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para seguir ampliando su panadería.

Con las ganancias percibidas Gregoria ha podido avanzar en la construcción de su casa, lo que la pone orgullosa, ella sigue trabajando para que sus dos últimos hijos puedan estudiar alguna carrera técnica, ella es una mujer honesta y muy querida por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 55-year old mother who lives with her husband and five children, two of whom are still in school. They live in the neighbourhood of Chosica del Norte, in the district of Victoria, located about ten minutes from Chiclayo. Gregoria has a homemade oven in her home in which she has been baking bread for the past three years. She supports her family with the income from this work. Her husband used to work in construction, but as he got older he had to stop and return to his job as a baker. Gregoria and her husband work from six in the evening to late at night mixing together the ingredients for the bread which they then bake in the early hours ready to sell to their customers. Everyday from 5:30am, their two young helpers and their two youngest children go around delivering bread to neighbourhood stores and homes. Then their two children set off for school. Gregoria also sells bread in the mornings from the corner near her house. She has worked in the past with Kiva and is very grateful to the staff who assisted her with the business which finally began to do well and she was able to hire two young people to help out. She is once again asking Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles with which she is planning to buy ingredients and continue expanding her bakery business. With any profit she earned, Gregoria continued building her house, a feat which has made her very proud. She wants to continue working so that her last two children can study technology. She is an honest woman and much loved by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread

location.town: Chosica del Norte - La Victoria - Chiclayo

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca , de 32 años , convive con su pareja y con sus 3 pequeños hijos . Reside en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa que es propia. Solo estudio la  primaria incompleta, y eso no significó que no iba a trabajar en el futuro. La clave del éxito fue la perseverancia y cuando ingresó en  la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y la hoja de coca, no tenía mucho conocimiento de las labores. Y aunque tenía un hijo siempre tuvo el respaldo incondicional de su familia y de su esposo. Cuando empezó  sus primeras ventas no  fueron buenas , solo le alcanzaba para cubrir su capital. En la actualidad  sus productos son muy pedidos por los principales compradores.Comercializa  de manera directa, sin intermediario alguno, es por esta razón que tiene buenas ganancias económicas,y normalmente trabaja con su esposo,y  durante la  temporada de cosecha cuenta con la ayuda  de sus peones , que le facilitan  la extracción de sus productos finales . Para el  futuro tiene planeado arrendar los terrenos de otros productores con la finalidad de sacarles  provecho, pues quiere cultivar semillas de cacao.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y se  compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago puntualmente , además se siente contenta  por el buen trabajo de su grupo comunal.Rebeca tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cacao de otros productores, pues desea  atender los compromisos pactados con sus clientes .
texts.en:
Rebeca is 32 and lives with her partner and their 3 small children. She lives in a village located in the beautiful Ayachuco jungle where she has her own house. She didn’t finish primary school but this didn’t mean she wasn’t going to work in the future. The key to her success was her perseverance. When she started farming, specifically cultivating cacao and coca leaves, she didn’t know that much about the work. And although she had a child, she always had the unconditional support of her family and her husband. When she began, her first sales weren’t good: she was only able to recover the capital. Currently her products are in much demand by the mainl buyers. She sells directly, without middlemen, and that’s why she has a good income. She normally works with her husband, and during the harvest time, she also has laborers who help her collect the final crops. In the future she wants to plant land with other crops to get more earnings. She wants to grow cacao seeds. This is the fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to fulfill the obligation of punctual payments. She feels happy for the good work of her communal group. Rebeca plans on using the loan she is requesting to buy cacao from other producers so that she can fill the promised orders of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a big quantity of cacao

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits cosmétiques, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2006 et s’approvisionne à accra. Voulant agrandir son commerce elle  sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  poudre à visage, vernis, diluant, shampoing et divers produits cosmétiques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who has an income-generating business involving cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2006, and she gets her supplies in Accra. Wanting to expand her business, she is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying face powder, nail varnish, thinner, shampoo, and various cosmetics. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics and more

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Roxana,  ella socia tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestra socia  comparte sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la socia es artesana, realiza trabajos de tejidos en alpaca, oveja y lanas; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para que siga realizando sus mantas y diferentes trabajos en tejido.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Pacaha Illariy" communal bank. She lives in the community of Llullucha in Ocongate district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Her name is Roxana. She is 28 years old and lives with her boyfriend and two children. She shares her activities with a retailer. She is a retailer, making woven goods with alpaca and sheep wool. She is seeking this loan to buy materials so she can continue making blankets and other woven goods. She is grateful for the support from the loans and is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for woven goods

loans.name: Esso-Wazina

texts.fr:
Cet homme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de sacs de charbons de bois et de maïs, il s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Bassar, il a 5 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce. Son stock de charbons de bois est  épuisé il souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 20 sacs de charbons de bois et 5 sacs de maïs
il  est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, avec ce qu’il gagne de son commerce il  contribue aux charges financières du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a man who has an income-generating business involving retail sales of charcoal and corn. He stocks up in the country's interior in the city of Bassar. He has five years of experience in this business. His stock of charcoal is exhausted. He wishes to stock up again. This is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES for twenty sacks of charcoal and five sacks of corn. He is married and the father of four children. With what he earns from his business, he helps to meet the financial responsibilities of the household.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of charcoal and sacks of corn

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha  is a trustworthy and hard-working woman. She is 54 years old and has been running a kindergarten for the past eight years. Martha is a widow and the mother of four children. Her oldest child is 35 and the youngest is 25 years old.  Martha always loves to take care of children. She started with taking care of her own children and eventually decided to start a kindergarten in her community. She admits kids from six months to two years old. She dreams of expanding her infrastructure to enable her to extend admission to older kids.

She currently operates her school in a rented space in her community. She is excited to be taking this loan to enable her to buy additional tables and chairs to be used by the kids and also improve the quality of the food for the kids.

loans.use: To purchase additional tables and chairs.

loans.name: Our Father #3 Group

texts.en:
Fanta T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our Father #3.  She is 35 years old, married and has seven children who range from 3 to 18 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.


For 13 years, she has been selling used clothes at the River View Market in Gardnersville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.  She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  


She  plans to use her LRD 6,000 portion of this LRD 30,000 group loan to buy more used clothes. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Fanta is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, yeast, flour and milk.

loans.name: Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco  Comunal Cumbe está conformado por un grupo de 12 señoras luchadoras y dispuestas a salir adelante junto a sus familias, viven en la parroquia  Cumbe que se encuentra a 24 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia presentan viviendas mezcla de europeo, americano y las típicas  de la región con paredes de adobe, columnas, pilastras, puertas y ventanas de madera, pisos de ladrillo y madera,  con estructura de madera y revestimiento de teja tradicional formando un singular paisaje mezcla de culturas.  Cumbe también ofrece al visitante lugares muy especiales para la recreación como el mirador El Calvario a 5 minutos en auto y 15 caminando del centro parroquial,  el Gulash  entre Santa Rosa, Cumbe y Jima, Pucará de la Geografía Sagrada de los Cañaris, las orillas del río Cumbe y las ruinas de Ingahuasi en el ascenso a Tinajillas.

María Lucrecia León es una mujer  casada,  tiene 62 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos que ya son casados y viven de manera independiente,  su esposo trabaja en la rama de la construcción y gracias al esfuerzo del trabajo en su juventud han logrado construir su casa  compartiendo con  dos nietos que le hacen compañía.

María Lucrecia se dedica a la venta de animales como chanchos y gallinas que  los vende en su  comunidad, también cuida de una vaca y la leche que obtiene la vende y un poco es para el consumo de su hogar.  Es socia de éste banco comunal  hace cuatro  años  y todos los créditos  anteriores ha invertido en su  negocio, con su nuevo  préstamo comprará más chanchos y gallinas para incrementar su criadero de animales.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Al igual que las  otras socias del banco comunal la señora  Rosa G. vive en la comunidad  del mismo nombre de su banco del que formó parte hace un ciclo incentivada por su cuñada, ella  se dedica  a la compra y venta  de chanchos y gallinas labor que realiza hace 24 años y fue gracias a su cuñada que ingreso a esta actividad, los días martes, miércoles y jueves son los días que se dedica a la venta de los animales y los fines de semana vende en una picantería  de su propiedad en la cual labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 3:30 p.m. con su nuevo crédito va a comprar más chanchos y gallinas  para incrementar  su negocio y su meta es  aumentar  su picantería y hacerle de dos pisos.

Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran de 26, 24, 12 su primer hijo trabaja y su sueldo es solo para sus gastos, su segunda hija le ayuda en la picantería y su último hijo estudia en la escuela de la localidad, su esposo se dedica al cuidado de su ganado, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Cumbe communal bank has 12 tenacious members who are determined to get ahead with their families. They live in Cumbe parish that is 24 kilometers south of the city of Cuenca. This parish has homes that are a mix of European, American and typical of the area construction styles. The latter have adobe walls and columns with wood windows and doors and floors of brick and wood; the structures are wood covered with traditional tile work giving the area a singular look blending several cultures. Cumbe also offers the visitor special recreational areas like El Calvario lookout which is a five minute drive or a 15 minute walk from the parish center, El Gulash which is between Cumbe and Jima, Pucará, a sacred archaeological site of the Cañaris people, the Cumbe river banks and the Ingahuasi ruins on the slope of Tinajillas Mountain. María Lucrecia León, 62, is married and has four children who are married and live independently; her husband works in construction and thanks to his efforts at work when he was young they managed to build their home which they share with two grandchildren who keep them company. María Lucrecia sells pigs and chickens in her community; she also cares for a cow whose milk she sells keeping some for personal home consumption. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years and she has invested all her previous loans in her business. She will use the new funds to buy more pigs and chickens to increase her animal nursery. Her goal is to continue growing in her business. Like the other group members, Rosa G. lives in Cumbe. She became a member a cycle ago thanks to her sister-in-law who encouraged her to join. She has raised pigs and chickens for sale for 24 years and it was thanks to her sister-in-law that she went into this kind of business. On Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays she sells the animals and on weekends she tends to an eatery she owns from 8am until 3:30pm. She will use the new loan to buy more pigs and chickens to enlarge her business. Her goal is to expand her eatery by adding a second story onto it. Rosa, 47, is married and has three children who are 26, 24 and 12 years of age. Her oldest is employed and uses his salary just for his own expenses. Her second daughter helps out in the eatery and the youngest is still in school. Her husband is a cattleman and his efforts have made it possible for him to build their house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Lilas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LILAS, esta ubicado en el Estado D. Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.

L. señorita Oliva Castañeda ocupa el puesto D. Presidenta  del grupo tiene 28 años D. edad, venD. zapatos por catalogo.

L. señora María del Rosario, es viuda y se dedica a L. venta D. comida desD. hace 15 años, cuando falleció su Mamá, al no tener ingresos, sus vecinas le dijeron que vendiera gorditas D. manteca con atole, ya que su situación económica era muy difícil, su esposo  no tenia trabajo y le ayudaba, años mas tarD. falleció el señor y elL. continuo con el negocio, mismo que hoy en día le permite salir adelante. Con el paso D. los años fue consolidando y complementando el giro y hoy en día venD. gordas entre semana y pozole los fines D. semana (ambos son platillos típicos). L. señora tiene problemas D. salud, el trabajo le ayuda a no deprimirse. Solicita el crédito para dar mantenimiento a su negocio y surtirlo D. materias primas.
texts.en:
This group is called LILAS and is located in the State of Morelos. It is maD. up of ten members. Oliva serves as the group’s president and is 28 years old. She sells shoes through a catalog. María is a widow who sells food and began doing so 15 years ago when her mother passed away. She did not have a source of income, so her neighbors suggested that she begin selling gorditas and atole. Her economic situation was not very good, and her husband was unemployed, he helped as he could, but years later he also passed away. She continued with the business and it allows her to get ahead. Over time she consolidated and complemented the business and today she sells gorditas during the week and pozole on the weekends. (both are typical dishes) She has problems with her health and the work helps keep her from getting depressed. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to maintain her business and stock it with supplies and ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and Ingredients

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Teresa,  ella socia tiene 27 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestra socia  comparte sus actividades del hogar con la artesana, ella realiza trabajos de tejidos en lana de alpaca, oveja y lanas sintéticas; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de tejido y otros.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the communal bank “PACAHA ILLARIY" and lives in the community of Llullucha, district of Ocongate, province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco. Her name is Mrs. Teresa. She is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children. She splits her time between house work and her handicrafts. She does knitting work in alpaca, sheep, and synthetic wool. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her knitting. She is grateful for the support given through this channel and is committed to paying back her loan in the agreed upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of knitting materials

loans.name: Confort

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une revendeuse de produits cosmétiques, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003 ce qui lui a donné une bonne maîtrise de ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Voulant gonfler son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques et divers.
Elle est célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This woman is a vendor of cosmetics products. She has been in this business since 2003 and therefore knows it well. She purchases her stock at the big market of Lomé and has a diverse customer base. Wishing to increase her stock, she is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase cosmetics and assorted products. She is single, and it is with the income from this business that she is able to support herself.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics [for resale]

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 43 años , es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Vive en una localidad  ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa, que es propia .Desde muy joven  tuvo la noción de ser independiente;  y en la actualidad ayuda a sus padres a sembrar y cosechar de manera eficiente. Ella produce y comercializa cacao y  hoja de coca, y  va mejorando sus ventas de manera paulatina, todo esto se lo debe a sus padres quienes le enseñaron las técnicas y herramientas necesarias para obtener productivas plantaciones agrícolas. Rosa reconoce que hay muchas cosas por mejorar, en cuanto a la calidad y cantidad, y  lo logrará con el transcurrir del tiempo, solo por falta de capital no puede introducir maquinarias que le puedan  generar una  producción a gran escala. Por lo general trabaja sola , en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero siempre necesita de sus peones en tiempo de cosecha y su rutina diaria es de 12 horas, solo  los domingos se da un descanso con su familia. Su plan a futuro es producir frutas cítricas, para obtener mayor cantidad de clientes, a la vez desea sacar ventaja de sus competidores.Este es el segundo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  asegura cumplirá puntualmente  con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente fortalecida  y en confianza con su banco comunal.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de más  terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de continuar sembrando sus productos , para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, is a single mother of three children. She lives in a community located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry where she owns her own house. From a very early age she wanted to be independent and currently helps her parents plant and harvest efficiently. She produces cocoa beans and coca leaves to sell and has gradually been improving her sales. She owes all this to her parents who taught her the skills and gave her the tools to be an efficient farmer. Rosa realizes that there are many things still to improve both with respect to quality and to quantity and she will achieve this as time passes; it’s only the lack of funds that keeps her from introducing mechanization that would allow for large scale production. Generally she works alone but occasionally her family helps her; she always needs help from field hands during harvest time, however. She works a 12-hour day with just Sundays off to spend with her family. Her future plan is to produce citrus fruit in order to acquire more customers and have an edge over her competition. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she assures prompt repayment. Being a member of a communal bank gives her strength and confidence. Rosa plans to use the requested funds to buy more farmland in order to continue growing her crops so that her profits will be greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more land to cultivate.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
La   Sra. Pelagia V. A.  es de la compania Jejui, tiene 64 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Rodolfo Rolón de 69 años de edad.
 
           La Señora es propietaria de  una negocio  que funciona en su domicilio particular.
El negocio es muy completo ya que tiene todos lo relacionado a la canasta básica , ademas posee una carnicería y venta de ropas.
La pareja es muy trabajadora, por que ademas de atender el negocio tienen algunos cultivos, hortalizas en la huerta y ademas tienen cria de ganados menores como cerdos y aves.
Solicita el crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA para la compra de una congeladora para la carnicería que funciona en su negocio ya que estaban utilizando la heladera de la casa para conservar la carne.
Ella desea aumentar su ganancia para invertir en ganados vacunos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pelagia V. A. is from the Jejui Company; she is 64 years old and is married to Mr. Rodolfo Rolón of 69 years of age.

Mrs. V. A. is the owner of a business that is run in her home.

The business is very complete since she has everything relating to basic household goods and she also has a butcher’s shop and sells clothing.

They are a very industrious couple, besides having the business they have some crops, a vegetable garden and a litter of small livestock like pigs and birds.

She needs the loan from Fundación Paraguaya (Kiva’s field partner) and KIVA to buy a freezer for her butcher’s shop since she uses her home freezer to preserve the meat.

She wishes to increase her profits to invest in cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is faithful and industrious businesswoman who sells groceries to customers. She is married to a petty trader. She is 27 years old and mother of one child who is 4 years old. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and supporting her family. She loves selling and enjoys serving customers. She sells groceries like candies, mineral water, toiletries, hair creams, assorted biscuits, etc. She has operated her shop for the past 2 years in her neighborhood. 

Stella believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draw customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful grocers. She plans to use the loan to purchase more groceries to serve her customers. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits so that she will be able to rent a bigger store and do wholesale grocery sales.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Irene,  ella socia tiene 32 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestra socia  comparte sus actividades del hogar con la ganadería, ella cría animales vacunos y animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral y vende sus animales cuando alcanzan su madurez. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un nuevo animal vacuno.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Communal Bank “Pacaha Illariy”. She lives in the community of Llullucha in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Irene is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She divides her time between her household activities and raising livestock. The animals she raises include cattle and smaller animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and poultry. She sells her animals once they reach maturity. Irene is requesting a loan in order to buy another cow.

She is grateful and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her loan payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Lachidatou

texts.fr:
En 2008 cette femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays pour pouvoir réaliser de plus grand bénéfice sur ses ventes. Son stock de marchandises a connu une baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son tout premier crédit pour l’achat de 14 sacs de maïs.
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2008, this woman began trading in grains. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country in order to make much more profits on her sales. Her stock of products is low. She would like to restock and is requesting from WAGES her first loan to buy 14 bags of corn. She is married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of  bags of corn

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Virginia,  ella socia tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestra socia  comparte sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, la socia se dedica a la fabricación de telares con lana de alpaca, oveja, lanas sintéticas, realizan mantas, frazadas, cuadros, correas, medias, monteras, chullos y otros artículos de vestir y adornos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Pacha Illariy communal bank; she lives in the Llullucha community, district of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco. She is 26 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She is responsible for household activities and also does handicrafts— she makes textiles with alpaca, sheep, and synthetic wools. Her products include cloaks, blankets, wall hangings, belts, stockings, caps, chullos (Peruvian-style hats with ear flaps) and other clothing and accessories. Virginia is requesting this loan to buy wool. She values this available support and is grateful for it. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El  Sr. Ramon V. B.  es de la ciudad de Santani, del Barrio Republicano, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Elva Franco Portillo con 38 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos, todos  en  en  edad escolar.
        Se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a la producción de mandioca (yuca), además trabaja con  ganaderia para la producción y venta de leche, y queso. 
El señor Ramón produce la mandioca y lo vende en su camión en los mercados de la ciudad, a distintos negocios y una fabrica de almidón de la zona.
 
Tiene clientela formada, lo que le genera buenos ingresos, tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
Actualmente en la zona hay buena venta de mandioca por la gran demanda y desea ampliar su producción pero debe invertir, para lo que solicita el préstamo.

Mas adelante el Sr. Ramon desea  cambiar su camioneta por otro en mejores condiciones, para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramon V. B. is from the city of Santani, of the Barrio Republicano. He is 43 years old and is married to Mrs. Elva Franco Portillo who is 38 years old, they have 4 children all of school age.

He works in agriculture especially producing mandioca (yucca) he also works with cattle in the production and sale of milk and cheese.

Mr. Ramón grows the yucca and sells it in his truck to city markets, different businesses, and a starch mill in the area.

He has a customer base that gives him good income, and has good business and personal references.

Currently in his area, the sale of yucca is good because of its great demand and Mr. Ramon wishes to expand his production but he must invest on his crops, which is the reason for the loan.

Later, Mr. Ramon wishes to change his truck for another that is in better condition to make his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his mandioca (yucca) crops.

loans.name: Claudio Domingo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Claudio,  él socio tiene 37 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestro socio  trabaja como albañil y en  ocasiones sale a camino inka; y camino de Ausangate como porteador; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y empezar a construir en un alero de su casa actual.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank Pacaha Illariy and lives in the community of Llullucha, district of Ocongate, province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco. Our member, Mr. Claudio, is 37 years old and lives with his three children. He works as a mason and on occasion goes out as a porter on the Inka roads around Ausangate, a sacred peak in southeastern Peru. Our member requests the loan to buy construction materials to begin to build an extension on his existing house. The member appreciates and values the support provided by this means and commits to comply with the payment of his debt in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member requests the loan to buy construction material

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Cecilio,  él socio tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestro socio  trabaja como porteador en camino a Ausangate con diferentes agencias de viajes que prestan servicio a la zona de los nevados. Nuestro socio también va a camino inka con sus amigos a trabajar cuando escasea el turismo en la zona. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatillas y una bolsa de dormir yu con la otra parte comprar víveres para su hogar.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "PACAHA ILLARIY" community bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Our member, Sr. Cecilio, is 26 years old, partnered and the father of 2 children. He works as a porter for different travel companies around Mt. Ausangate in the Peruvian Andes. When tourism falls off, he works with friends along the Camino Inka. He is applying for a loan, partly to buy shoes and a sleeping bag and partly to buy everyday necessities for his family. The member is grateful for the help that this kind of lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes, sleeping bag and household necessities.

loans.name: Sarly

texts.es:
La Sra. Sarly es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 44 años de edad està casada y tiene dos hijos .
Tiene una casa de equipamiento para vehiculos, y tambien venden colchones y camas, en donde atiende con su marido, el señor Jorge Speranza, con una buena clientela, ya que son los ùnicos que se dedican en ese ramo dentro de la ciudad.
 Su proyecto para mas adelante es habilitar otra sucursal en el centro de la ciudad, para cubrir y mejorar la atenciòn a sus clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de auto radios y parlantes, y otros accesorios para autos ya que de esa manera brindará mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sarly is from the city of Santani, is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She has an automobile parts store and also sells mattresses and beds. She attends to the store with her husband, Jorge Speranza, and they have good customers since they are the only ones in the city who do this activity. Her project to grow her business is to set up another branch in the center of the city to have better coverage and give better service to her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase radios, speakers, and other automobile parts since this way she will provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of radios, speakers, and other automobile parts.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Juan,  él socio tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Nuestro socio  trabaja como albañil y en algunas ocasiones como porteador al camino inka y en el nevado de Ausangate, Nuestro socio trabaja mucho porque es el único sustento económico que su familia tiene; él socio disfruta lo que hace y está construyendo su casa para lo cual Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "PACAHA ILLARIY" community bank and lives in the community of Llullucha in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Our member, Sr. Juan, is 33 years old, partnered and has 4 children. He works as a construction worker and part-time porter for tourists along the Camino Inka and around Mt. Ausangate. He works long hours because that's the only way that he can support his family. He likes his work and is building a house. He is applying for a loan to buy construction materials for the house. The member is grateful for the help that this kind of lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy es transportista urbano trabaja en el Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 de la ciudad de La Paz.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz zona de pasankeri.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de motor para su trufi.
 
Es primer crédito con IMPRO. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Freddy works in transportation and works in the Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 (Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 Labor Union) in the city of La Paz. This is his main source of income and his only means of supporting his family. His home is located in the city of La Paz in the pasankeri area.

The loan will be used to buy a motor for his trufi (a taxi with a fixed route).

This is his first loan with IMPRO (Kiva’s field partner). The evaluation that they gave him qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
El señor Cecilio D. L. y la señora Ofelia Grimaldo tiene dos hijos ha quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
En este momento la familia esta posando por un mal momento, la señora Ofelia Grimaldo esta enferma y necesita unos estudios medico, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para que se pueda realizar los exámenes médicos que necesita.
Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y así poder pagar a la clínica que se encargara D. los estudios médicos.   
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene D. su taller D. reparación D. autos.
texts.en:
Mr. Cecilio D. L. and Mrs. Ofelia Grimaldo have two children and they wish to give them the best. Currently, the family is going through bad times. Mrs. Ofelia Grimaldo is sick and needs some medical exams but she does not have the money needed to have the tests that she needs.

This is why they need he loan, to be able to pay the clinic that will be in charge of the medical tests.

They plan to pay the loan with the income that that they get from their automobile mechanic workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Cynthia R. le esta haciendo falta los acabados y el piso de concreto para tener terminada una parte de la casa. 
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
La señora Cynthia R. tiene ya mas de tres años dedicándose a la decoración de salones de fiestas, también renta las fuentes de chocolate para las fiestas infantiles. 
Con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito. Ya que los gastos familiares su esposo el señor José Refugio Guerrero se encargara de los gastos de la familia.
Tiene dos pequeños hijos que actual mente están estudiando y desean que tengo un lugar mejor donde puedan vivir.
texts.en:
Cynthia R.’s house needs the finishings and a concrete floor to finish part of the house. But, she does not have the money needed to be able to buy the material and pay the person to make the improvements. Cynthia R. has been decorating party salons for over three years. She also rents chocolate fountains for children’s parties. She plans on paying the loan with the income she gets from her business. Her husband, José Refugio Guerrero, pays the family expenses. She has two small children who go to school. They want her to have a better place for them to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the interior and put down a concrete floor

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan y su esposa son productores lecheros. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para  incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es su segundo crédito con IMPRO. El buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Hernan and his wife are dairy producers. This activity is the main source of the income they use to support their family. Their home is located in the community of Tahari - Achacachi, in Omasuyos Province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. Hernan will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase his milk production. This is his second loan with IMPRO. His excellent payment history qualified him to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika G. y su esposo el señor Héctor Garcia son padres de familia ya tiene varios años que se viven en Nuevo Laredo, toda su familia se quedo en el sur de la ciudad.
Tiene un problema que la mama del señor Héctor Garcia necesita urgentemente una operación, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario. Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para poder mandarle el dinero a la señora y así la puedan operar antes de que sea más complicado. 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene la señora Erika G. de su trabajo en una fábrica en el departamento de producción. 
Con el ingreso del señor Héctor Garcia que obtiene de su trabaja que tiene en una fabrica  será para los gastos familiares
texts.en:
Erika G. and her husband Héctor Garcia are parents who have lived for several years in Nuevo Laredo. All of their family members are in the south of the city. They currently have a problem: Héctor Garcia's mother urgently needs an operation, but she does not have the necessary funds. For this reason, they are requesting a loan so that they can send her the money and she can receive the operation before her condition becomes worse. They plan to repay the loan with the income Erika G. receives from her work in the production department of a factory. The income Héctor Garcia obtains from his work, also in a factory, will be used for the family's living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Eusebio Freddy

texts.es: EL SEÑOR EUSEBIO  ES UN CLIENTE ANTIGUO,  HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD   EN LOS PAGOS DE SUS CREDITOS,EL CLIENTE TRABAJA CON SU TAXI EN TODA LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, EMPIEZA SU LABOR A LAS 6:00 am Y LA TERMINA A LAS 20:00 APROXIMADA MENTE, LA ESPOSA SRA. PASTORA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA FERIA DE LA 16 DE JULIO LOS JUEVES Y DOMINGOS DONDE LA GENTE SE REUNE A REALIZAR SUS COMPRAS Y A DEGUSTAR LA VARIEDAD DE PLATOS QUE OFRECEN, EL MAYOR SUEÑO DE LA FAMILIA ES LLEGAR A TENER SU CASA, POR LO QUE SE ESFUERZAN EN LOGRARLO, TRABAJAM DURO, EL SR. EUSEBIO AYUDA TAMBIEN A SU ESPOSA EN LA VENTA DE COMIDAS YA QUE ESOS 2 DIAS DE FERIA TIENE BUENA VENTA Y NECESITA AYUDA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO EL SR. EUSEBIO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA QUE SU ESPOSA ELABORE SUS RIQUISIMAS COMIDAS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Eusebio is a long-standing client and has shown himself to be responsible about repaying his loans. He works as a cab driver in and around the city of El Alto. He starts work at 6:00am and finishes around 8:00pm. His wife, Sra. Pastora, earns money selling food in the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays. People congregate in the market to buy what they need and enjoy the variety of dishes for sale. The family's greatest dream is to build a house of their own, a dream that they work for with all their might. Sr. Eusebio helps his wife with food sales because she sells a lot on market days and needs his help. With the money from the loan, Sr. Eusebio will buy the supplies that his wife needs to make her delicious meals. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown by extending the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
Damaso es productor lechero.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.

Es su tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Damaso is a dairy producer. This activity is the main source of the income he uses to support his family. His home is located in the community of Tahari-Achacachi, in Omasuyos Province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase his milk production. This is his third loan with IMPRO; his excellent payment record qualified him to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther V. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo surtir su negocio y tener mas ingreso para su familia. 
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para surtir el negocio de otros productos que le están pidiendo sus clientes que son verduras, frutas y carnes. 
Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther V. is thankful for your cooperation in the last loan which helped her stock her business and have more income for her family.

Once more she needs a loan to stock her business with other products that her clients are asking for like vegetables, fruits and meat.

Since she does not have the money necessary and does not want to take money away from her business.

Mrs. Esther plans to pay the loan with the earnings from her business since it is the source of income of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor R. A. es de Bº Navidad, con casa propia, tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero.
Se dedica a la venta de artículos farmacéuticos (analgésicos y remedios naturales) y otros artículos de uso familiar, tiene una motocicleta en el cual realiza su trabajo, es un señor muy responsable, tiene varias operaciones canceladas en forma excelente.
El señor Victor realiza las ventas de sus mercaderías en moto ofreciendo sus productos casa por casa en varias localidades.
Los artículos que el vende lo deja a sus clientes a créditos por lo que solicita un crédito para completar el capital que debe invertir para contar con las mercaderías suficiente para sus clientes.
El desea comprar sabanas, cacerolas, toallas, planchas para lo que solicita el préstamos.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor R. A. is from the Navidad neighborhood. He is 43-years-old and single, and lives in his own home. He sells healthcare products (analgesics and natural remedies) and other household goods. He has a motorcycle which he uses for work. He is a very responsible man, and has an impeccable payment record on previous loans. Mr. Victor sells his merchandise door-to-door in various neighborhoods, using his motorcycle as transportation. He sells his goods to his customers on credit, so he is requesting a loan to provide him the capital that he must invest in order to keep a sufficient supply of merchandise on hand for his customers. He is asking for this loan because he would like to buy sheets, pots and pans, towels, and irons.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheets, towels, pots and pans, and irons.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es productora lechera, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. La señora es separada. Su domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad de Arasaya – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es segundo crédito con IMPRO. El buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Natividad sells dairy products. This is her principle source of income with which she provides for her family. She is separated. Her home is located in the Arasaya community in Achacachi province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production. This will be her second loan with IMPRO. Her good repayment record allows her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda G. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pido cambiar todo el cableado de la luz de su casa.
Ahora a su vivienda le esta haciendo falta la reparación del techo ya que esta en muy mal las condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente. Solicita nuevamente un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de perfumes, bolsas para damas y varios artículos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hermelinda G. is thankful for your cooperation in her previous loan, which she used to replace all the electrical wiring in her house. Now her house is in need of repairs to the roof, which is in very poor condition, and she is fearful that an accident could happen. She´s requesting another loan in order to buy the necessary materials and pay someone to make the improvements to her roof. She plans to repay the loan with the profits she makes from her sales of perfumes, ladies' handbags and other merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tables, chairs

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Esfuerzo esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista Sur de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  esta integrado por tres personas, todos vecinos y que se conocen hace mucho tiempo atras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan.

la señora Maria Angela N. R. tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de granos basicos (frijoles, maiz, arroz) y refrescos, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas granos basicos y refrescos.
Maria tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos dependen de ella, Maria vive con su papa.

El sr. Jose Dilmer T. Chirino tiene 30 años  de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo.
Jose se dedica a la venta de leña en rajas, tambien tiene dos lanchas que las alquila a personas que se dedican a la venta de leña. Su deseo es construir su propia casa y comprarse otro motor para otra lancha.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar leña.

la sra. Maria Auxiliadora Ortes F. tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella.
Maria se dedica a la venta de pescado. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas pescado.
el deseo de todos ellos como grupo es trabajar y salir adelante con sus negocios para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group El Esfuerzo (The Effort) is located in Buena Vista Sur neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. It is made up of three people, all neighbors who have known each other for a long time. Following are the details of the different business activities they are involved in: Mrs. Maria Angela N. R. is 36 years old, single, and sells staple foods (beans, corn, and rice) and soft drinks. She has been doing this for many years. She will use her loan to buy more staple foods and soft drinks. Maria has four children who depend on her, and she lives with their father. Mr. Jose Dilmer T. Chirino is 30 years old, married, and has one child. He sells split firewood, and he also has two motorboats which he rents to others who sell firewood. His wish is to build his own house and buy a new motor for another boat. He will use his loan to buy firewood. Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora Ortes F. is 36 years old, married, and has two children who depend on her. She sells fish. She will use her loan to buy more fish. Their wish, as a group, is to work and continue progressing with their businesses to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, staple foods, soft drinks, and fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tony

texts.es: Tony,de 20 años, es soltero y vive en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, al lado de sus padres.Este joven a su corta edad ya tiene su propio negocio. En la actualidad ofrece servicio de reparación de artefactos  eléctricos, y tiene bastante experiencia en su labor , además considera que la  clave del éxito consiste en ofrecer repuestos de calidad y buen servicio hacia sus clientes, y  esta obteniendo buenas ganancias económicas . En cuanto al precio lo maneja de acuerdo al servicio de reparación que se requiera y su tienda esta localizada por la zona donde vive . En el futuro piensa  ampliar su negocio y adquirir una motocarro , con la finalidad de obtener un ingreso adicional. Por lo general trabaja solo y su horario  de trabajo empieza  desde las 7 de la mañana  y termina a  las 8 de la noche.Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su banco comunal por la transparencia y apoyo que le brindan.Esta muy satisfecho con las reuniones mensuales con sus compañeros de grupo porque puede compartir sus experiencias.Tony tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de repuestos que tengan mayor demanda, con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tony, who is 20 years old, is single and lives in a town located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, next to his parents. This man, at his young age, already has his own business. Currently, he offers an electrical repair service, and has a lot of experience with this. Additionally, he believes that the key to success lies in quality repairs and customer service to his clients, and he is earning good profits. He sets his prices according to the parts required for the repair, and his shop is located in the area in his neighborhood. In the future, he is thinking about growing his business and getting a motocarro (a motorized rickshaw) with the goal of earning even more. He usually works alone, with his schedule running from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening. This will be his third loan with MFP, and he promises punctual payments. He would also like to thank his communal bank for the transparency and support it provides. He is very satisfied with the monthly meetings with his group of fellow borrowers, because its an opportunity to share his experiences. Tony has plans to invest the money in parts that are in greater demand, with the goal of increasing his income.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of electrical parts necessary to provide his repair services

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ROSA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA ZONA DE EL PASO, ELLA  VIVE EN CASA ALQUILADA MAS DE 8 AÑOS, SU SUEÑO ES COMPRARSE VIVIENDA LA VIVIENDA DONDE ESTA VIVIENDO. LA SEÑORA EMPEZO DESDE AYUDANTE DE COCINA EN UNA PENSION, TRABAJO DURO PERO DECIDIO INDEPENDISARSE Y BUSCO UN LUGAR ESTRATEGICO PARA PODER VENDER COMIDA, YA QUE ELLA AHORRO MUCHO PARA PODER ABRIR SU PROPIA PENSION AUNQUE SEA PEQUEÑA, COMO SE VE EN LAS FOTOGRAFIAS, ELLA LLEGO A LA INSTITUCION GRACIAS A OTRA CLIENTA, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MESAS Y SILLAS PARA LA MISMA. EL PUESTO SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PARTE NORTE DE COLCAPIRHUA A 3 KILOMETROS DE LA AVENIDA BLANCO GALINDO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Rosa sells food in the El Paso zone. She has lived in a rented house for more than 8 years. Her dream is to purchase the house where she is living. She began as a kitchen helper at a guesthouse. She worked hard but decided to become independent and look for a strategic place to be able to sell food. She saved a lot to be able to open her small guesthouse, although it is small. As you see in the photographs, she arrived at the institution thanks to another client. The purpose of this loan is to be able to purchase more tables and chairs. The place is located in the northern part of Colcapirhua, 3 kilometers from Avenida Blanco Galindo. She is very thankful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in providing the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Guadalupe esta ubicado en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan.

la señora Francisca Sugey G. tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y dependen de ella 4 hijos, recibe  apoyo economico del padre de sus hijos.
Francisca se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene 5 años de tener su pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia SUGEY.
el credito lo utilzara para comprar mas abarroteria como ser jabones, papel higienico, sopas, refrescos, chiles, churros, manteca, aceite, frijoles tortillas, harina de maiz y trigo, pan, galletas, arroz, azucar etc.

la sra. Waleska Yamileth G. V. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Elvis Alexander Romero quien es albañil, ambos se ayudan mutuamente en los gastos mensuales del hogar.
Waleska se dedica a la venta de lacteos, charamuscas y ropa.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar lacteos.

la señora  Berta Marina V. M. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Oscar Armando G. quien se dedica a la albañileria, tienen un hijo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar telas.
tambien vende golosinas los fines de semana.

Todos ellos juntos trabajando duro lograran salir adelante con sus familias y sus negocios.
texts.en:
The cohesive group called Guadalupe is located in the Morazan colony in the city of San Lorenzo. There are three hardworking women that comprise the group. Below are the details of the different activities that they do Mrs. Francisca is 31 years old, is a single mother and has four children that are dependent upon her. She receives economic support from the father of the children. Francisca sells groceries. She has had a grocery store for five years. It is called SUGEY grocery store. With this loan she will buy more groceries such as soaps, toilet paper, soups, soda, chiles, churros, margarine, oil, beans, tortillas, corn and wheat flour, bread, cookies, rice, sugar, etc. Mrs. Waleska is 33 years old. She lives with Mr. Elvis who is a mason. They both help with household expenses. Waleska sells milk products, popsicles and clothes. She will use this loan to buy milk products. Mrs. Berta is 52 years old and is married to Mr. Oscar. Mr. Oscar is a mason. They have one child. She will use the loan to buy fabric. She also sells candy on the weekends. All of these people are working together to help their families and businesses progress.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, corn, fabric, milk products, groceries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victor Avelino

texts.es:
Víctor de 62 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, hace unos años atrás el tenia una avícola( lugar donde vende todo tipo de carnes) con ese negocio mantenía a su familia. Pero cuando sus hijas crecieron el decidió dejarles la avícola a ellas, y compro víveres para tener su propia tienda. 

Ahora Víctor trabaja en su tienda desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, vende todo tipo de víveres, en ocasiones vende al por mayor sus productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, azúcar y arroz para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victor is 62 years old. He lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. For a long time he had a meat market (a place where he sold all types of meat). He supported his family with this business. When his daughters grew up, he decided to give the meat market to them and buy supplies of food in order to have his own grocery store. Now Victor works in his store from 7:00am until 10:00pm everyday. He sells all types of groceries. Sometimes he sells his products at a wholesale level. With this loan he would like to buy oil, sugar and rice for his store. In the future he would like to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Oil, sugar, rice

loans.name: Freddy José

texts.es:
Freddy José R. R. es un joven venezolano, que estudió economía y tiene un concepto muy especial de salud integral en una pequeña farmacia de la que, segun el manifiesta, las instancias de Salud pública, ha manifestado su aprecio, en el cumplimiento al pie de la letra  de toda la normatividad legal que rige para este sector, donde como valor agregado Freddy y médicos y profesionales especialistas de la salud, ofrecen servicios de asesoría para prevenir la automedicación en un enfoque de responsabilidad social con sus clientes que son orientados en todo lo relacionado con  prescripciones médicas, manejo alimenticio de dietas, etc.

Su idea de negocio inició cuando en Caracas, la capital de Venezuela, asesoraba un proyecto para algunos propietarios de farmacias y conoció la liquidez y utilidades que este negocio genera; así mismo estuvo cerca de muchas experiencias de propietarios de farmacias en su operación administrativas lo que finalmente  marcó en primera instancia su decisión de emprenderlo; por eso cuando se vino a vivir en Colombia y su mamá le insistió  en que montara una Farmacia, no lo dudó,  fue así como nació Farmaprevid  "dirigido a la venta y dispensación de diversos productos farmacéuticos y para el cuidado y la higiene personal,  como concepto novedoso orientado hacia la cadena que influye en la salud y por lo tanto en la calidad de vida del usuario de este servicio".

Freddy  quiere que en Farmaprevid los clientes encuentren de todos los medicamentos en su amplia gama,  por eso solicita su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de adicionarle a su inventario gotas oftalmológicas, antibióticos varios, productos de salud y de aseo personal e iniciar una relación financiera con esta organización. 

Su sueño, meta y también desafío principal es lograr estabilizarse en este negocio para conseguir su gran posicionamiento en el mercado; a nivel familiar comparte una gran alegría con su esposa por la llegada muy  pronta de su primer bebe y finalmente sueña con ayudar a muchas personas que lo necesitan, porque Freddy es un joven de buen corazón, sensible y muy altruista.
texts.en:
Freddy José R. R. is a young man from Venezuela who studied economics and practices a very special concept of comprehensive health at his small drugstore; he mentions that offices of public health have expressed their appreciation on how he literally follows all legal requirements required in this business sector. As an added value, Freddy, doctors and health professionals offer medical advice at the store to prevent self-medication, as a way to focus his social responsibility with his customers; he guides them with everything related to medical prescriptions, managing dietary nutrition, etc. His business idea was born when he was in Caracas, capital of Venezuela, and he was working as a consultant in a project for drugstore owners; he learned about the liquidity and profitability of this business. He was also close to many experiences of how owners managed their businesses and this finally prompted him to make the decision to start his own business. For this reason, when he came to Colombia and his Mom insisted that he setup a drugstore, he did not hesitate. This is how Farmaprevid was born: “dedicated to the sale and distribution of a variety of pharmaceutical products, and to personal health care and hygiene, as an innovative concept directed to the chain that influences health and therefore, the quality of life of the users of this service” Freddy wants his customers to find the widest range of medicine at Farmaprevid; for this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to increase his inventory with eye drops, varied antibiotics, personal heath and hygiene products, and at the same time, start his financial relationship with this organization. His dream, goal and main challenge is to stabilize his business and achieve a great market position; at a family level, he shares great joy with his wife for the soon arrival of their first baby; finally, he dreams of helping many people in need, because Freddy is a young man with a good heart, sensitive and very altruistic.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory with eye drops, varied antibiotics, personal heath and hygiene products

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARINA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD EL CUAL VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS HIJOS, TIENE SU TIENDA ESTA UBICADO EN UNA DE LAS MAS LINDAS PROVINCIAS DE COCHABAMBA  "TIQUIPAYA" , LA CIUDAD DE LAS FLORES, LA SEÑORA MARINA ACCEDIO AL CREDITO CON TASA KIVA POR SER UNA DE LAS EXELENTES CLIENTAS DE EMPRENDER, QUE ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON ESE PRODUCTO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO FUE PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD Y ESTANTES PARA SU TIENDA, ES MUY TRABAJADORA SE LEVANTA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO PARA COMPRAR PAN Y ABRIR SU TIENDA, SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA EN LA ATENCION DE SU TIENDA YA QUE TIENE MUCHOS CLIENTES Y NO PUEDE ATENDERLOS SOLA DE ESTE MODO LA SRA. TRABAJA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO PARA ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Marine sells basic needs products. She lives in her own home with her husband and their children. Her store is located in one of the nicest provinces of Cochabamba "Tiquipaya", city of flowers, Marina gained access to the loan with the Kiva rate by being one of Emprender's excellent customers, and she is very grateful for this product. The purpose of the loan was to be able to buy more basic needs products and shelves for her store. She is very hardworking and gets up very early to buy bread and open her store. Her husband helps her to look after her store since she has a lot of customers and cannot look after them alone. Therefore she works together with her husband in this way to improve the whole family's quality of life. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en casa propia en la zona de Irpavi, ladera sur de la ciudad de El Alto con su hijo. Ella es rentista del sector comercio, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para el colocado de ventanas y puertas en dos habitaciones de su vivienda, que se encuentra a media construcción.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria lives with her son in her own home in the Irpavi district, which is south of the city of El Alto. She is a commercial property owner and uses the rent to support herself.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase windows and doors for two rooms in her house, which is halfway built. This is the fourth time she has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates she has a favorable rating and is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase windows & doors

loans.name: Brisas De Nacaome Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Brisas de Nacaome esta integrado por 2 mujeres y un hombre, son personas honestas y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan.

el señor Eulalio C. C. tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Maria Teodora B., tiene 2 hijos. Eulalio se dedica a la venta de calzado, tiene su negocio en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Eulialio comenzo a comercializar con vegetales, pero tenia muy pocas ganancias y busco otro tipo de articulo para venta, es por eso que ahora se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de zapatos.

la señora Marcelina B. F. tiene 54 años de edad, esta soltera. Marcelina se dedica a la venta de ropa y materiales de plastico,  nos comento que las ventas estan bajas, pero que cree que van a mejorar notablemente, su negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal de Nacaome.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar productos hechos a base de plastico. (vasos, platos, picheles, panas, baldes, tortilleras, paneras etc).

la señora Lidia B. tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Fredys Alberto García, tienen tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de calzado en el mercado municipal de Nacaome, donde tiene variedad de calzado.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar calzado.
texts.en:
The support group Brisas de Nacaome is made up of two women and one man. They are honest people with a lot of enthusiasm to get ahead. Their different activites are detailed below. Mr. Eulalio C. C. is 48 years old. He is married to Ms.Maria Teodora B., and they have two children. Eulalio sells shoes. He has his business in the Naaome city market. Eulialio started out selling vegetables, but he had very little profit and he looked for something else to sell, and that is why now he sells shoes. He will use the loan to purchase shoes. Ms. Marcelina B. F. is 54 years old. Marcelina sells clothes and plastic products. She remarked that sales are low, but that she thinks they will increase notably. Her business is in the Nacaome city market. She will use the loan to purchase plastic products (cups, plates, pitchers, cords, tortilla presses, bread boxes, etc.) Ms. Lidia B. is 28 years old. She is married to Mr. Fredys Alberto Garcia and they have three children. She sells shoes in the Nacaome city market. She will use the loan to purchase shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes, clothes and plastic products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana ,de 25 años, es madre soltera y tiene una hija. Reside en una localidad de la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura y aunque al principio no sabía nada de este rubro , recnonoce que con el tiempo ha aprendido bastante .En la actualidad tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y obtiene buenas ganancias económicas, su estrategia de éxito es que siempre tiene su negocio bien surtido de toda clase de productos. Además no le gusta esperar que se le agote su mercadería sino que se abastece cada quince días . Por lo general sus productos los vende en su propia localidad y los precios van acorde al poder adquisitivo de cada cliente, ya que su negocio está segmentado para todo el público en general. Usualmente trabaja  sola, y  en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Las puertas de su negocio están abiertas todos los días, y para el futuro desea ampliar su tienda de abarrotes, para ofrecer sus productos al por mayor a sus asiduos  clientes.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y se  compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus  pagos, además esta muy agradecida con los integrantes de su banco comunal por la solidaridad que ejercen entre todos.Yobana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería , para  abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, y a la vez satisfacer  las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yobana, 25, is a single mother of one daughter; she lives in her own home located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry. For the last five years she has been a farmer even though she started out not knowing anything about farming; she recognizes that in this time she has learned quite a bit about it. She has a grocery store and earns good profits from it; her strategy for success is to always have the store well stocked with a wide variety of products. Besides, she doesn’t like to run out of items so she stocks up every two weeks. In general, she sells her products in her own location and prices are according to each customer’s ability to pay; her store is segmented for the general public. She usually works alone but occasionally her family helps out. She is open for business every day and in the future would like to expand her store to offer wholesale items to her regular customers. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion; she is very grateful to all the members of her communal group for the solidarity among them. Yobana plans to use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of merchandise to stock her store in order to meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El  Sr. Miguel S. P. es de la ciudad de Santani, del Barrio Monte Alto, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Teodolina Ovando de S. de 39 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 4 hijos todos Mayores de edad.
 Posee una Joyería con relojería en el centro de la ciudad, el atiende el negocio ofreciendo sus joyas a los clientes.
Las joyas que el comercializa los compra de la ciudad de Luque.
Es un familia muy trabajadora que procura bastante para vivir de la mejor manera posible.
Actualmente quiere renovar los modelas de joyas y relojes que ofrece pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente por lo que solicita el préstamo.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva ya que facilita el trabajo de mucha gente con escasos recurso y espera que siga ayudando.
texts.en:
Miguel S. P. is from the Monte Alto neighborhood in the city of Santani. He’s 43 years old, married to Teodolina Ovando de S., 39; they have four adult children. He has a jewelry shop downtown that he runs himself offering jewelry that he brings from the city of Luque for sale to his customers. This is a hard-working family that puts much effort into living in the best possible way. He wants to update his watch and jewelry stock items but lacks enough funds to do so; thus this loan request. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva because of the help they offered to many low-income people so that they can continue working; he hopes they will continue to help.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry and watches.

loans.name: Celida

texts.es:
La señora Celida  de 33 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas Argentinas y nacionales, cuenta con salón comercial propio en su casa,  vende prendas de vestir  para damas,  caballeros y niños, son  exclusivas y delicadas como blusas de licras, vestidos, jeans y otros.
 Anteriormente ella misma confeccionaba y comercializaba por la zona, aumento su clientela y actualmente además de confeccionar compra las mercaderías.  

 Celida  esta conforme con la actividad que realiza, así también su clientela.

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de jeans, pantalones, camperas y otros abrigos de la temporada para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Celida, 33, is clothes merchant; she stocks domestic and Argentinean clothing in a store located in her own home. She sells unique and delicate items, such as lycra blouses, dresses, jeans, etc. for women, men and children. She used to make the items she sold in the area herself but her clientele grew and now, besides making items, she also buys merchandise to stock.
