Celida is satisfied with her work; so are her customers. She is asking Fundación Paraguaya for funds to buy jeans, pants, jackets and coats for the season in order to meet the great demand she has.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans, jackets, pants and coats.

loans.name: Victor Hernan

texts.es:
La Actividad Principal a que se dedica el Sr. Victor D. es  transporte Urbano, operando bajo el nombre de “TRANSPORTE SAUCEDA” el cual circula  como taxi dentro de la ciudad de Danlí con el Nº 247 de su legítima propiedad.
El tiene (8) ocho años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar,  actualmente trabaja en un vehiculo año 2001 de su propiedad en muy buenas condiciones y buena presentación

Don Víctor, es casado y su compañera de hogar labora como maestra de educación pública y de su matrimonio tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos.
Con los ingresos que recibe del taxi, el cubre los gastos de educación de sus hijos mismos que actualmente están cursando estudios universitarios y su esposa lo apoya con ciertos gastos del hogar. 

En la vida personal don Víctor es una persona bien conocida en la ciudad de Danlí y casi en todo el territorio nacional, ya que el fue jugador profesional de fútbol en los años 1980 al 1992 jugando en diferentes equipos de la liga nacional Hondureña.
texts.en:
Victor D.’s main job is providing urban public transportation services; he does business under the name of “TRANSPORTE SAUCEDA” providing taxi services in the city of Danlí with his own vehicle identified with the number 247. He has been in this line of work for 8 years and it’s of note that during this time he has known how to administer it well; he drives a 2001 model vehicle that is still in very good condition and appearance. Victor is married and his wife is a public school teacher; they have three children who are still 100% dependent on them. His earnings as a taxi driver make it possible for him to cover education costs for his children who are currently studying at the university; his wife contributes and helps him with certain household expenses. Victor is very well-known in the city of Danlí and practically nation-wide because he was a professional football player from 1980-1992 playing for several different teams in the Honduras national football league.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Juan de 56 años de edad es comerciante, cuenta con una pequeña micro  industria familiar en su casa, preparan todo tipo panificados, galletas criollas, pancitos, pan felipe, coquito y otros.
 Don Juan  ganó experiencia trabajando para otros, actualmente cuenta con un negocio prospero. 
  
El mismo se encarga de la comercialización de sus productos por la zona, para lo cual necesita de un nuevo móvil para trasladarse con sus productos, confía en Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA lo cual solicita dicho crédito para completar su capital y poder obtenerlo.
texts.en:
Juan, 56, is a merchant; he has a small family-run micro business in his home where they make all kinds of baked goods typical of the area. Juan learned his skills working for others but now he has his own prosperous business. He himself sells his products in the area so he needs a new vehicle to do so. He trusts that Fundación Paraguaya and KIVA will provide the funds he needs to add to his capital so that he will be able to afford it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Los 5 Claveles Del Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO LOS CINCO CLAVELES ESTA CONFORMADO POR 11 SOCIOAS (OS), LAS CUALES  8 SON MUJERES Y TRES SON VARONES, TODAS VIENEN D. LA MISMA ZONA HUAYNA POTOSI D. AHI VIENE EL NOMBRE, LA MAYOR PARTE SON DUEÑAS D. CASA, LA MESA DIRECTIVA ESTA REPRESENTADA POR LAS SIGUIENTES PERSONAS.

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SEÑORA NANCY  D. 35 AÑOS VIVE EN ANTICRETICO, TIENE DOS LINDAS HIJAS A QUIENES ELLA LAS MANTIENE SOLA, SU ACTIVIDAD ES VENTA D. RELLENOS MADRUGA DESD. LAS 06:00 A.M. PARA SALIR A SU PUESTO A LAS 9:00 D. LA MAÑANA, ESTE CREDITO DESEMBOLSADO LO UTILIZARA PARA COMPRARSE UN PUESTO EN EL MATADERO YA QUE ES UN LUGAR MUY TRANSITADO Y TENDRA MAS VENTA Y ASI MEJORARA SU CALIDAD D. VIDA YA QUE TENDRA MAS INGRESOS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA ELABORACION D. SUS RELLENOS, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, POR SU SOLIDARIDAD FUE ELEGIDA COMO PRESIDENTA.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y TRABAJADORAS Y ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Los Cinco Claveles (“The Five Carnations”) Bank is maD. up 11 members, 8 of whom are women and 3 of them men. All of them come from the same neighborhood, called Huayna Potosi, hence the name of the group. Most of the members are homeowners. The board of directors includes the group’s president. Nancy, the president of the group, is 35 years old and lives in “anticrético” [Note: “anticrético is a Bolivian rental agreement in which tenants pay their landlord a fixed sum rather than a monthly rent]. She has two pretty daughters whom she is bringing up by herself. Nancy’s economic activity is selling rellenos (which in Bolivia are stuffed potatoes that are often sold as street food). She rises at 6:00 AM so that she can leave for her stand at 9:00 in the morning. The disbursed loan will be used to purchase a stand at the slaughterhouse, since it is a very busy place and she will have more sales. This will allow her to improve her quality of life, since she will have more income. She will also use the money to purchase ingredients for making rellenos. Nancy is very hardworking and responsible, and because of her solidarity with the rest of the group she was elected as the group’s president. All of the members are very responsible and hardworking, and they are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for rellenos

loans.name: Santiago Valentin

texts.es:
Santiago de 43 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales, El tiene una tienda de verduras y vegetales trabaja con su esposa, este negocio lo comenzó vendiendo arroz por libre en su casa, pero como la demanda de productos era mucha, decidió comprar mas víveres para vender. 

Trabaja todos los días con su esposa, veden verduras, legumbres y víveres. Vende al por menor y en ocasiones al por mayor aunque no mucho.  Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Santiago is 43 years old, lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil, and has 2 children who study in the public schools. He has a store that sells greens and he works there with his wife. When the business began, they sold rice by the pound from their home, but since demand for other products was high, he decided to buy more foodstuff to sell. Santiago and his wife work every day, selling greens, vegetables and other foods. He sells at retail and, occasionally, though not often, at wholesale. With this loan he wishes to buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar to stock his business. In the future he wishes to open a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE, SUGAR, AND COOKING OIL TO SELL

loans.name: Dunia Liseth

texts.es:
Doña Dunia se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “MAMIREBE” la cual tiene 1 año con 3 meses de haberlo instalado, en su negocio se encuentra lo mas necesario para el consumo diario, como ser: carnes, lácteos, embutidos, arroz, azúcar, huevos, café, etc.
El Negocio de doña Dunia esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico y el local es de un ambiente agradable, higiénico y de buena presentación. 
Doña Dunia, es madre soltera con 2 niños pero recibe un aporte económico de pensión alimentaría por el papá de sus niños, pero es ella quien vela por el bienestar de ellos.
En la actualidad la Sra. D., no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Dunia is a businesswoman. She runs a corner store called MAMIREBE. She’s had the store for 15 months and sells daily necessities such as meat, milk products, cold cuts, rice, sugar, eggs, coffee etc. Dunia’s store is in a really good location, and the place itself has a pleasant feel about it, and it’s clean and attractive. Dunia is a single mother with two children but receives financial support for food from their father. However, it is Dunia who is responsible for their upbringing. At the moment she doesn’t have enough money to buy more stock for the store and satisfy her customers’ needs. The loan will be used to buy more stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: EL SR. JUAN  NACIO EL 20 DE OCTUBRE DE 1965 EN SAMAIPATA TIENE PARCELA EN LA FLORIDA 5 HECTARIAS TAMBIEN TIENE 15 VACAS CADA UNA EN PRECIO DE 2000 BS Y EL TRABAJA AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA PERO MAS EN LA AGRICULTURA SIEMBRA PAPA, YUCA, POROTO, SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA SIEMBRA, COSECHA Y COMERCIALIZACION DE SUS PRODUCTOS EL DINERO SOLICITADO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL YA QUE QUIERE SEMBRAR OTRO PRODUCTO MAS Y NECESITA SEMILLAS, HERRAMIENTAS, ETC. EL SR. JUAN ES MUY TRABAJADOR Y SIEMPRE PENSANDO EN LE BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan was born on October 20th 1965 in Samaipata. He has a 5-hectare parcel of land in La Florida and also fifteen cows, each one worth 2000 Bs. He works as a farmer most of the time and also raises cattle. Juan grows potatoes, manioc, and green beans. His wife helps him sow the seeds, and harvest and sell the produce. Juan is asking for a loan as he wishes to grow other products. He needs seeds, tools etc. He is a very hardworking man, always thinking of his family’s wellbeing. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felix Calizto

texts.es:
Felix de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela, el antes de conocer a su esposa era albañil/ carpintero, pero al casarse necesitaba mas ingresos, decidió invertir sus ahorros en cuadernos y readecuo su casa para ubicar su papelería en la sala de su casa ya que no tiene dinero para alquilar un lugar.  

Poco a poco fue incrementando su papelería, hasta ahora que tiene muy surtido su negocio, ha implementado vender peluches y perfumes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pintura y tejas para arreglar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener un local.
texts.en:
47-year old Felix lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. He has two children who attend school. Before he met his wife, he was a builder/carpenter, but when he got married, he needed more income so he decided to invest his savings in school supplies. He altered his house so that he could run a stationery store out of the living room since he didn’t have enough money to rent separate premises. Over time Felix increased his merchandise so that he currently has a very well-stocked store. As well as stationery, he now sells soft toys and perfume. With the loan he wants to buy paint and tiles to fix up his house. In the future he wants to have his own store in a separate location.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paint and tiles

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar de 25 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas, el vende sus mercaderías en un puesto del mercado municipal de Villarrica,  vende prendas de vestir  para damas,  caballeros y niños,  como blusas de licras, algodón, vestidos, jeans y otros. Actualmente llega la temporada fría por lo desea adquirir gran cantidad de ropas como camperas, sueter, pantalones y otros.
Desde muy joven se inicio a la venta de ropas, gracias a la ayuda de su madre a quien pertenecía dicho puesto de venta, anualmente el negocio esta a  cargo de Cesar,  y día a día va creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo.  

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de más mercaderías de la temporada para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene
texts.en:
25-year old Cesar has his own business selling men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing from a stall in the municipal market of Villarrica. He sells lycra or cotton blouses, dresses, jeans and other clothing. Right now, as the cold season is approaching, he wants to stock up on jackets, sweaters, pants etc. Cesar has been selling clothing since he was a young man, helping his mother run this very same stall which used to belong to her. Gradually he took over the stall and it is doing very well thanks to his hard work. Cesar is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya to buy winter clothing for his many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Carmentina Lilii

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmentina S. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva, lociones, carteras, relojes y otras variedades,  actividad a la cual se a dedicado desde hace 17 años y lo hace de manera ambulante, es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.- sus clientes potenciales son los empleados de las empresas gubernamentales (Maestros, secretarias, aseadoras, promotores etc.) y tambien de la empresa privada, a todos les da el producto con facilidades de pago.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por las facilidades de pago que les da y los productos que son de muy buena calidad y de marcas reconocidas.
Doña Carmentina es casada y de su matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo al cual le cubre a un 100% los gastos; su esposo trabaja de tramitador de documentos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar carteras, cremas, zapatos y otros productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Carmentina S. sells new clothes, lotions, purses, watches and other merchandise. She has been in this line of work for 17 years and does it in an itinerant manner. It’s notable that during this time she has known how to administer it well. Her potential customers are employees of governmental agencies (teachers, secretaries, cleaning staff, spokespersons, etc.) and people in the private sector; she provides them all with easy payment plans. She has won over her customers with the easy payment plans she offers them and with the high quality of the well-known brand-name products she offers. Carmentina is married but only has one child that still depends 100% on her; her husband works as a document expediter. She will use the funds to buy purses, creams, shoes and other personal use items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, purses, creams, shampoo, hair conditioner.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa se dedica a la confección de Ropa para mujer (modista),  la mayoría de sus clientes son maestras de diferentes centros de estudios de esta ciudad, alumnos de los mismos y personas de otras oficinas gubernamentales y privadas, Rosa se ha sabido ganar la clientela por la especialidad con la que elabora las confecciones, además de dedicarse a la elaboración de ropa también arregla ropa que a las personas ya no le quedan o quieren hacer algún cambio en las mismas.
Rosa vivia en unión libre,  su compañero de hogar migro hacia los EE.UU. en busca de mejorar sus condiciones económicas, sus hijos que procreó con su compañero de hogar ya formaron sus propio hogares.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar telas, repuestos maquina de costurar, hilos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a seamstress; she makes women’s clothes. Most of her customers are teachers in various schools in the city, their students and employees of government and private offices. Rosa has won over customers with the special touches she puts into the items she makes; besides making new items she also provides alteration and repair services. Rosa has a common law partner but he emigrated to the United States to seek better economic opportunities; the children she had with him have all formed their own homes. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and sewing machine replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and sewing machine replacement parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra Norma Elizabeth L. B. de 38 años de edad es comerciante conocido en la zona, se dedica ala compra y venta de productos medicinales, al por mayor. 
Empezó hace más de 5 años con la ayuda de su esposo Don Hernán, ella cuenta con su negocio propio, ubicado en el mercado de  la ciudad de Villarrica-Guaira.
Actualmente quiere vender remedios naturales en paquetes pequeños que pueda ser accesibles para toda la gente para esto debe comprar en gran cantidad a granel remedios naturales y fraccionarlo de la mejor manera posible.  
Para llevar a cabo dicho proyecto solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Norma Elizabeth L. B., 38, is a well-known merchant in the area; she sells medicinal products at wholesale. She started about 5 years ago with help from her husband, Hernán. She owns her own stall in the city of Villarrica-Guaira’s market. She wants to sell natural remedies in small packages that will be accessible to everyone. To do this, she must buy in bulk and then repackage it the best way possible. She needs funding to carry out this project.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural remedies like boldo (a type of laurel used to treat gall bladders and upset stomachs), manzanilla (chamomile), etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy machines to make gold molds, car batteries, ropes and a car alternator.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy A. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es el negocio de variedades, mismo que opera bajo el nombre de variedades “LUCYS”
Su negocio esta ubicado en la Terminal de transportes de la ciudad de Danli, tambien esta frente a la estación de buses de Jacaleapa, cuenta con 24 años de experiencia en el negocio.
Doña Lucy tiene 10 años de haber instalado su propio negocio, con el cual durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien.- ella vende mercadería al por mayor y menor y tiene vendedores dentro de la Terminal de transporte. 

El crecimiento en su negocio es notable y esto es debido a la buena administración y atención que ella muestra a sus clientes, el local es muy estratégico para este tipo de actividad.  

Doña Lucy esta casada y su esposo es comerciante individual, él se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería al por mayor y la distribución de la misma.
De su matrimonio ya solo dependen 2 hijos.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucy A. is a merchant; she owns a variety store called “LUCYS” located in the city of Danli’s transportation terminal and also across from the Jacaleapa bus station. She has 24 years experience in this type of business. Lucy set up her own business 10 years ago and has done quite well all this time. She sells merchandise at wholesale and retail and has sellers inside the transportation terminal. Her business has grown notably thanks to the good administration and attention she gives to her customers; besides the locale is very strategically located for this type of business. Lucy is married and her husband is also a merchant; he buys merchandise at wholesale for resale. They still have two dependent children. She will use the funds to buy more merchandise in order to better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sunglasses,sashes, hats, caps, watches, cell phone accessories, tote bags, hair pins.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Domingo Rufino

texts.es:
El  microempresario: Domingo Rufino Zeledón A. tiene 65 años de edad es casado y tiene cinco hijos todos adultos. Desde hace 14 años se dedica a vender sorbete en un carrito de madera de manera ambulante por toda la ciudad de Bluefields. Actualmente vive con su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla de maíz. Con el ingreso de ambos pueden mantenerse ya que no reciben ayuda de sus hijos quienes se encuentran fuera del país.

El señor Zeledón ya fue beneficiado con un primer préstamo por parte de Kiva, el cual ya cancelo en tiempo y forma. Don Rufino agradece el gesto de los prestamistas en ayudar a familias pobres tanto de nuestro país como de otros países también pobres como el nuestro.

Don Rufino esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

Dos  Llantas para el carrito el par cuesta US 50.00 dólares, una caja de leche que cuesta US 65.00 dólares la caja, un quintal de azúcar que cuesta US 35.00 dólares, tres tanques de sorbete que cuesta 35.00 dólares cada tanque, tres cajas de cono que cuestan US 25.00 dólares cada caja y dos sabores para sorbetes que cuestan US 35.00 dólares cada caja.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Domingo Rufino is 65 years old, married, and has 5 children, all adults. For 14 years he has sold sherbet from a small wooden cart in the streets of Bluefields. He lives with his wife who sells corn tortillas. With the income of both they are able to maintain themselves, and they receive no help from their children who live outside the country. Rufino has already benefited from his 1st Kiva loan, which he paid off as prescribed and on time. He is grateful for the offer of loans to benefit poor families in his country, as well as in other poor countries like his. Rufino is soliciting a loan to buy the following: 2 tires for his little cart, totaling $50 dollars; a package of powdered milk, costing $65 dollars; a 100-weight of sugar, costing $35 dollars; 3 tanks of sherbet, costing $35 dollars; 3 boxes of cones, costing $25 dollars per box; and 2 boxes of sherbet flavoring, costing $35 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TIRES FOR HIS CART, AND MILK, SUGAR, CONES, FLAVORS FOR SHERBET, AND TANKS OF SHERBET

loans.name: Lidia Yolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia V. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de verduras,  actividad en la cual cuenta con 18 años de experiencia.
La Sra. V. tiene ubicado su negocio en el mercado “Nuevo Amanecer” cubículo Nº 2 de la ciudad de danlí, y realiza ventas al por mayor y al detalle.
Doña Lidia  además de vender en el cubículo también tiene 3 vendedores los cuales salen a vender verduras en bicicletas de carga que ella posee dándoles como sueldo el 25% de las ventas que realizan.
Doña Lidia vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar de igual manera se dedica al comercio, el cual posee un vehiculo y transporta verduras desde Tegucigalpa y sale a vender en los mercados de la ciudad de danlí.

Doña Lidia nos comento que anteriormente residían en Tegucigalpa y que llegaron a esta ciudad de Danlí en busca de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que en la capital es mas cara la vida y expresa que en el poco tiempo que tiene de vivir en Danlí sus condiciones de vida han mejorado en gran manera ya que ahora poseen su propia vivienda lo que nunca pudieron tener durante el tiempo que vivieron en Tegucigalpa. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras y surtir más su negocio ya que su clientela día a día es mas grande.
De su matrimonio tienen 4 hijos que dependen a un 100% de ellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia V. has a business selling vegetables, an activity she's been doing for 18 years. Mrs. V. has her business situation in the "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) market, stand No. 2 in the city of Danli, where she does wholesale and retail sales. In addition to selling in the stand, Ms. V. has three salespersons who go out on bicycles to sell vegetables, and she pays them 25% of the sales their make. Ms. Lidia cohabits with her life partner, who also works equally hard at business. He has a car and transports vegetables from Tegucigalpa to Danli city markets. Ms. Lidia told us that previously, they lived in Tegucigalpa. They moved to Danli in search of better living conditions as the capital is very expensive. In the short time they've lived in Danli their living condition have improved and they already own their own home, something they never could have done while living in Tegucigalpa. She wants to use the loan to buy a wide variety of vegetables to increase her supply and meet the demands of her increasingly growing clientele. From her relationship, she has four children who depend on her and her partner 100%.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of fruits and vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Sra. Del Pilar M. González de 37 años de edad es vendedora de leche conocido en la zona, vende varias partes de la zona de Villarrica. 
Empezó hace 5 años con la ayuda de su esposo Ricardo Cabral Benítez, quien trabaja como capataz de dicha una estancia (establecimiento ganadero).
La señora Del Pilar quiere aumentar la cantidad de leche para vender y para ello debe comprar una vaca lechera y  solicita el préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya ya que ella no cuenta con el dinero para realizar dicha compra.
Ella confía mucho en su trabajo y tiene mucha esperanza de que puede mejorar la situación de vida actual.
texts.en:
La señora Del Pilar M. González is 37 years old and is a well-known seller of milk in the area. She sells in different portions of the area around Villarrica. She began 5 years ago with the help of her husband, Ricardo Cabral Benítez. He works as a foreman on a large ranch. La señora Del Pilar would like to increase milk sales and therefore must buy a dairy cow. She has requested a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya (local lending institution) because she doesn't have the money to buy a cow. She feels confident of success in her work and fully expects to improve her current living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow from Holland

loans.name: Don Bosco(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Don Bosco esta formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que buscan el bienestar para sus familias,  viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que los ecuatorianos la consideran la ciudad más bella del país, uno de los atractivos son las hermosas artesanías que se encuentran por toda la ciudad  desde blusas bordadas, suéteres de lana, joyería de filigrana bañada en oro y plata y tejidos. Cuenca igualmente tiene una tradición en artículos de cerámica, artesanías y productos frescos pueden ser hallados de venta en la feria de los jueves o en el mercado (más pequeño) los sábados. Una industria líder en Cuenca y sus alrededores es la de la confección de sombreros de paja toquilla.

 María de Lourdes G. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una socia muy alegre que irradia mucho carisma se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y es una de las fundadoras de este  bankito  y se encuentra con muchas ganas de crecer en sus negocios. 

Es una mujer de 30 años de edad, se encuentra separada hace 5 meses de su esposo, en su unión conyugal concibió cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 11, 8, 7, 4 años, sus tres primeros hijos cursan los estudios  primarios en la escuela de la localidad y como no tienen  casa propia vive arrendando.

María ha retomado su negocio de venta de productos Yanbal  hace 4 años  ya que vendía estos productos desde que tenía  18 años, también trabaja los días jueves, viernes y sábado en un gabinete de belleza  arte que aprendió  sola, con su nuevo credito va a comprar cremas, tratamientos, maquillajes, perfumes y bisutería de productos Yanbal.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su propio gabinete de belleza.

 Verónica García tiene 29 años y es otra de las socias activas de éste banco,   vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con sus cuatro niños  de  11, 7, 6, 4 años  en una casita arrendada,  sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad y el más pequeño pasa con ella, nos comenta que no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda del padre de sus hijos por lo que sola debe sacarlos adelante.

Verónica vende ropa  catalogo  hace un año y también se dedica a impulsar  varios productos en los almacenes y supermercados de la ciudad cuando  sus conocidos la llaman para que realice este trabajo ya que lleva 10 años en ésta actividad.

Este  es su primer crédito con su banco comunal  y está muy esperanzada en salir adelante junto con sus hijos, con su préstamo   comprará  pantalones, calentadores, blusas, sacos y mas ropa para seguir progresando en su negocio.

Su sueño es llegar a  tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Don Bosco is made up of a group of enterprising women who are looking out for their families' wellbeing. They live in the city of Cuenca which Ecuadorians consider the most beautiful city in the coutry. One of its attractions is the beautiful artisan crafts that are found throughout the city, from embroidered blouses, wool sweaters, gold and sliver plated filigree jewelry to weavings. Cuenca also has a tradition of producing ceramic items, artisan crafts and fresh produce that can be found in the market on Thursdays or in the (smaller) market on Saturdays. One industry leader in Cuenca and its surrounding towns is the production of toquilla straw hats. María de Lourdes G. lives in the city of Cuenca. She is a very cheerful member who radiates a lot of charisma, is in her second cycle and is one of the founders of this little bank. She is very eager to grow her businesses. She is a 30 year old woman and she has been separated from her husband for 5 months. Her marriage produced four children aged 11,8,7, and 4. Her three oldest children are studying in the local elementary school and since they don't own their own home they are renting. María took up the business of selling Yanbal products again 4 years ago. She has sold these products since she was 18 years old. She also works Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays in a a beauty salon. She learned this skill on her own. With the new loan, she will purchase creams, treatments, makeup, perfume, and costume jewelry from Yanbal. Her dream is to have her own beauty salon. Verónica García is 29 years old ans she is another active member of this bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca with her four children aged 11,7,6, and 4 in a little rented house. Her three oldest children are in an elementary school in the city and the youngest stays with her. She tells us that she does not receive any help from the childrens' father and so she must get them ahead on her own. Verónica has been selling catalog clothing for a year and she also promotes various products in the stores and supermarkets in the city when acquaintances call her to do this work. She has been doing this activity for 10 years. This is her first loan with her communal bank and she is very hopeful to get ahead with her children. With her loan she will purchase pants, sweatsuits, blouses, jackets and more clothing to continue progressing in her business. Her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams, treatments, makeup, perfume and costume jewelry from Yanbal as well as pants, sweatsuits, blouses, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 25 años, convive con su actual pareja y juntos tienen un hijo. Reside en una comunidad ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tiene su casa propia.Lucy creció en su comunidad, a unos pasos del rio . Sus padres se dedicaban a la agricultura y siempre los ayudaba en los quehaceres del hogar, y también lo hacia en su chacra.  A los 17 años empezó a independizarse , es por esta razón que  sus padres le otorgaron una parcela de terreno de cultivo, pero ella quería cambiar de negocio .En la actualidad atiende su tienda abarrotes, y le va muy bien . Cada día empieza con  su negocio desde  las 6 de la mañana  hasta las 9 de la noche, para lograr atender las demandas de sus comensales. Por lo general trabaja junto con su esposo, pero usualmente está a cargo sola de su negocio. En el futuro anhela ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de vender al por mayor y menor.Este es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir con sus respetivos pagos, además dice que trabaja en unión con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal.Y tiene pensado invertir el dinero  solicitado, en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería , con la finalidad de surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Lucy lives with her partner, and together they have a son. She resides in a community located in the Cuzqueña jungle, where she has her own home. She grew up in this community, only a few steps from the river. Her parents are farmers, and she has always helped them in their home and at their garden. She started to become independent at age 17, and therefore her parents gave her a plot of land to cultivate, but she wanted to change to another line of work. She now runs a grocery store, with much success. She begins work each day at 6 in the morning and works until 9 at night, attending to the needs of her customers. She generally works with her husband, but often is alone in charge of the business. In the future, she wishes to expand her grocery store with the goal of selling at wholesale and retail. This is her second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma (local lending institution), and she is committed to timely repayment. In addition, she says that she works together with all the members of her communal bank. Her thought is to invest the loan proceeds in a large amount of merchandise, which will be used as store inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase a large amount of groceries

loans.name: Silvio José

texts.es:
El señor Silvio José M., tiene la edad de 48 años es casado y con sus dos hijos habitan en el Barrio Georgino Andrade, uno de sus hijos labora y le apoya económicamente a sus padres, El señor  labora como panadero, actividad que le ha producido problemas en su salud, pero es la principal fuente de ingresos de la familia, y tiene mucha popularidad en su barrio por la buena calidad de sus productos.

El negocio ha registrado muy buenos resultados,  razón por la cual ahora desea realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda, la edificación de un muro que le divida el área del patio con un cuarto, dará mejores condiciones de habitad y comodidades para todos. Con este préstamo realizara las compras de materiales de construcción necesarias para llevar a andar este proyecto, el apoyo que se le brinde aportara a mejorara día a día sus forma de vivir, en el pasado a tenido otros préstamos con Afodenic y dice sentirse complacido de obtener excelentes resultados que a la fecha han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones socio-económicas.
texts.en:
Silvio José M., 48, is married and has two children; they all live in Georgino Andrade neighborhood. One of his sons is employed and helps his parents out financially. Silvio is a baker, an occupation that has caused him some health problems, but it’s the family’s main source of income; he is very popular in his neighborhood due to the good quality of his products. The business has been having good results so he wants to make some home improvements; he’d like to build a wall to separate the yard from a bedroom which will provide better living conditions and more comfort for everyone. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies to do this project. Whatever help he gets will improve his day-to-day existence. He has had previous loans with Afodenic and he says that he is pleased with the excellent results which he’s had to date that have made it possible for him to improve his socio-economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in his house.

loans.name: Family (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Family está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que buscan el bienestar para sus familias viven en la ciudad de Cuenca urbe considerada cuna de artistas y deportistas, tienen varios atractivos turísticos como sus hermosos templos, los ríos que bañan la urbe, sus artesanías, paisajes y calidez de  la gente hacen una ciudad para volver a visitarla. La mayoría de sus integrantes son familias que se agruparon para mejorar su situación económica y familiar.

La  señora Gloria O. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca  con su esposo que es artesano en joyería  y tiene su propio taller y con dos de sus cinco hijos ya que los tres mayores son casados y viven independientes, su cuarto hijo trabaja en una mecánica y  su última hija trabaja realizando quehaceres domésticos medio tiempo y por la tarde se dedica a la venta de bisutería, sus dos hijos le ayudan un poco económicamente con los gastos del hogar y pago de arriendo porque aun no tienen casa propia.

Gloria se dedica a realizar quehaceres domésticos hace 10 años, y también elabora tejidos como carteras, bufandas, etc.  Esta labor la aprendió sola y lleva 2 años realizando estas manualidades, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hilo  y lanas para sus tejidos, su mayor sueño es llegar  a tener una casa propia.

María Rosario  Sánchez  es otra de las socias de éste banco, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca,  es una mujer  muy alegre  tiene 65 años de edad se encuentra viuda hace 10 años a causa de un atropellamiento a su esposo, en su unión conyugal concibió  seis hijos de ellos cinco  son casados y viven de manera independiente, solo su hijo soltero le ayuda económicamente y con el pago del arriendo de la casa. Nuestra socia se encuentra muy preocupada ya que a su hijo le atropello un vehiculo cuando tenida 12 años ahora tiene 29 años de edad y le han detectado un tumor en su celebro.

María Rosario se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de frutas en el mercado 9 de Octubre, esta actividad la realiza hace 42 años trabajando de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., no tiene un puesto propio por lo que es una vendedora ambulante, con su crédito va a comprar  naranjas, manzanas, naranjillas, melón, etc. 

Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Family” communal bank is composed of a group of enterprising women who work hard to secure their families’ wellbeing; they all live in Cuenca, a city considered to be the birthplace of artists and sports heroes. It has several tourist attractions like: beautiful churches, the rivers that bathe the city, its crafts, scenery and the warmth of its inhabitants, all of which make it a city that you want to return to for another visit. Most of its members are families that grouped together to improve their family and economic situation. Gloria O. lives in downtown Cuenca with her husband who is a jewelry craftsperson who has his own shop, and two of their five children since the three oldest are adult, married and living independently. Her fourth son works in a machine shop and her youngest daughter works half time doing domestic chores and half time selling costume jewelry. Both children help a bit financially with household expenses and rent because she still does not own a house of her own. Gloria has been a domestic employee for 10 years but also weaves purses, scarves, etc. She taught herself how to weave and has been making these crafts for 2 years. She will use the funds to buy thread and wool for her weavings. Her greatest wish is to have a house of her own. María Rosario S., 65, is another group member. She lives in downtown Cuenca and is a very cheerful woman who has been widowed for 10 years; her husband was run over and killed. She had 6 children five of whom are married and live independently; her only single son helps out financially and with rent payments. She is very worried because her son was hit by a car when he was 12 years old; he’s now 29 and has been diagnosed with a brain tumor. María Rosario has sold all kinds of fruit in the 9 de Octubre market for 42 years; she is open for business from Monday through Friday from 8am to 5pm. She does not have a stall of her own so she sells by wandering through the aisles of the market. She will use the funds to buy oranges; her goal is to have a house of her own some day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, wool and fruits like: apples, oranges, melons, mandarin oranges, etc.

loans.name: Ayda Luz

texts.es:
La señora Ayda Luz G. R., es madre soltera de dos hijas adolecentes, ella tiene la edad de 44 años, se gana la vida como docente desde hace 5 años, permitiéndoles una mejor educación a sus sucesoras.

Su hogar es una morada humilde que limita el buen vivir, por la falta de comodidades que posee, es por tal razón que la señora Ayda solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y puerta de madera que mejoren la fachada de la casa, las condiciones de techo y paredes de su hogar, esta inversión le brindará a la señora G. la satisfacción necesaria de poder ofrecerle a sus hijas, un lugar digno donde habitar, debido a  que por las edades que poseen le demandan mejores condiciones socio-económicas que preocupan día a día a su madre.
texts.en:
Ayda Luz G. R., 44, is a single mother of two adolescent girls; she has earned her livelihood as a teacher for the last 5 years making a better education possible for her heirs. Her home is a humble dwelling that limits their quality of life because it lacks many comforts. Because of this, Ayda is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies as well as a wood door that will improve the façade of the house, the roof and its walls. This investment will provide Mrs. G. with the satisfaction of offering her daughters a proper place to live, something their mother worries about daily, especially now that they are at an age when they are asking for better socio-economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her home's façade.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las gestiones que hicieron las señoras  Victoriana Zarza y Ana Epifania A..
Hoy día el comité se encuentra trabajando con mucha esperanza y entusiasmo, ya que el trabajo que cada una realiza le genera ingreso para su familia.
Se puede hablar de la  Ana Epifania A. Vda de Villar, quien  tiene 51 años.
Ella vive con su único Hijo, soltero ,31 años quién es chofer y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Es una señora muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la confección de ao po’i y bordados en distintos tipos de telas.
Todos sus trabajos son muy llamativos, originales y creativos por lo son vendidas fácilmente en los negocios de la ciudad.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to efforts made by Victoriana Zarza and Ana Epifania A.. The committee is working with much hope and enthusiasm because the work which each one does generates income for their family. We feature Ana Epifania A. Vda de Villar, 51. She lives with her only single son, 31, who is a driver and helps out with household expenses. She is a very hard-working woman. She makes ao poí (Peruvian craft) and embroiders on different kinds of fabric. All of her items are very eye-catching, original and creative so they sell easily in the city’s stores.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ao po'i (Peruvian craft) fabrics.

loans.name: Mirachisun Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mirachisun que significa Hagamos Crecer inicia su ciclo 22 con 20 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es la venta de tubérculos, cosméticos, golosinas, artesanía, ropa, gas, joyas, abarrotes en general, repuestos, jugos, cereales y animales menores.
Como es el caso de la Señora Nora que es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Nora se dedica a la venta de jugo de naranja que prepara ella misma, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además vende chicha y golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Nora invertirá su préstamo para el arreglo de su carreta y ampliar para vender mas productos. Los sueños de Nora son tener casa propia, educar a sus hijos, mejorar su negocio y tener un lugar estable para su negocio. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 10,200 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The “Mirachisun,” which means “Let’s Create Growth,” is starting its 22nd cycle with 20 members. The members are in a variety of commercial activities like: sale of tubers, cosmetics sales, sweets sales, clothing sales, gas, jewelry and grocery sales; replacement parts, juices, cereals and small farm animals. Such is Nora’s case. She is 40 years old, married and has three children. She sells home-made orange juice throughout the city’s wholesale food market; she also sells chicha (an alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) and snacks every day. She will use her loan to repair her cart and expand so that she can sell more products. Her dream is to have her own home, educate her children, improve her business and have a stable location for her business. The members all need varying loan amounts like: 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles for a total group loan of 10200 soles to the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her cart.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario, de 52 años, es casado y tiene ocho hijos. Reside en una comunidad de la selva cusqueña, y en este lugar tiene su casa que es propia.Nazario recuerda que cuando era joven cometió ciertos  errores como agricultor, ya que vendía sus productos a precios inferiores , y solo le servía para subsistir, pero eso le sirvió de mucho para que aprenda a comparar los precios del mercado. Es por esta razón que en la actualidad atiende a grandes compradores a un  precio competitivo, y esta obteniendo buenos resultados económicos. Ya lleva 44 años dedicándose a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo del cacao, y en el futuro piensa ampliar su terreno de cultivo, con la finalidad de poder satisfacer a sus habituales clientes. Normalmente trabaja solo,pero en tiempo de siembra  y cosecha necesita de la ayuda de sus peones para que le agilicen la extracción de sus productos. Y luego los comercializa en su misma comunidad.Este es su tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, durante las fechas estipuladas; además agradece a su banco comunal por lo facilidades que le brinda, que les favorece para trabajar en equipo. Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de cacao a otros productores, con el propósito de atender la demanda de sus clientes y además mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nazario, 52, is married and has 8 children. He lives in a community in the Cusco backcountry where he owns his house. Nazario remembers that when he was young he made some mistakes as a farmer because he would sell his crops for too low a price and only earned enough income to subsist. However, this experience served him well because he learned how to buy at market prices. He currently has many large buyers that pay competitive prices and he’s getting good economic results. He has been a farmer for 44 years, specifically cocoa bean farming. In the future, he plans to expand his growing fields aiming at producing enough to meet all his regular customer demand. Normally he works alone but during planting and harvesting seasons he hires field hands to help ease the work load. He sells his crops in his own community. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion; he is also grateful to his communal bank for the easy payment plans it offers that allows them to work well as a team. He plans to use the funds to buy large amounts of cocoa beans from other producers so that he can have enough to meet customer demand and to improve his living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large amounts of cocoa beans to sell.

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
La señora Sara maría G. P., tiene 53 años es madre soltera de 4 hijos, que habitan y sobreviven de sus propios ingresos, hace unos años se divorsio de su pareja quedando en ella todas las deudas y gastos a incurrir en la casa y con su familia, recibe de sus hijos un apoyo para conllevar los gastos mensuales en los que se incurre, labora como conserje desde hace 3 años, siendo una mujer humilde de recursos limitados que le obstaculizan mejorar su forma de habitar.

Razón por la cual, ella solicita de un préstamo para la ampliación de su dormitorio, el lugar en donde se encuentra en la foto es donde se edificara su cuarto, esta construccion le permitirá una independencia y comodidad personal y continuara con las edificaciones que empezó gracias también a los prestamos de Afodenic, la continuidad de este proyecto favorecerá a su diario vivir.
texts.en:
Sara María G. P. is 53 years old and the single mother of 4 children, who are living independently on their own incomes. She was divorced from her husband a few years ago, and all of the debts and expenses of her family fell to her. She receives support from her children to cover her monthly costs, and she has also worked as a custodian for 3 years. She is a woman of humble means with limited resources which hinder her from improving her standard of living. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to expand her bedroom. The place where she is standing in the photo is the site where she will build her room. This construction will give her more personal independence and comfort, continuing with the construction she began thanks to previous loans from Afodenic. Carrying out this project will improve the quality of her daily life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Orlando Rafael

texts.es: El señor Orlando Rafael V.
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando Rafael Alvarez V. is 30 years old, married, and he lives with his wife in a neighborhood called Buenos Aires. She too is a merchant and adds income to the family economy. Orlando dedicates himself to the sale of second-hand and new clothes, and has also done electrical work. For more than 4 years, he has worked in the wholesale distribution of goods, supplying the capital's markets, while hoping for a better future. One of the greatest problems he has endured during his career, has been the lack of financial support that microfinance banks offer. Orlando has lacked the few resources that ensure good pay, but with the accessibility of Afodenic, and thanks to Kiva funds, he can now have access to a loan to purchase a larger inventory of merchandise, which will increase his sales volume and produce a higher income. This will allow for new investment in future sources of work that should, day by day, improve the level of life for him and all his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HIS CLOTHING SALES BUSINESS

loans.name: Rosa Georgina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Georgina G., tiene la edad de 39 años vive en los Laureles norte con su compañero de vida, él labora como conductor apoyando a su mujer a los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja como niñera, ganándose la vida de una manera muy humilde,  pero honrada desde hace mas de 3 años.

Los recursos de la familia son bastante limitados y su vivienda necesita de muchas reparaciones entre ella está el cambio del techo de la cocina, es para este fin que solicitan de un préstamo para la compra  de laminas de zinc, estas reparaciones son de urgencia debido a que se acercan las temporadas de lluvia y afectan su modo de vivir y el agua deteriora aun más su hogar, un apoyo a la familia favorecerá en gran medida su forma de habitad, que permitan mayores comodidades que beneficien a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and lives is Los Laureles north with her partner. He works as a driver and helps his wife with the household expenses. She works as a nanny, and has been earning her living in this very humble but honorable way for 3 years. The family's resources are fairly limited and their home is in need of many repairs including a new roof for the kitchen. It is with this goal in mind that they are requesting a loan to buy zinc sheeting. These repairs are urgently needed because the rainy season is approaching and this affects their way of living. The water will also further deteriorate their home. This loan for this family will help their standard of living in a significant way and will give them greater home comforts that will benefit all the family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A new roof for her home

loans.name: Las Acllas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Acllas inicia su cuarto ciclo con 16 socias, que son del Distrito de Vischongo, Provincia de VilcasH., que se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es la venta de abarrotes en general, panes, quesos, animales menores, carne, golosinas, comida y servicios de carpintería.
Como es el caso de la Señora Aydee que es secretaria del Banco Comunal, Aydee es conviviente y no tiene hijos, socia hace 1 año, Aydee tiene una panadería, actividad que inicio vendiendo panes y pasteles de manera ambulatoria en una carretilla, actualmente tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde comercializa sus panes y además vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos. Los sueños de Aydee es tener un local propio para su panadería, tener 2 hijos educarlos y darles todo lo mejor.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 11,500 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Acllas is starting its fourth loan cycle with 16 members who are from the Vischongo district of the province of VilcasH., which is located 3 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The members run different businesses such as selling general groceries, bread, cheese, young animals, meet, candy, food, and carpentry services. This is the case for Aydee, who is the secretary of the community bank. Aydee lives with her partner and has no children. She has been a member of the bank for 1 year. Aydee has a bakery, and she started this business buy selling break and cakes from a small cart. She currently rents a small store where she sells her bread and also general groceries, which she does with the help of her husband. Her loan will be used to buy sacs of flour. Aydee dreams of owning her own bakery premises and of having two good children to whom she can offer the best in life. The members need different loan amounts like 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, making a total of 11,500 soles for the whole community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour

loans.name: Judit

texts.es: Judit, D. 38 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. ResiD. en una comunidad  ubicada en L. hermosa selva cuzqueña, donD. tienen su casa propia.DesD. hace 20 años se dedica a L. actividad agrícoL., específicamente al cultivo D. cacao y café. Judit  piensa que será un gran mayorista, siente que todavía le falta mucho por  emprender , y recuerda lo  mucho que le ha costado ser un buen comerciante,pero todo lo logrado se lo debe a sus padres. No contento por el éxito actual D. su negocio , junto con su esposa, decidieron instalar una tienda D. abarrotes, con L. finalidad D. tener una ventaja competitiva ante los demás, y  le está yendo muy bien. Por lo general Judit se hace cargo solo  D. L. siembra D. sus productos agrícolas, pero también cuenta con L. ayuda D.  sus peones que le facilitan el trabajo.Además su esposa está cargo del negocio D. abarrotes D. manera íntegra. Generalmente  venD. sus productos en su comunidad. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su tienda D. abarrotes, implantando nuevos productos naturales , D. acuerdo a L. posibilidades económicas D. sus clientes.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivas obligaciones, además agradece L. confianza que le esta brindando su grupo comunal.El dinero lo invertirá en comprar más cantidad D.  mercadería con el propósito D. abastecer su tienda D. abarrotes y a L.  vez generar una buena cantidad D. ingresos.
texts.en:
Judit is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a community located in the beautiful Cuzqueña forest, where he has his own house. He has been working in agriculture for 20 years, growing cocoa and coffee. Judit thinks of being a big wholesaler, but feels that he doesn't have everything that he needs to get started, and he remembers what it has cost him to be a good businessman. But he owes all that he has achieved to his parents. Not content with the current success of his business, Judit, along with his wife, decided to open a grocery store with the goal of having a competitive advantage over the rest, and this is going well. Judit usually takes sole care of sowing his crops, but can also count on laborers to help him with his work. His wife works as a partner in the grocery store. They generally sell their products in their community. For the future, Judit plans to expand his grocery store and introduce new natural products, in accordance with the economic means of his customers. This is his fourth loan from MFP, and he promises to meet his obligations. He is also grateful for the confidence that is offered to his community group. He will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise with the goal of stocking his grocery store and bringing in a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Yarely

texts.es:
Yarely C. R., vive en  el barrio Villa Sol de Soledad, ella tiene 3 hijos entre 10 y 16 años de edad; antes trabajaba en una empresa y simultáneamente se dedicaba al comercio, pero como trabajaba en el área de preparación de alimentos, su salud empezó a deteriorarse y en la actualidad tiene un trabajo independiente: se dedica a vender mercancías como cosméticos, artículos de cocina, accesorios y prendas de plata, mediante revistas especializadas y también tiene un pequeño punto de ventas   ubicado donde en la casa de su madrina quien la ayuda mucho. 

Inició su negocio hace 4 años cuando una amiga la incorporó al programa de una revista,  ahora ella muestra los productos que ofrece mediante este sistema de promoción y selecciona solo a clientes que tengan capacidad de pago para no perder dinero. Dice que para sacar a sus hijos adelante ella debe hacer todos los esfuerzos necesarios para hacer crecer su negocio, aunque recibe un gran respaldo de su  cónyuge a nivel  económico y emocional, esto la hace sentirse tranquila.

En la actualidad solicita  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar artículos que tiene encargados como fantasías, cosméticos y perfumes, desde hace dos años está con los programas de esta organización  y ella dice que con este dinero ha podido aumentar su capital, invertir en el levante de muros de su vivienda  y   le ha servido de mucho  porque pudo salirse de un empleo que le estaba haciendo daño a su salud y trabajar de manera independiente;  también considera que con ellos puede tener dinero disponible para buenos clientes que no tienen para comprar de contado y ella los financia y aprovecha las ofertas que traen los productos exhibidos en las revistas.
Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa que ya está muy avanzada y ponerla mas habitable,  para pasarse con su familia porque en la actualidad vive en la casa de sus padres. Quiere que sus hijos se preparen y progresen y que aprovechen los esfuerzos que ella puede hacer ahora que tiene buena salud y juventud.
texts.en:
Yarely C. R. lives in the neighborhood of Villa Sol de Soledad. She has three children between the ages of 10 and 16. Yarely previously worked for a company and also had a side business preparing and selling food. However, her health began to deteriorate and now works as an independent sales representative offering products such as cosmetics, kitchenware, accessories, and silver jewelry through specialized catalogs. Yarely also manages a small store in the house of her godmother, who has provided her with much support.

Four years ago, Yarely started her business when a friend also joined the catalog program. She now shows her products through a promotional system and selects only those customers who have the ability to pay in order to avoid losing money. Yarely says she has been able to move her children forward and make all the necessary efforts to grow her business. She receives a great deal of financial and emotional support from her husband, who helps her to remain calm.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of 2,000,000 COP to purchase items from which she will receive commission such as costume jewelry, cosmetics, and perfumes. Yarely has participated in the FMSD programs for two years and says this loan will increase her capital so that she can begin investing in the construction of her house. She also says FMSD allowed her to get out of a job that was damaging to her health and work independently. In addition, she believes that the organization gives financial access to good clients like her who cannot afford to conduct business in cash but have opportunities to take advantage of sales promotions for products offered in the catalogs.

Her dream is to finish her house, which is in the advanced stages of construction, and make it more habitable. She hopes to spend time with her family because she currently lives at her parents’ house. Yarely wants her children to become prepared and take advantage of her efforts to create opportunities for them while they are healthy and young.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase costume jewelry, cosmetics, and perfumes

loans.name: Jorge Luís

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Jorge Luís G. le esta haciendo falta el piso de enfrente de la vivienda. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar el piso y que no cuenta con el dinero necesario.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como policía escolar de la ciudad. Con el vive su hermana la señora Maria Elizabeth G. quien le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Desea que su casa este en mejores condiciones.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Elizabeth G., hermana del señor Jorge Luía G., ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día que la visita.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Jorge Luís G. is lacking a floor at the front of his house. He is requesting a loan to buy the materials and pay a contractor to lay down the floor since he does not have the necessary funds. Sr. Jorge plans to repay the loan using the salary he earns working as a school police officer for the city. His sister, Sra. Maria Elizabeth G., lives with him and helps with the family expenses. He wants his home to have better conditions.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria Elizabeth G., the sister of Sr. Jorge Luís G., since he was already at work on the day of this visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & pay a contractor to lay down a concrete floor

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan E. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos ya adolescentes que necesitan su espacio en la casa. 
Desea empezar la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta alta de la caso, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el materia y empezar la construcción de las recamaras que serán para sus niños. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una formación en el aria de gerente. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria De Jesus Gómez esposa del señor Juan E. ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan E. is the father of two teenage children who need space in their house. He wants to begin construction of two rooms on the upper floor of his house, but he does not have the money needed to buy the materials. Sr. Juan wants to begin the work in order to provide bedrooms for his children. He plans to repay the loan using the salary he earns from his job as a training manager.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria De Jesus Gómez, the wife of Sr. Juan E., since he was already at work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of two bedrooms on the upper floor of his house

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La Sra. Trinidad es madre soltera y tiene toda su vida esforzadose por sacar adelante a sus hijos								
brindándoles lo mejor posible siendo padre y madre a la vez, a ella le resultaba difícil encontrar no								
solo una institución que le otorgara ayuda sino también que comprendiera su situación.								
Agradece de corazón le apoyo que se le pueda brindar, para que pueda compra ropa nueva y semi-usada y asi 

tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en: Sra. Trinadad is a single mother that has worked hard her whole life to provide for her children. At times she plays the role of both mother and father. She has had a hard time finding an institution that would help her out and that could also understand her situation. She is thankful from the bottom of her heart for the help that you can give her. She plans on using her loan to buy new clothes and semi-used closed to expand her business. [[[Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí, de  21 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Reside en una comunidad ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su casa que es propia.A pesar de su corta edad decidió instalar  una pequeña bodega con la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares. En la actualidad  tiene una buena cantidad de habituales clientes , esto debido al  buen servicio que ofrece.Además le gusta su trabajo, ya que sabe medir las necesidades de sus clientes, y siempre se abastece de productos indispensables, para ofrecer lo mejor a sus compradores . Generalmente trabaja sola  y de vez en cuando recibe la ayuda de su esposo. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad y a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias económicas, para el futuro  planea ampliar su  tienda de abarrotes, introduciendo nuevos productos, para captar nuevos clientes.Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente  , además felicita el desempeño de  su banco comunal , por el buen trabajo  que vienen realizando.Noemi tiene planeado invertir  el dinero  solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería, para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, así sabe que obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Noemí is 21 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in a community in the tropical Peruvian jungle where she has her own home. Despite her young age, she decided to open a small grocery store in order to cover her family’s expenses. She currently has a good number of regular customers as a result of the excellent service that she offers. Noemí enjoys her job since she likes getting to know the needs of her customers and always having essential products on hand so that she can offer the best to them. She generally works alone, but occasionally receives help from her husband. Her grocery store is located within her community and she has future plans for expansion. Noemí will introduce new products so that she can attract more customers and generate better revenues.

This is her third loan with MFP. Noemí promises to complete her payments on time and is happy with the good work that her Communal Bank has accomplished. She will use the money she requested to purchase large quantities of merchandise to restock her store so that she can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Vivo con mis padres ya que son personas de la tercera edad, por ello he quedado a cargo de ellos								
para cuidarlos y de alguna manera agradecerles todo lo que han hecho por mi.								
Tengamos una tiendita de abarrotes, sin embargo no habia podido tener tanta variedad								
como queria. Pero gracias a ustedes podre incrementar la variedad de mercancias y dar una mejor								
vida a mis padres.
texts.en:
I live with my parents - since they are elderly, I stay at home to take care of them and in a way thank them for all that they have done for me. We have a small grocery store. However, we have not been able to have as much variety as we would have liked. But thanks to you all I will be able to increase the variety of merchandise and give a better life to my parents.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Soy cabeza de familia y aunque soy joven me preocupo por brindar no solo comodidad y bienestar								
a mi familia, sino seguridad ya que es un elemento muy importante y esencial para el desarrollo de mi pequeño								
hijo y esposa. Ahora solicito su apoyo para podre colocar una barda en el patio de mi vivienda. Muchas 

gracias.
texts.en:
I am the head of my household, and although I am young I worry not only about providing comfort and well-being for my family, but security is very important as well, and essential for the progress of my young son and my wife. I'm now asking for your help to be able to put a wall around my yard. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around the yard of my home

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Mi familia es lo mas importante y como madre me preocupa dar lo mejor posible 							
a mis niñas ya que son menores de edad. 

Tengo la necesidad de poner Vitropiso en mi vivienda ya que aparte de 

dar mejor apariencia, es mas higienico y mis muebles se conservan mas limpios, no he podido hacerlo debido a 

que no he logrado juntar el dinero es por eso que ahora les solicito a ustedes el apoyo para poder llevar a 

cabo este proyecto de mejoramiento para mi vivienda.
texts.en:
My family is the most important thing for me and as a mother I'm concerned with giving the best to my young daughters. I need to put a ceramic tile floor in my home which, along with giving a better appearance, is more hygienic and my furniture will stay cleaner. I haven't been able to do it because I haven't been able to save the money. This is why I'm asking you all for help now, to be able to finally undertake my home improvement project.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing a ceramic tile floor

loans.name: Jose Rosel

texts.es:
José Rosel es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Santa Clara, una zona agrícola del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde muy joven en la agricultura, empezó apoyando a sus padres en las labores de cultivo y poco a poco fue aprendiendo del oficio, luego empezó a trabajar como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo vecinos y con los ahorros que guardaba de estas actividades pudo adquirir un campo de cultivo en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, gracias a estas actividades el ha podido solventar sus gastos y sacar adelante a su familia.

Adicionalmente también cría vacas y vende la leche que ellas producen a sus vecinos. Jose Rosel ha instalado en su terreno cultivo de maíz y desea brindarle mantenimiento con fertilizantes de modo que pueda desarrollarse de manera correcta y así pueda obtener una mejor producción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José Rosel es una persona honrada y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para sacar adelante a su familia. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas por lo que es considerado como un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
José Rosel is a 36-year-old father who lives together with his wife and three children in Santa Clara, an agricultural zone in the Pitipo district located in Ferreñafe province, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked from a very young age in agriculture. He began by supporting his parents in their own farming activities, and little by little learned the trade. Later he started working as an agricultural day laborer in his neighbors fields, and with his savings from this work he bought his own fields in which he plants all kinds of crops. Thanks to this, he has been able to pay off his debts and provide a good life for his family. He also raises cows and sells their milk to his neighbors. Jose Rosel has planted corn on his land, and would like to use the most up-to-date fertilizers to grow his crops more efficiently, to get a better harvest. This is why he has found it necessary to ask for a loan of $2000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Jose Rosel es an honorable and hard-working person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to continue providing a good life for his family. He has previously worked with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with his loan payments, and is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the costs of growing his corn (fertilizer, etc.)

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
No hay nada mas importante para mi que la familia, es el nucleo de nuestra sociedad sin contar que								
estan con uno en las buenas y las malas. Por eso quiero brindar a mi familia una casa en las mejores								
condiciones posibles. Es por eso que solicito su apoyo para colocar un piso de concreto en el portal de mi 

casa para evitar que se junte el agua cuando es temporada de lluvias.
texts.en:
There is nothing more important to me than family, the nucleus of our society, not to mention that they are with you through thick and thin. This is why I want to provide a house for my family, and in the best shape possible. This is why I am asking for your help to put a concrete floor in the entryway of my house, to avoid water pooling there during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing a concrete floor in house

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Soy propietario de una tienda de abarrotes, la vida me ha enseñado que no 

hay mejor forma de salir adelante mas que luchando y esforzándose día a día, yo lo hago junto con mi familia 

para tratar de tener mejores condiciones de vida.  

Les solicito apoyo para comprar mercancía y así poder tener mas ventas y por lo tanto mas ganancias
texts.en:
I am the owner of a grocery store. Life has taught me that there's no better way to get ahead than to struggle and push yourself day by day, which I do together with my family in order to try to improve our living situation. I'm asking you for help to be able to buy merchandise, which will help increase sales and, therefore, more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the grocery store

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Me gusta el negocio de la comida y quisiera seguir prosperando al tener mayor cantidad de materia								
prima. Gracias a ustedes esto podría ser posible, con su apoyo podre comprar mas productos para la 

elaboración de distintos platillos.

Dios bendiga su trabajo y a todas las personas detrás de esta noble empresa.
texts.en:
I like my business selling food and would like to continue developing it by purchasing a supply of staple ingredients. Thanks to you, this will be possible. With your help, I will be able to purchase what I need to make a variety of dishes. May God bless your work and everyone behind this noble organization.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beoun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Beoun K. is 62 years old, the leader of a group loan, and who was selected by the members, which consists of 4 people located in Samar village in Kandal province. The members of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mrs. Beoun K. is staying at home and taking care her children. Her husband, Mr. Naem Noeun, is a motorbike taxi driver who can earn a small income to support his family's living. Mrs. Beoun K. is now requesting for a loan to buy a Khmer trailer to support her husband's motorbike trailer transportation. This couple has three children; one is a construction worker while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a Khmer trailer

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
El Sr. A. D. Cesar Augusto de 27 años de edad vive con su conviviente Diana Huanaco Ramal ellos aun no tienen hijos. Viven en casa de su suegro en Psje. Horno Viejo – Parcona – Ica.

El es chofer de mototaxi (transporte) trabaja desde las 7:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm producto de su trabajo ha ido obteniendo sus bienes. 

Su esposa trabaja eventualmente por lo que no cuenta con ingresos fijos, ellos desean mas adelante tener casa propia y tener sus hijos para brindarle una estabilidad y seguridad.

Ambos son jóvenes con muchas ganas de superacion presenta buenas referencias de sus vecinos y solicitan el crédito para mejorar el ambiente donde habitan.
texts.en:
A. D. Cesar Augusto is 27 years old. He lives with his life partner, Diana Huanaco Ramal. They do not yet have children. They live in his in-law’s house in Psje. Horno Viejo – Parcona – Ica. He is a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle used for transportation) driver. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. As a result of his work, he has been acquiring his possessions. His wife works occasionally, so she does not have a fixed income. Later on they want to have their own house. They want to have children and provide them with stability and security. Both of these young people have a great desire to get ahead. They have good references from their neighbors. They are asking for a loan to improve the atmosphere where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve property
