loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S. is 32 years old and is the group leader of a loan. He was selected by 5 members who are located in Chrey Young village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose. Mrs. Sopheap S. is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Bol Kann, is a rice wine maker. With both businesses they can earn a small income to support their family's living. Mrs. Sopheap S. is now requesting a loan for pig food to support her pig breeding. This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and who also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people located in Sieng Kong village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vanna B. is the group leader of the loan who was selected by the members. The members of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mrs. Vanna B. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. For supporting this farm, Mrs. Vanna B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crops. Aside from bieng a farmer she also is a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mr. Sophat K., is a government worker. With these jobs they can receive a small salary to support their family's living. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra C. is 41 years-old. She was selected by the four members of the group located in Chanlork village in Kandal province as the leader. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their individual purposes.

 Mrs. Ra C. is a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support the family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it.  Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell. 

Mrs. Ra C. is a widow with three children.  One works as a seamstress in a garment factory, another a Khmer trailer taxi driver and the youngest is a student at the local school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Thara's Group

texts.en:
Four people located in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province are seeking a group loan. 

Mrs. Thara M. is 30 years-old and has been selected as the leader of the group loan by the other members. Each member of this loan will use it to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support various purposes. 

Mrs. Thara M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. For this farm, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her crops. Her husband, Mr. Borei Brak, is a construction worker who receives a small income to support the family. This couple have a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Voch Ngim

texts.en: Mrs. Voch Ngim N. is 37 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Andoung village in Kandal province. She is staying at home and take care of her child while her husband, Mr. Kimong Chav, is a cow middleman who can earn a small income to support their family's living. For her husband's business, Mrs. Voch Ngim N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch N. is 38 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Traeuy Troeng village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Uch N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crops. Her husband, Mr. Vin Pin, is a candy seller who can earn a small income to support his family's living. This couple has three children; one is a fishnet maker and the other two are attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Chanthorn

For this farm, Mrs. Chanthorn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Choeun Mom, is a fisherman who supports his family by a little income. This couple has two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom S. is 38 years old and is a villager who lives in Vihear village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Sarom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Thoa Chea, is employed in a garment factory where he can receive a little salary to support his family's living. This couple has five children; two are laborers and three are students who also support their mother with farming. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Khhoeun

She and her husband, Mr. Khoun Chon, are farmers who own 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Khhoeun R. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming crops. This couple has two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon A. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 35 years old. Marlon is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 60000 PHP during harvest season.

Marlon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marlon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mr. Thol M. is 60 years old, and he is a villager who lives in Ta Pech village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ya Phan, are farmers who own 1.40 hectares of land to cultivate rice for their family's living. In order to support this farm, Mr. Thol M. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine (for irrigation) to water plants. This couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the last one is a student in the local school. His wife is the picture with him.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine for irrigation

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Casalatan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresita is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector selling a variety of vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from vegetable vending. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

For this farm, Mrs. Sithorn O. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming crops. Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Sithorn O. is a fishnet maker. loans.name: Emelson

texts.en: Emelson P. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 34 years old. Emelson is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emelson raises crops. The main source of income for his business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emelson has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 75,000 Philippine pesos per harvest. Emelson said that his business really helps his family financially, thus he is very determined to continuously manage the said activity. In 2005, Emelson joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Emelson is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Emelson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

This couple has six children; one is a laborer while the other five are students who also support their parents with the farming.

Janeth B. is from the town of Sto.Niño. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Janeth owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 28 years now.

In 2008, Janeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Janeth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

Mr. Moa R. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support his farming. Mrs. Sithorn Kiet is also a silk weaver who earns a small income to support her family. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
"Farming is my passion," says Romeo M., who is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 54 years old, married and has one adult child. Romeo owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Romeo has been involved in his business for over 50 years and earns approximately 9,0000 PHP during harvest season. His income is really a great help in supporting his family's needs.

In 2005, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Romeo is requesting a new loan, his 5th, of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean M. is from the town of Sto.Niño. She is 55 years old, married and has 5 adult children. Jean owns & operates an agricultural business. She tills a 1.25 hectare rice field and harvests approximately 70 sacks of rice from it. She also raises some pigs and hopes for her new venture to grow. Jean has been involved in farming for over 40 years.

In 2008, Jean joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and pigfeed. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jean from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mrs. Ann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fish food to support her husband's business. This couple has four children; two are students and two are too young to study or work.

53-year-old Jennebby P. is from the town of Sto Niño. She is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Jennebby owns and operates a business raising crops. She owns 3 hectares of rice field and harvests 80 sacks of rice per hectare. She also owns a hectare of coconut field. Jennebby has been engaged in her business for over 12 years now.

In 2008, she joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennebby has successfully repaid a previous loan from the MFI. Jennebby is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan she has taken out from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She currently has a half-hectare rice field and also raises two pigs. She hopes to expand her business to earn a better income. She also dreams that all her children will be able to finish college.
In 2008, Jessica joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and feed for her pigs. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam P., 25, lives with his wife and four-year-old daughter in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent) in a rented yard. His wife, Nyamtsetseg, is pregnant and currently staying at home.
During the day, Baljinnyam operates a transportation business in his town with a truck that he purchased in 2009. Before he purchased the truck, Baljinnyam cooperated with his brother and worked as a assistant driver for him, gaining valuable experience during that time. In the future, he plans to use his business profits to purchase his own plot of land with a yard. Baljinnyam is a very hardworking man who has been working hard to provide a better life for his wife, daughter and new baby. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay off the truck that he purchased for his business.

loans.use: To pay off his truck

loans.name: Josephine

Josephine L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. loans.name: Buhchuluun

texts.en:
Buhchuluun T. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent). Two of his children attend a local secondary school and one is a university student.
Buhchuluun operates a meat-trading business in his town with his wife's help. In his business, his wife sells the meat. Buhchuluun and his wife have been operating this business since 1990, and have gained significant experience over the past 20 years. In addition, Buhchuluun works in Shim Us LLC. During his holidays, he collects meat from the countryside at wholesales price and resells them for a profit. With his business profit, he has been paying his eldest child's university fees. Buhchuluun is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat from the countryside to sell to his many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine C. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Josephine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine plants and harvests corn for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $1035 during harvest season. She said that in farming patience and hard work is really needed to have a bountiful yield.

In 2005, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

In 2010, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: cliente FELIX Q. Q.,es casado tiene hijos mayores,independientes,tiene casa propia en Cañete que ha ido construyendo poco a poco con ingresos propios, actualmente se dedica a la actividad de renovadora de calzados en kiosko alquilado en la calle LA MAR Nº221, del cercado de ica, tiene experiencia en el negocio hace 8 años, empezó trabajando en una empresa y luego se independizó con un capital de s/ 1 300 trabajando 12 horas diarias su objetivos es tener mas renovadoras con empleados encargados.
texts.en:
Felix Q. Q. is married, and he has grown, independent children. He has his own house in Cañete. He has been building it little by little with his own income. He currently repairs shoes in a rented kiosk on La Mar Street N°221 in the Ica district. He has eight years of experience in the business. He started working for a company, and then he used 1,300 PEN to become independent. He works 12 hours a day. His objective is to have more repair shops with employees in charge.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita P. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 31 years old. Lolita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she provides recycling services. She hauls plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $188 a month for these activities.

In 2007, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Erma is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

To make a living, Mirasol owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mirasol from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Hajera Group

texts.en: Wajya is the group leader of Hajera group. She is married. Her son, who is 25, owns a burger and ice cream shop where he works hard in all seasons – although he cannot sell ice cream in winter. Instead, he sells some extra Afghani food then. Wajya wants to take a loan for her son’s business as he wants to expand his business and buy the essential things related to it, such as good quality milk, meat, bread and so on. He hopes to support his family in a better way and make good progress.

loans.use: To expand the business and buy essential food items for it

loans.name: Izat

texts.ru: Джураева Изат проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 56 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Дети в России на заработках. Сама Изат имеет среднее образование. После того как мужа не стала она занялась животноводством. Изат откармливает и продает крупно - рогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Izat D. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 56 year sold. She is a widow and has five children. They are now working in Russia. Izat has secondary education. After he husband passed away she started doing animal husbandry. Izat feeds and sells large cattle. She has been in this business for more than five years. She is taking out the loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mamodiyarova's Group

texts.en:
Mamodiyarova S. is the leader of this group. She is 57 years old and a widow. Her eldest son is married and lives with his family. Her two grandchildren, aged 9 and 11, are at school. S. is a pensioner, so her son is the one who is engaged in business. At the moment, they are preparing for the sowing process. With her loan, S. is going to purchase fuel and seed potatoes, which are needed for farming. In this way, she hopes to save money for her son's wedding, which is in the autumn.
Kadyrkulova M. is 52 and the group's treasurer. She has raised two daughters and a son. Both daughters are students and her son is married and lives and works in Bishkek. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to make money, M. bought three sheep for 6000 KGS a year ago and sold them for 9300 KGS. M. has one hectare of land, which she wants to sow, so she is requesting a loan to buy fuel and seed potatoes.
Keldibek uulu R. is 29 and has a wife and two children. His wife works as a teacher and both children are preschool age, so R.'s wife is on maternity leave. Now, R. is preparing for the sowing process. With his loan, he will buy seed potatoes and fuel.
Kemelova S. is 56 and married. Her husband is a pensioner and works in cattle breeding. They have a 19-year-old daughter who is a student. They also have grandchildren who go to school. S. wants a loan to buy fuel and seed potatoes (they have one hectare of land, which they want to sow).

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and seed potatoes

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Хусайнова Дилбар проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж, на заработках в России. Сама Дилбар занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 3 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.

She has a small cow house where she breeds cattle. She has been in this business for more than three years. She is taking out the loan to buy small cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

texts.en: Amam J. is the group leader of Parigull Amam J. group. He is 45 years old and lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. Amam J. owns a car parts shop. He needs some tools for his shop. He wants to make the shop larger and buy the required supplies. He would like to make his business much bigger. He is confident that, with his loan, he can increase his business.

loans.use: To purchase some tools for his shop

loans.name: Bazar

texts.ru: Бердикулов Базар проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование - высшее, "Педагог". По специальности проработал более 12 лет. Сейчас клиент занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Bazar B. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 38 years old. He is married and has five children. He has high education in teaching. He has worked in his profession for more than twelve years. Right now he is in trade. He has a store where he sells groceries. He has been in this business for already five years. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Ostadan-E-Golly Maasjed Group

texts.en: This is the Ostadan-e-Golly Maasjed group. The group leader is Raysa, who is 54 years old, married, and lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Raysa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new sewing machine in order to sew good quality clothes and gain lots of new customers for her business. She has requested a loan for this purpose. Raysa is very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan, and thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Бобиева Шамигул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Сын, на заработках в России. Сама Шамигул не имеет высшее образование. texts.en:
Shamigul B. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 42 years old. She is a widow and has four children. Her son works in Russia. Shamigul has high education. After her husband's death she started doing agriculture. At home she has a plot of land where she sows vegetables for resale. She has been in this business for seven years now. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en:
Petra R. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 30 years old. Petra is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Petra is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Petra owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Petra has been in business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Petra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Petra from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Bazaroy

texts.ru: Тагайкулова Базарой проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 40 лет. Разведена, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное. Работает учительницей в средней школе. Concurrently, Bazaroy is involved in animal husbandry. She breeds livestock at home. She is primarily involved in buying and selling cattle and has been in this business for over 20 years. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Yolanda

Yolanda D. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 56 years old. Yolanda is widowed and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a food stall, tending a canteen in the community. Yolanda has been in business for more than eight years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees her children.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
