loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new shop and some essential cosmetics

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She is married and has five children. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years. 
Naseem and her husband are very hard working people. They handle their dairy business. They get early in the morning and get milk from their dairy cows and then her husband goes to the milk shops for selling it. They have been in this work for over ten years.  
Their elder son is 26-years old and operates his own barber shop in the community where does hairdressing and facial treatments for his customers. His clientele base is limited to males. He has been in this profession for the past five years. 
Naseem is a regular client of Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). She has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time to invest in capital for her son’s barber shop. This loan will allow him to purchase the required items for his shop (such as chairs, mirror and facial creams) and to expand to its business.

loans.use: To purchase items for barber shop.

loans.name: Lyroche

texts.en:
Lyroche F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Lyroche is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lyroche owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lyroche has been engaged in her business for over 7 years already.

In 2009, Lyroche joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lyroche has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lyroche is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lyroche from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Ulfat Rani's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat rani is a wife of Y. M. and they live in a city named Borewala, (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small two-roomed house that she has been living in with her family for over 15 years. She is a mother of two sons. Her elder son works in a factory on monthly wage. The younger one is a motor mechanic and works in a motor workshop. Her husband is a driver, by profession. He drives his own vehicle named “Shahzore” which he uses for delivering different item, such as fruits & vegetables, from one place to another. He has been in this profession for the past ten years.  

Ulfat is a caring mother and a caring wife. She stays at home and manages the household work. She also cooks delicious food for her family. 
She has successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. Now she is applying again for a loan for her husband so he can repair his vehicle and it will be in working condition.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle named "Shahzore".

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 58 years old, married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Magdalena owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Magdalena has been engaged in farming for over 40 years. She also started raising pigs recently. She has 2 pigs as of now and hopes to acquire more pigs to raise.

In 2008, Magdalena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and hopefully piglets and feeds. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Magdalena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Virgilia's Group

texts.en:
Virgilia B. is from the town of Cauacan Capirpiriwan Cordon. She is 48 years old. Virgilia is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Virgilia B. Group.

Virgilia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Virgilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virgilia has been in business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virgilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flower pots and nets

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn B. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 26 years old. Genalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Genalyn owns and operates a business preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Genalyn has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Genalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Genalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nashon Odwuor

texts.en:
Nashon Odwuor O. is a businessman who sells rice in Migori town. He is also a matatu driver. While he is away driving, he leaves his wife behind to manage the rice business for him. He buys his stock in Sirare Migori twice a week, in small quantities, but due to the rising demand, he wants to start purchasing his stock in bulk.

He would like to get a loan worth KES10,000 to increase his stock that will boost his business. He is 30 years old, married man and a father of three (3) children. He lives with his family in Migori, Kenya.

loans.use: To increase stock to boost the business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
From the town of Sto. Niño, 41-year-old Milagrosa E., a married mother of three school-aged children, earns her living by raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also owns a hectare of land upon which she cultivates rice. Milagrosa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years now.

In 2008, Milagrosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 15000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. Milagrosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy some essential materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction equipment

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Рачабов Нуриддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Нуриддин более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет большой земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Nuriddin R. lives in the Yavan district. He is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Nuriddin has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He has a large plot of land, where he grows wheat and vegetables. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a wife of A. S. and she lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for over 30 years. She is a mother of three sons. All of her sons are very hardworking. Her first two sons are involved in her husband’s timber selling business. The younger son is very intelligent and spends most of his time studying. He reads in 6th standard and has an ambition to become a doctor. 
Razia is a caring lady. She stays at home to manage the household chores and to cook food for her family. She also prepares the animal food. She receives orders from her neighbors and generates an income. She manages her house and work simultaneously and never receives any complaint from her neighbors or from her family. 

She has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase timber in bulk and sell it in the community. 

Note: "In this picture she is showing the cutter which helps her to prepare the animal food".

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J., 53 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She says that her 1.5 hectares of rice field can produce 130 sacks of rice. Norma has been engaged in farming for over 30 years now and she hopes for her business to grow.

In 2008, Norma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Norma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: David Ondiek

texts.en:
David Ondiek O., 51 years old, married and blessed with 10 children, lives in Migori Kenya where he owns a tailoring shop, a business that he started in 1978 to generate additional income for his family. David says that he works extra hard to make sure that all of his family's basic needs are met.

Having met other members of the KMET–KIVA loan program, he decided to join in order to expand his business and develop financially as he prepares to send some of his children in college. To meet these objectives, David is requesting a loan of Ksh.30000 to increase his business stock.

loans.use: To increase his business stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B., from the town of Sto. Niño, is married and the mother of six grown children. To make a living, Rebecca plants and harvests rice to sell, a business she has operated for over 30 years now.

In 2008, Rebecca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new one, her sixth, of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rebecca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Сафаров Абдурахим проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Абдурахим более 6 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин со смешенным ассортиментом. Он привозит товар из города Душанбе.  Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Abdurahim S. lives in the Yavan district. He is 38 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is involved in household work. Abdurahim has been involved in retail sales for over 6 years. He has a store that carries various merchandise. He brings his merchandise from the city of Dushanbe. He is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of A. G. and the mother of a five-year-old son in 2nd standard and a seven-year-old daughter in 4th standard . She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 10 years.

A very caring and active lady, Shahnaz operates a livestock business, raising and then selling the animals to her neighbors. Her business provides major support to her family. Her husband, meanwhile, sells fruit on his four-wheeled cart by going to various areas of the community, an enterprise he has been operating for over six years. Shahnaz is now requesting a loan from Asasah so her husband can purchase seasonal fruits in bulk and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina. a married mother of two grown children, works at a small market in Zaporozhye, selling clothing and bed shirts, a successful business she has operated for 10 years. Valentina enjoys it very much, her kindness, experience and openness attracting many clients to her kiosk. She would now like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her assortment of bed shirts, hoping to earn additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of bed shirts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads to make different kinds of purses and bags for women.

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru: Абдиназаров Гулмурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование - среднее. Более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Gulmurod A. lives in the Yavan district. He is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a secondary education. Gulmurod has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He primarily breeds and sells livestock. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 52 years old. Remedios is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. She raises pigs for breeding. She also owns 2 hectares of rice field, which her husband mainly manages. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 28 years.

In 2008, Remedios joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She also plans to buy farm inputs for the rice farm. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Remedios from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Phestus Ragga

texts.en:
Phestus Ragga O. operates a tailoring business in Migori town in Kenya. Besides that, he is also a driver who operates along Kisumu Migori route. With the dream of buying his own Matatu vehicle, Phestus wants to expand his business so that his income can increase with enough profit to be able to save. He wishes to get a loan of KES 30,000, which will be used to boost his tailoring business.

He is 30 years old, a husband, and a father of five children.

loans.use: To increase stock for his tailoring business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar is a wife of A. M. and lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has been living for the past 20 years.
Naseem Akhtar has three daughters, all of whom are free and do household chores. Naseem wishes to send her daughters to school so that they get a good education and have a bright future. She operates a business sewing clothes. She does this work to save money so she might be able to enrol her daughters in school.
Naseem's husband is a tailor and runs a tailoring center in the community where he specifically sews gentlemen's clothes. He has been in this profession for ten years. Naseem has successfully repaid two loans to Kiva partner, Asasah. With the profits from her loans, she bought a color television and a fridge. Now she is applying for a new loan to purchase an electric sewing machine for her husband’s tailoring center so that he can sew more clothes and increase his profit.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for her husband's business

loans.name: Sonunkan's Group

texts.en:
Sonunkan T. is the leader of this group. She is 57 years old and a widow. Sonunkan has raised five children – they are married and live separately with their families, except the youngest son. Sonunkan has been engaged in cattle breeding for 16 years, and her youngest son is the only one who helps her. She has been increasing slowly the number of cattle she owns. Her cattle-breeding success made it possible for her to buy a brick factory. Sonunkan is requesting a loan to purchase two small cattle in order to increase her number of livestock. In this way, she hopes to save money for her son's wedding.
Zamira N. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 and divorced. Zamira raised two daughters and two sons. The older son is 25 and he helps his mother in her business. The other children are students. After her divorce 13 years ago, Zamira's brother helped her with money, and with 5,000 KGS of initial investment she began to sell DVDs, tapes and clothes. At the moment, her monthly profit is 25,000 KGS. Thanks to this activity she was able to buy a house. Zamira is requesting a loan to purchase different seeds in order to resell them to make some money. In the future, she wishes to buy a pavilion, increase her turnover, and save money for the marriage of her older son.
Akbara A. is 35 and a widow. She has a son and daughter, both of whom study at school. Seven years ago, Akbara sold a cow for 10,000 KGS and with this money she started to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. Now she makes 20,000 KGS per month, which enabled her to build a house and buy a vehicle. Akbara is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables in order to resell them.
Kenzhekan K. is 36 and divorced. She has two daughters, both of whom are students. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 4,000 KGS, Kenzhekan began to sell lottery tickets. Now she earns 10,000 KGS per month, making it possible for her to buy a flat and furniture. Kenzhekan is requesting a loan to buy 150 lottery tickets.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl C. is 24 years old and from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Rezyl owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting rice and selling her harvest. Recently, she also started raising pigs and she hopes to acquire more pigs to raise. One of her goals is to save for her children's education.
In 2008, Rezyl joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rezyl is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also additional piglets and feed. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, plus piglets and feed

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married to a taxi driver. They have seven children and all their children go to school. Aisha doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a poultry farm in Kawempe Kiyini zone, Kawempe division, Kampala district.

She has been a poultry farmer for over 20 years. Aisha wants to use this loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed. She works from her home. Her customers are nearby shops and chicken roasters from Kawempe and Bwaise market. She rears both broilers and layers and her farm consists of 300 chickens. Aisha works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include poultry diseases and transportation of feed from Mengo Kisenyi to her home in Kawempe. Her goals and aspirations are to own 700 chickens and to educate her children up to university. 

Aisha decided to work with MCDT because they were charging low interest rates compared to other MFIs. She resides in and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Aisha‘s monthly expenses includes paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Shanthilatha

texts.en:
Shanthilatha is a 47-year-old married woman living in the Kekanadura area of Matara, Sri Lanka. She has five children (two sons and three daughters). Her husband is a driver.

Shanthilatha helps her son manage a business sewing cushion covers for vehicle seats and covers for three wheel rickshaws (Tuk-Tuks). They have worked together for four years with this business.

Shanthilatha has requested a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy materials for cushion covers

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rochelle owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her 1.75 hectares of rice field produce almost 200 sacks of rice. Rochelle has been engaged in her business for over six years now.
In 2008, Rochelle joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rochelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Gull Begam Husin Group

texts.en: A. Manan is the group leader of Gull Begam H. group. He is 54 years old, married, and has six children who are all in school. He wants to take a loan for his vegetable-selling business and his shop. A. Manan is busy working seven days of the week. He dreams of making progress in his business and being successful. He has full familiarity with this business because he worked with his father from childhood. He is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, which are in demand a lot in the market. He is glad that through this process he can improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Kostyantin

texts.en:
Konstantin is married, has two children, and owns a shoe store at Jubilee Market in the town of Zaporozhye. He started this business eight years ago, and his outstanding collection of goods and excellent customer service have made his store a success. He is delighted with the outcome of his work because he enjoys selling shoes very much. 

Konstantin has applied for a loan for 15,000 UAH to buy new seasonal inventories. He goals are to develop this business further and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy a new supply of shoes to sell to his customers

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas S. lives in the town of Sto. Niño. He is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. He makes a living by growing rice on his three-hectare farm. He sells his rice in the local market, and also supplements his income by raising pigs. He has been in these lines of work for more than 16 years.

In 2008, Tomas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid five previous loans from CEVI, and is now applying for a new one for 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and feeds for his pigs. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Beatriz's Group

texts.en:
Beatriz M. is from the town of San Antonio Ramon, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Beatriz is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Beatriz M. Group.

Beatriz is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a business in a retail sector managing a vegetable vending business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables through house to house in their town. Beatriz has been in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month .

In 2009, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Beatriz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock for her catering business.

loans.name: Vanessa Jireh

texts.en:
Vanessa Jireh C. lives in the town of Sto. Niño. She is 20 years old and has a one-year-old child. She and her husband Joemar have been married for a year, and she makes a living as a farmer. She has been in this line of work for more than two years, and sells her produce in the local market. 

Last year, Vanessa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from CEVI, and is now applying for a new loan for 12,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use on her farm

loans.name: Evangeline's Group

texts.en:
Evangeline V. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 32 years old. Evangeline is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Evangeline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Evangeline has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married to an electrical engineer and they have one child. Her child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Agnes owns a stall in Nakulabye selling second hand clothes.  She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years. Besides this clothing business, she also sells soft drinks, like soda, passion juice, and water, cakes and bans of bread.   Agnes sells at retail only and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Agnes’ business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She hopes to build her own house, expand her clothing business and start importing the clothing. She joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and rents a two-room house. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana is divorced and has one child. For the last seven years, she has made a living selling women's tights at a small local market. Low prices and a large assortment of goods have made her business a success. Oksana would like to increase her sales by buying additional items to sell to her customers in the summer season, and has applied for a loan to make this possible. Her long-term goal is to open a second location at which she will be able to sell her goods.

loans.use: to buy more tights to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita A. lives in the town of Banga. She is 61 years old, married and has ten adult-aged children. She makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice. She has been in this line of work for more than 40 years, and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Nelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Now she is applying for a loan, her first, for 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is widowed. She owns a retail business selling various agricultural products like seeds, fertilizers, bug killers, etc. Tatyana has a large assortment of products, affordable prices and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Tatyana has been in this business for 17 years. The business is seasonal and items sell mostly in spring and summer. In this particular area, many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Tatyana's business is very useful to them.

Tatyana would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories like seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to develop her business even more and have more clients who would use her services.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: 16-01-01Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Thức T. Thị (3) is a 56-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Thức is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 01- Đông Hải (16.01.01Đông Hải).


Thức is married and has four adult children.  To make a living, Thức owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale.  Thức has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Thức joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thức has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Thức from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thức plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Đào (9) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Đỗ Thị Lợi (24) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  N. Thị Đàn (33) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business ioperating a specialized retail store.


4.  T. Thị Xanh (4) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her  fishing business.


5.  Lê Thị Hường (5) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thức T. Thị (3) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thức là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01- Đông Hải (16.01.01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Thức thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thức kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND.  Vào 2004, Thức đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thức đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Đào (9) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Đỗ Thị Lợi (24) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. Thị Đàn (33) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  T. Thị Xanh (4) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  Lê Thị Hường (5) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase chickens to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Parenda Group

texts.en:
Toryali is a member of Parenda group. He lives in district 1st of Kabul Afghanistan. He is a young boy of 25 and single, but still he feels lots of responsibility for his family members. He lives in a household of with five iother members: his father, mother and three sisters. 

He has an ice cream shop with lots of clients. He needs the loan to purchase good quality milk to make ice cream and to attract more new clients.

He is glad that he can progress through the loan and hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy more milk

loans.name: Hajarah

texts.en: Hajarah is married to a trader and they have six children. Only two children go to school. Hajarah also takes care of her old mother. Hajarah deals in cattle and buys the cattle from  villages of Ngoma and Nakasongola.  She wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more cattle for resale. She sells cattle to meat packers and Kmapala city abbatoir and the rest to bucheries in Kawempe. She works two days a week.  Hajarah doesn’t have any other side business. Hajarah has been in this business for two  years and with MCDT for seven years. Her business challenges include transportation, thievesand ever increasing prices of cattle.  She is aspiring of owning a delivery van. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was charging low interest compared to other MFIs in the area.  Hajarah resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she stays with eight people.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Hajara's biggest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru: Кузибоев Ашур проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ашур занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает мелко - рогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 22 года. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Ashur K. lives in the Yavan district. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Ashur is involved in animal husbandry. He fattens and sells small livestock. He has been involved in this business for 22 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is married and has two adult sons. She sells clothing at the local open market. Ludmila has been in this business for 10 years. Good variety and affordable prices attract many clients to her kiosk. Large experience helps her to choose the right goods that sell well. Ludmila is a very enthusiastic and happy person. She enjoys being in sales and dreams of opening a small shop in her town. Ludmila would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Fardin Group

texts.en:
Nasir Ahmad is the group leader of Fardin group. He is 45, married and living in a family of 7 members. He and his family members are residents of the 16th district of Kabul Afghanistan. He is a tinsmith and can produce different kinds of things in his shop such as heaters, bags, pots and so on. 
He needs the loan to rent a new shop next to his old one and to expand his business. He is glad that has this opportunity to go ahead and be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: To rent another shop

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en: Rhona is married with six children and all her children go to school. Rhona doesn’t take care of additional family members. Rhona sells charcoal and buys this charcoal from the villages of Luwero. She uses public transport to and from shopping. She wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal.  Rhona has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for 12 years. Besides this charcoal business, she also lays and sells bricks. Rhona sells from her home. She sells at wholesale and at retail and works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation of charcoal from villages to her home and seasonality. Rhona is aspiring to sell at wholesale only.  She joined MCDT because it was working with poor women in groups. She resides in and owns a six-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, paying utility bills, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk town. Her monthly profit is 2,000 UAH. Olga has been in this business for 10 years. She has learned that to be successful, she needs to have a large variety of items and very good service. Olga feels this is something she can do well. 

Olga would like to borrow 3,300 UAH to increase her inventory. Olga is not married and does not have children.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Toirsho

texts.ru: Урозов Тоиршо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее, "Педагог". По профессии проработал 4 года. Сейчас занимается торговлей. Открыл торговую точку возле дома. Продает продукты питания и необходимые вещи хозяйству. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Toirsho U. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a higher education as a teacher. He spent 4 years working in that profession and is now involved in retail sales. Toirsho opened a retail outlet near his home. He sells food products and essential household goods. He has been in this business for 6 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old engaged man living with his parents. He's an experienced hairdresser with four years of experience. In 2006, he opened his own barbershop in his hometown. Mohammad provides services to a wide range of clientele in the village and its neighborhoods. 

Today, Mohammad wishes to improve his shop, but he will mainly use the loan to furnish his home. In order to do so, he is requesting a $1,300 loan. This is his second loan; he reimbursed his last loan on time. With his previous loan, he was able to increase his merchandise, such as shampoos, gels, sprays, etc.

loans.use: To improve his shop and furnish his home

loans.name: Wadii

texts.en:
Wadii is a 55-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and child. Fifty-five years ago, he decided to open a mini-market in his town after seeing a need for such services in the region. He sells canned food, bread, dairy items, candies, chips, soft drinks and also fruits and vegetables. His mini-market is well known in his region because of his good reputation, welcoming attitude and also because he has competitive prices. This allows him to have a growing number of customers pass by his shop and buy all types of food products. 

Today, Wadii is requesting to borrow $2,000 to increase his purchases of such items as food products, soft drinks, juices, etc., to increase his sales and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To increase his purchases

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en: Lukia is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Lukia sells new and used clothes and sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes. Lukia uses public transport to and from shopping and does her shopping twice a week.  She buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city. Lukia works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her. Her goals and aspirations include getting a permanent business premise and importing clothes.  Lukia resides in and owns a three-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes
